column2: This ruler's Permanent Regent has recently gained or lost power.
This ruler's Permanent Regent has forced them into secluded meditation for the time being, completely preventing any interference in government affairs.
The Permanent Regent has forced this character off the council
Due to a failed attempt to end the Permanent Regency this ruler is unable to govern at present.
Father is from the Imperial Family
Does not approve of female rulers
Would be the heir under Primogeniture
Mother is from the Imperial Family
Would not be a good figurehead
Change to the Japanese Bureaucracy government type
Though some would find a bureaucratic government unnecessarily restrictive, perhaps there is some wisdom in governing in a more bureaucratic fashion.
Change to the Japanese Feudal government type
Though perhaps not a government that would appeal to everyone, a feudal government would be rather fitting for a warrior at least.
Change to the Japanese Monastic Feudal government type
Though some would frown on temporal and spiritual power held by the same individual, those that truly belive in the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith would quite possibly find it only natural.
Though possession of the Chrysanthemum Throne naturally implies being the lawful ruler of Japan there are those that only would accept this as the truth if certain specific steps are taken...
The traditional capital of Japan is of course located in Yamashiro, but right now the official capital is not. Taking steps to correct this inconsistency would be a good idea.

Japan needs a proper capital, and there is a promising site for one in Yamashiro. I should allocate the necessary funds and proclaim the founding of a capital, and the beginning of a new period of Japanese history.
The county of Yamashiro becomes the capital.
Though not part of the Eight Great Islands of Japan, the island of Ezo surely belongs to the Rising Sun...
Though not part of the Eight Great Islands of Japa, the Ryukyuan Islands surely belong to the Rising Sun...
The Kingdom of Ezo has no holder, is held by you, or is held by a vassal with an appropriate government type of yours
The Kingdom of Ryukyu has no holder, is held by you, or is held by a vassal with an appropriate government type of yours
As the Permanent Regent I can take some of my liege's wealth to spend as I desire, as long as I claim it is for the good of the realm.

If it is of critical importance that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] does not interfere with the Permanent Regency I can take steps to ensure that [Root.Liege.GetSheHe] is unable to do so. I cannot do this too frequently, however.
Perhaps the time has come for my authority as [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent to be expanded even further.
My Permanent Regent has far too much authority. If ending the Permanent Regency outright is not currently an option, perhaps I could at least reduce [Root.Regent.GetHerHis] authority somewhat.

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.

Inform your Permanent Regent that you wish for the Permanent Regency to end, and that you are prepared to use force of arms to compel [Root.Regent.GetHerHim] to step aside if [Root.Regent.GetSheHe] does not do so willingly.
With there being no Permanent Regent, it is clear that there can be no Permanent Regency.

As the Permanent Regent it would only be right and proper to make sure that [Root.GetBestName] is married to someone from my dynasty, and this would perhaps help ensure that [Root.GetHerHis] heir is more likely to listen to me or my successor.
I can order [Root.GetBestName] released from [From.Liege.GetBestName]'s prison using my authority as the Permanent Regent.
I can order [Root.GetBestName] executed using my authority as the Permanent Regent. However, everyone would know that it was my decision, so I should not do this carelessly....
It would perhaps be in my interest to ensure that [Root.GetBestName] no longer serves on [From.Liege.GetBestName]'s council. As Permanent Regent, I can easily get [Root.GetHerHim] fired.
As the Permanent Regent I can transfer a vassal from my liege if I think it would benefit the realm.
As the Permanent Regent I can transfer a vassal from my liege if I think it would benefit the realm.
As the Shogun I can transfer a vassal from the Tenno or the Tenno's Permanent Regent if I think the realm would benefit from this.
As the Shogun I can transfer a vassal from the Tenno or the Tenno's Permanent Regent if I think the realm would benefit from this.
As the Shogun's Permanent Regent I can transfer a vassal from the Tenno or the Tenno's Permanent Regent if I think the realm would benefit from this.
As the Shogun's Permanent Regent I can transfer a vassal from the Tenno or the Tenno's Permanent Regent if I think the realm would benefit from this.
There needs to be a new ruler on the Chrysanthemum Throne. Perhaps [Root.GetBestName] is the [Root.GetManWoman] for the job...
I had intended to put [Root.GetBestName] on the Chrysanthemum Throne, but perhaps [Root.GetSheHe] is not the [Root.GetManWoman] for the job any longer...
I can choose to grant [Root.GetFirstName] the Minamoto surname, removing [Root.GetHerHim] from the Imperial Family.
I can choose to grant [Root.GetFirstName] the Taira surname, removing [Root.GetHerHim] from the Imperial Family.

Though not currently a part of the Imperial Family, [Root.GetBestName] can trace [Root.GetHerHis] patrilineal ancestry all the way back to Tenno Jimmu. Perhaps [Root.GetSheHe] deserves the rare honor of being restored to the Imperial Family.
[Root.GetBestName] patrilineal ancestors are all either deceased or members of the Imperial Family.
All deceased patrilineal ancestors that are not part of the Imperial Family also get restored.
As [Root.Owner.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName], should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As [Root.Owner.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName], should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As [Root.Owner.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName], should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName] or [Root.Owner.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent, should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName] or [Root.Owner.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent, should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName], should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Permanent Regent for the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName] or [Root.Owner.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent, should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Permanent Regent for the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName] or [Root.Owner.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent, should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
As the Permanent Regent for the Shogun I can easily transfer a title from [Root.Owner.GetBestName], should I think this is in the interest of the realm.
[Root.Liege.Regent.GetBestName] is unfit to serve as [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent, and all can see it. Take the final steps necessary to become the new Permanent Regent.
[Root.Liege.Regent.GetBestName] is unfit to serve as [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent, and all can see it. Take the final steps necessary to become the new Permanent Regent.
[Root.Liege.Regent.GetBestName] is unfit to serve as [Root.Liege.GetBestName]'s Permanent Regent, and all can see it. Take the final steps necessary to become the new Permanent Regent.
Demand that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] makes you [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent and that you are put in charge of all affairs of state.
Demand that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] makes you [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent and that you are put in charge of all affairs of state.
Demand that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] makes you [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] Permanent Regent and that you are put in charge of all affairs of state.

[Root.GetBestName] can demand to be named Shogun when [Root.GetSheHe] and [Root.GetHerHis] supporters feel confident that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] will agree to the demand... or that they can put someone else on the Chrysanthemum Throne that would agree to this demand.
Demand and end to the Shogunate
[Root.GetBestName] can demand that the Shogun steps aside and the restoration of Imperial rule when [Root.GetSheHe] and [Root.GetHerHis] followers are ready to make their move.
The current holder of the Chrysanthemum Throne abdicates to another member of the Imperial Family
The current Permanent Regent is unfit to serve as the Permanent Regent at present. As a result, [From.GetBestName] seeks to become the new Permanent Regent.
The current Permanent Regent is unfit to serve as the Permanent Regent at present. As a result, [From.GetBestName] seeks to become the new Permanent Regent.
The current Permanent Regent is unfit to serve as the Permanent Regent at present. As a result, [From.GetBestName] seeks to become the new Permanent Regent.
We can declare war on the Permanent Regent to take control of the Permanent Regency
We can declare war on the Permanent Regent to take control of the Permanent Regency
We can declare war on the Permanent Regent to take control of the Permanent Regency
War to End the Permanent Regency
$ATTACKER$'s $ORDER$ War to End the Permanent Regency
War to Maintain the Permanent Regency
$DEFENDER$'s $ORDER$ War to Maintain the Permanent Regency
As a member of the Imperial Family, I can attempt to seize the Chrysanthemum Throne

[Root.GetBestName] can demand that [Root.Liege.GetBestName] steps aside in favor of another member of the Imperial Family if [Root.GetSheHe] thinks [Root.GetSheHe] and [Root.GetHerHis] backers can prevail.
[FromFrom.GetBestName] holds land elsewhere in the realm
[FromFrom.GetBestName] is the heir to an unrelated title
Sacrilege like this cannot be permitted!
The Permanent Regent would not approve
[FromFrom.GetBestName] holds land elsewhere in the realm
[FromFrom.GetBestName] is the heir to an unrelated title
Will create a new Grand Chancellor bloodline
[This.GetBestName] wishes to ensure [This.GetHerHis] dynasty can be the power behind the throne by becoming Grand Chancellor.
The decision to create a Grand Chancellor bloodline has been taken
With sufficient support it will be impossible for anyone to deny that you are the Grand Chancellor.
Ask [Root.GetBestName] to support you as Grand Chancellor.
Ask [Root.GetBestName] to give you [Root.GetHerHis] spot on the council.
Demand that [Root.GetBestName] switches to your current voting pattern.
Recently requested support as Grand Chancellor
This character is required to be a Loyalist at the moment
This character is required to be a Pragmatist at the moment
This character is required to be a Glory Hound at the moment
This character is required to be a Zealot at the moment
This character is required to be a Loyalist at the moment

§GCan pressure another councillor to adopt their voting pattern§!

§GCannot be fired from the council normally§!
Asked me to change my voting pattern
Asked me to support them as Grand Chancellor
Asked me to give them my spot on the council
Is a member of a Chinese Imperial bloodline or holds a kingdom-tier title
[Root.TopLiege.GetBestName]'s claim to possess the Mandate of Heaven is not as solid at it might be, and perhaps it is time for a new dynasty to rise...
Attempt to claim your liege's imperial title, and with it the Mandate of Heaven
75 % of your Council Eunuchs need to not be Malcontent
The Council Eunuchs are not in control of this regiment
All held king- and emperor-tier titles will use Chinese Succession
It is clear I could do more for the realm as Grand Chancellor, but this would require further privileges.
It is clear to every vassal that the [Root.Liege.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven should impose fewer restrictions on [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] subjects, for the good of the realm.

Certain elements at court are far too influential. With the help of one of my vassals this problem could be dealt with in a permanent fashion... though the vassal assisting me would expect considerable authority in return.

Certain elements at the [Root.Liege.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven's court are far too powerful. I could deal with them for [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] in a permanent fashion... and I could easily gain considerable authority in return.
There is only one true [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, and [Root.GetSheHe] possesses the Mandate of Heaven. Perhaps I am the true [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven..
Holds at least one king-tier title that either is a de jure vassal of China or that has a capital in the China region.

Personally travel to the court of [Root.GetTitledName] to show your subservience.
This will cost you prestige depending on your tier, but will award you with some Grace.
The amount of Grace gained will depend on your actions at the court of [Root.GetTitledName].
This will result in a regency until you return.
A journey to China can be beneficial, particularly if [Root.GetTitledName] likes you, but might also be dangerous, particularly if [Root.GetTitledName] does not like you.

Offer the Dragon Throne a gift of gold in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetSheHe] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer the Dragon Throne a gift of gold in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetSheHe] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer to become a tributary of the Dragon Throne. This will provide you with some Grace every year as long as the agreement lasts, with the amount depending on your tier and whether you are a nomad or control a religion.

Offer the Dragon Throne a gift of fine horses in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetSheHe] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer the Dragon Throne a gift of fine horses in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetSheHe] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your male courtiers as a eunuch.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the eunuch, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
The courtier offered to [Root.GetTitledName] will be castrated before the offer is made unless he already is a eunuch, and he is thus unlikely to think fondly of you.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your male courtiers as a eunuch.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the eunuch, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
The courtier offered to [Root.GetTitledName] will be castrated before the offer is made unless he already is a eunuch, and he is thus unlikely to think fondly of you.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your female courtiers as a concubine.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the concubine, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the concubine will be disinherited.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your female courtiers as a concubine.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the concubine, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the concubine will be disinherited.

You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the commander, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the commander will be disinherited.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your courtiers as a commander.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the commander, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the commander will be disinherited.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your courtiers as a physician.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the physician, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the physician will be disinherited.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your courtiers as a physician.
You will gain a moderate amount of Grace if the tribute is accepted.
The amount of Grace depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the traits of the physician, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
If the tribute is accepted the physician will be disinherited.

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your artifacts in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the quality of the artifact, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven..

Offer [Root.GetTitledName] one of your artifacts in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetTitledName]'s traits, the quality of the artifact, and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven..

Offer to renounce all claims you possess on territory currently under the control of the Middle Throne in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer to renounce all claims you possess on titles currently held by the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer to renounce the Favor the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven owes you in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer to renounce the Favor the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven owes you in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

Offer to transfer some of the Prosperity from your demesne to the province of the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven's choice in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

As both you and the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven are members of the same society you can offer to transfer some of your influence to [Root.GetHerHim] in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

As both you and the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven are members of the same society you can offer to transfer some of your influence to [Root.GetHerHim] in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.
Offer to support the Imperial Dynasty

Offer to do what you can to help convince all under Heaven that the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty possesses the Mandate of Heaven in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

You could potentially stand to gain if you tied ourselves more closely to [Root.GetChinaChina]. Of course, they might expect more of you in turn.

-(Vassal) 
-Client State
-Protectorate
-Imperial Tributary
-Peripheral Tributary

Offer [From.TopLiege.GetBestName] the county of [Root.GetName] in exchange for Grace.\nThe amount of Grace gained depends on [Root.GetBestName]'s traits and whether [Root.GetBestName] is believed to possess the Mandate of Heaven.

You currently possess some land that traditionally has been part of the Middle Kingdom, and [Root.GetChinaChina] obviously desires it. Offering to return it could give you a substantial amount of Grace, as well as a truce.
Remind [Root.GetBestName] of [Root.GetHerHis] obligations towards you and all you have done for the Middle Kingdom, requesting a bidirectional truce.

Request a Peace Deal with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\nIf this Boon is granted, you will not be able to declare war on the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], nor the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on you, for the next twenty-five years unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes or either party breaks the agreement.\nUnless you are or become a tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you will also be unable to declare war on their tributaries, while they will have no such restriction towards you.
Remind the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven of all you have done for [Root.GetHerHim] and request that [Root.GetSheHe] grants you a Favor.
Remind the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven of all you have done for [Root.GetHerHim] and request that [Root.GetSheHe] considers the Favor you owe [Root.GetHerHim] to be repaid.
Request that the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven grants you another county.
Request that the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven grants a county to the recipient of your choice.

Request that a male member of your dynasty of your choice is granted permission to marry a female relative of [Root.GetBestName].
[Root.GetTitledName] will be asked to provide a suitable female relative of [Root.GetHerHis], but could perhaps pick a lesser bride.
If this Boon is granted, you will also sign a Peace Deal and will not be able to declare war on the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], nor the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on you, for the next fifty years unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes or either party breaks the agreement.
Unless you are or become a tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you will also be unable to declare war on their tributaries, while they will have no such restriction towards you.
Request that a male member of your dynasty of your choice is granted permission to marry a female relative of the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven.

Request that a male member of your dynasty of your choice is granted permission to marry [Root.GetBestName].
The Dragon Throne might perhaps pick a lesser bride if unwilling to outright refuse the suggestion.
If this Boon is granted, you will also sign a Peace Deal and will not be able to declare war on the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], nor the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on you, for the next fifty years unless the dynasty on the Dragon Throne changes or either party breaks the agreement.
Unless you are or become a tributary of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you will also be unable to declare war on their tributaries, while they will have no such restriction towards you.
Request that a male member of your dynasty of your choice is granted permission to marry [Root.GetBestName].

Request the services of a Chinese physician.

Request the services of a Chinese Strategist.

Request the services of a Scholar-Bureaucrat.
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Master Engineer.
Request the services of a Master Engineer.
[Root.GetBestName] is obviously unfit to serve the Dragon Throne in [Root.GetHerHis] current capacity. Surely the Dragon Throne will agree.

Remind the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven of all you have done for [Root.GetHerHim] and the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty and suggest that you without a doubt are worthy of being named Grand Chancellor.
Request that the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven names you a commander.
Request that [Root.GetBestName] renounces all claims on your titles.
Reming the Dragon Throne of all you have done for the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty and suggest that your actions are worthy of praise.
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese artifact.\nThe quality of the artifact is likely to be better if [Root.GetBestName] is believed to be in possession of the Mandate of Heaven.
Request that [Root.GetTitledName] sends you a Chinese artifact.\nThe quality of the artifact is likely to be better if [Root.GetBestName] is believed to be in possession of the Mandate of Heaven.

It might be a good idea to increase your autonomy from [Root.GetChinaChina]. Of course, you might lose some benefits in turn.

From highest to lowest, the tiers are
-Client State
-Protectorate
-Imperial Tributary
-Peripheral Tributary
While you obviously are a most filial subject of the [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven surely the Dragon Throne understands that you are too important to be required to mourn any longer.
You are closely tied to [Root.GetChinaChina], and could thus perhaps convince them to part with some land that they control that traditionally has been adminstrated by your realm.
[Root.GetBestName] currently has [Root.grace.GetValue] Grace that [Root.GetSheHe] can use to obtain Boons from the Dragon Throne
[Root.GetBestName] currently has [Root.grace.GetValue] Grace that [Root.GetSheHe] can use to obtain Boons from the Dragon Throne
Inform [Root.GetBestName] that you have altered the deal... and that they should pray that you alter it no further.
Bestow an amount of Grace to [Root.GetBestName]. This will cost you some prestige, but [Root.GetHerHis] opinion of you will be increased.
Make [Root.GetBestName] available for regular marriage. This will somewhat make people question whether the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty truly possesses the Mandate of Heaven.
Request that all Client States that control at least one county within [Root.GetName] turn it over to you, seeing as [Root.GetName] lies within the traditional borders of the Middle Kingdom.

One of the following is true:
- The "Kingdom creation restrictions" game rule is set to "Disabled"
- You are independent
- You hold a non-viceroyalty non-temporary kingdom tier title
- Your top liege is neither a Chinese Imperial ruler with Average or higher Mandate nor a Japanese or Divine Imperial ruler that does not have the Under Regency trait

One of the following is true:
 -The "Duchy creation restrictions" game rule is set to "Disabled"
- You are independent
- You hold a non-viceroyalty non-temporary kingdom or duchy tier title
- Your top liege is not Chinese Imperial with Good or higher Mandate
- Your top liege is Chinese Imperial and you belong to an active Grand Chancellor bloodline.
I am required to appoint further Council Eunuchs. Perhaps one or more will see fit to step forth if I ask the palace eunuchs for candidates.
The Roman Legionaries were known to be one of the most disciplined force in history. Working in cohorts, units were severly punished if they were found to be working individually.

column3: Sa nature gentille est à blâmer...
column6: Es culpa de su naturaleza amable

column2: This character, though not following one of the [indian_group.GetGroupName] faiths, has a special sympathy and understanding for the [indian_group.GetGroupName] faiths and their practitioners.
§Y[From.GetBestName]§! will perform an experimental treatment. The outcome of this treatment can be extreme. The risk of this treatment will vary depending on [From.GetHerHis] capabilities.
column3: [From.Get_only_Le_Title]§Y[From.GetBestName]§! va utiliser un traitement expérimental dont le résultat peut être extrême. Le risque varie en fonction de ses compétences.
column4: §Y[From.GetBestName]§! wird eine experimentelle Behandlung durchführen. Das Resultat dieser Behandlung könnte extrem sein. Die Risiken dieser Behandlung hängen davon ab, wie fähig [From.GetSheHe] ist.
column6: §Y[From.GetBestName]§! realizará un tratamiento experimental. El resultado de este tratamiento puede ser extremo. El riesgo del tratamiento variará dependiendo de su aptitud.

column2: With age comes wisdom, they say. "Or at least, it may change the questions we ask", you mutter to yourself. You have had trouble sleeping lately - more often than not, while the rest of your court is sound asleep, you find yourself staring at the ceiling. You are getting older, each day closer to leaving this plane of existence. It is folly to fear such things, of course, yet you cannot keep these feelings at bay. You want more days with [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], your family...!\n\nYou sit up straight in your bed. This is ridiculous. You are the ruler! You have people ready to serve your any whim! Perhaps your councillors have ideas? If nothing else, it might ease your trouble sleeping.
column3: Il paraît qu'avec l'âge vient la sagesse. « Ou du moins, nous ne nous posons plus les mêmes questions », vous murmurez-vous. Vous avez eu du mal à dormir dernièrement, et alors que le reste de la Cour est profondément endormi, vous êtes là à fixer le plafond. Vous vieillissez, et chaque jour qui passe vous rapproche du moment de quitter ce lieu d'existence. C'est bête d'avoir de telles craintes, et pourtant vous n'arrêtez pas d'y penser. Vous voulez passer plus de jours avec [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], votre famille... \n\nVous vous redressez dans votre lit. C'est ridicule. Vous régnez et avez même des gens prêts à servir le moindre de vos caprices ! Vos conseillers auraient-ils une solution ? Cela pourrait au moins soulager vos problèmes de sommeil.
column4: Mit dem Alter kommt Weisheit, so heißt es. Oder wenigstens ändern sich die Fragen, die man stellt, murmelt Ihr. In letzter Zeit habt Ihr Probleme mit dem Einschlafen und liegt häufig bis tief in die Nacht wach in Eurer Kammer. Ihr werdet älter und jeder Tag bringt Euch dem Abschied aus Eurer derzeitigen Existenzebene näher. Auch wenn es Unfug ist, diesen Ängsten nachzuhängen, seid Ihr machtlos gegen diese Gefühle. Ihr wünscht Euch mehr Zeit mit [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName] und Eurer Familie ...!\n\nDann kommt Euch ein Gedanke. Es ist absurd! Seid Ihr denn nicht der Herrscher? Haben vielleicht Eure Berater eine Idee? Wenigstens Eure Schlafstörungen könnten sie doch beheben.
column6: Dicen que con la edad llega la sabiduría. O al menos, cambian las preguntas que hacemos», murmuras. Últimamente tienes problemas para dormir, más veces de las que no, mientras el resto de tu corte duerme, te encuentras mirando al techo. Te estás haciendo viejo, cada día tienes más cerca abandonar este plano de la existencia. Por supuesto, es absurdo temer estas cosas, pero no puedes evitar pensar en ello. ¡Quieres más días con [Root.Spouse.GetFirstName], con tu familia!\n\nTe sientas en la cama. Esto es ridículo. ¡Eres [Root.GetElLa] gobernante! ¡Tienes gente dispuesta a realizar cualquier capricho! ¿Tendrán tus consejeros alguna idea? Por lo menos, puede que te ayude a conciliar el sueño.

column2: With age comes wisdom, they say. "Or at least, it may change the questions we ask", you mutter to yourself. You have had trouble sleeping lately - more often than not, while the rest of your court is sound asleep, you find yourself staring at the ceiling. You are getting older, each day closer to leaving this plane of existence. It is folly of course, yet you are terrified you'll end up all alone, like the miserable [eternal_life_sad_example.GetTitledFirstName]... You've seen [eternal_life_sad_example.GetHerHim] skulking about, a dark cloud over [eternal_life_sad_example.GetHerHim]...\n\nYou sit up straight in your bed. This is ridiculous. You are the [Root.GetTitle]! You have [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] on your side! Maybe your councillors could calm you down? If nothing else, it might ease your trouble sleeping.
column3: Il paraît qu'avec l'âge vient la sagesse. « Ou du moins, nous ne nous posons plus les mêmes questions », vous murmurez-vous. Vous avez eu du mal à dormir dernièrement, et alors que le reste de la Cour est profondément endormi, vous êtes là à fixer le plafond. Vous vieillissez, et chaque jour qui passe vous rapproche du moment de quitter ce lieu d'existence. C'est sans doute de la folie, mais vous êtes terrifié[Root.Get_E] par l'idée de finir tout[Root.Get_E] seul[Root.Get_E], comme [eternal_life_sad_example.GetLeLa] misérable [eternal_life_sad_example.GetTitledFirstName]... Vous l'avez vu rôder discrètement, un nuage sombre sur [eternal_life_sad_example.GetLuiElle]... \n\nVous vous redressez dans votre lit. C'est ridicule. Vous êtes [Root.GetTitle] en ces terres ! Vous avez [Root.Get_le_HighGod] de votre côté ! Peut-être que vos conseillers pourraient vous aider ? Cela pourrait au moins soulager vos problèmes de sommeil.
column4: Mit dem Alter kommt Weisheit, so heißt es. Oder wenigstens ändern sich die Fragen, die man stellt, murmelt Ihr. In letzter Zeit habt Ihr Probleme mit dem Einschlafen und liegt häufig bis tief in die Nacht wach. Ihr werdet älter und jeder Tag bringt Euch dem Abschied aus Eurer derzeitigen Existenzebene näher. Auch wenn es Unfug ist, diesen Ängsten nachzuhängen, seid Ihr machtlos gegen die Angst, einsam und allein zu enden, so wie [eternal_life_sad_example.GetTitledFirstName] ... Ihr habt gesehen, wie [eternal_life_sad_example.GetSheHe] herumschlich, von einer schwarzen Wolke verdunkelt ...\n\nDann kommt Euch ein Gedanke. Ihr seid [Root.GetTitle]! [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] ist an Eurer Seite. Können vielleicht Eure Berater Euch beruhigen? Wenigstens Eure Schlafstörungen könnten sie doch beheben.
column6: Dicen que con la edad llega la sabiduría. «O al menos, cambian las preguntas que hacemos», murmuras. Últimamente tienes problemas para dormir, más veces de las que no, mientras el resto de tu corte duerme, te encuentras mirando al techo. Te estás haciendo viejo, cada día tienes más cerca abandonar este plano de la existencia. Sí, es absurdo, pero te aterroriza que terminar tus días sol[Root.GetOA], como [eternal_life_sad_example.GetElLa] pobre [eternal_life_sad_example.GetTitledFirstName]. Ya le has visto dando vueltas por ahí, como si tuviera una nube negra sobre [eternal_life_sad_example.GetElElla]\n\nTe sientas en la cama. Esto es ridículo. ¡Eres [Root.GetTitle]! ¡Tienes a [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] de tu parte! ¿Tendrán tus consejeros alguna idea? Por lo menos, puede que te ayude a conciliar el sueño.

column2: With age comes wisdom, they say. "Or at least, it may change the questions we ask", you mutter to yourself. You have had trouble sleeping lately - more often than not, while the rest of your court is sound asleep, you find yourself staring at the ceiling. You are getting older, each day closer to leaving this plane of existence. It is folly to fear such things, of course, yet you cannot keep these feelings at bay. Didn't you use to dream of grander things? What about you carving your own path? What happened to your ambitions?\n\nYou sit up straight in your bed. This is ridiculous. You are the ruler! You have people ready to serve your any whim! Perhaps your councillors have ideas? If nothing else, it might ease your trouble sleeping.
column3: Il paraît qu'avec l'âge vient la sagesse. « Ou du moins, nous ne nous posons plus les mêmes questions », vous murmurez-vous. Vous avez eu du mal à dormir dernièrement, et alors que le reste de la Cour est profondément endormi, vous êtes là à fixer le plafond. Vous vieillissez, et chaque jour qui passe vous rapproche du moment de quitter ce lieu d'existence. C'est bête d'avoir de telles craintes, et pourtant vous n'arrêtez pas d'y penser. Ne rêviez-vous pas de choses plus prestigieuses ? Et si vous affrontiez votre destin ? Qu'est-il arrivé à vos ambitions ? \n\nVous vous redressez dans votre lit. C'est ridicule. Vous régnez et avez même des gens prêts à servir le moindre de vos caprices ! Vos conseillers auraient-ils une solution ? Cela pourrait au moins soulager vos problèmes de sommeil.
column4: Mit dem Alter kommt Weisheit, so heißt es. Oder wenigstens ändern sich die Fragen, die man stellt, murmelt Ihr. In letzter Zeit habt Ihr Probleme mit dem Einschlafen und häufig liegt Ihr bis tief in die Nacht wach in Eurer Kammer. Ihr werdet älter und jeder Tag bringt Euch dem Abschied aus Eurer derzeitigen Existenzebene näher. Auch wenn es Unfug ist, diesen Ängsten nachzuhängen, seid Ihr machtlos gegen diese Gefühle. Habt Ihr nicht immer von Größerem geträumt? Wo sind Eure Träume und Pläne geblieben?\n\nDann kommt Euch ein Gedanke. Es ist absurd! Seid Ihr denn nicht der Herrscher? Haben vielleicht Eure Berater eine Idee? Wenigstens Eure Schlafstörungen könnten sie doch beheben.
column6: Dicen que con la edad llega la sabiduría. «O al menos, cambian las preguntas que hacemos», murmuras. Últimamente tienes problemas para dormir, más veces de las que no, mientras el resto de tu corte duerme, te encuentras mirando al techo. Te estás haciendo viejo, cada día tienes más cerca abandonar este plano de la existencia. Por supuesto, es absurdo temer estas cosas, pero no puedes evitar pensar en ello. ¿No soñabas con cosas mayores? ¿Qué pasó con abrir tu propio camino? ¿Qué ha pasado con tus ambiciones?\n\nTe sientas en la cama. Esto es ridículo. ¡Eres [Root.GetElLa] gobernante! ¡Tienes gente dispuesta a realizar cualquier capricho! ¿Tendrán tus consejeros alguna idea? Por lo menos, puede que te ayude a conciliar el sueño.

Esto es ridículo. ¡Eres [Root.GetElLa] gobernante! ¡Tienes gente dispuesta a realizar cualquier capricho! ¿Tendrán tus consejeros alguna idea? Por lo menos, puede que te ayude a conciliar el sueño.

column2:
Your council convenes and the faces of your advisors speak of confusion. "Why are we here, my [Root.GetLordLady]?" It comes with a hint of concern. You sit down and the suspense is almost tangible, as you leave the question hanging in the air. Finally you speak and without disclosing much of your current nightly restlessness, you convey the message eloquently enough... 

"I want to discuss the concept of life and death. And... I want to look into everlasting life." They nod, slowly. "So what do you think?" 

The spirit rises in the room as your councillors start to talk, some hesitantly, some gesturing wildly. They all have ideas.
column3:
Votre Conseil se réunit et l'embarras se lit sur les visages de ses membres. « Pourquoi sommes-nous ici, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady] ? », est demandé avec un soupçon d'inquiétude. Vous vous asseyez sans donner de réponse et l'attente devient tangible. Finalement, vous parlez sans trop en divulguer sur vos agitations nocturnes, et réussissez néanmoins à faire passer le message...

« Je veux discuter du concept de la vie et de la mort. Et... je veux étudier le sujet de la vie éternelle ». Ils hochent lentement la tête. « Alors, qu'en pensez-vous ? », ajoutez-vous. 

Vos conseillers se mettent à parler, certains avec hésitation, d'autres en faisant de grands gestes. Ils ont tous des idées.
column4:
Euer Rat ist zusammengekommen und aus den Gesichtern der Ratsmitglieder spricht Ratlosigkeit. "Warum sind wir hier, [Root.GetLordLady]?", fragen sie mit einem Anflug von Sorge. Wortlos setzt Ihr Euch und die Spannung ist beinahe greifbar, während die Frage im Raum schwebt. Schließlich ergreift Ihr das Wort und es gelingt Euch, unter Auslassung Eurer Schlaflosigkeit, Euer Anliegen ausreichend eloquent vorzutragen ... 

"Ich möchte über die Prinzipien von Leben und Tod sprechen, und über Möglichkeiten zur Erforschung des ewigen Lebens." Die Zuhörer nicken, vorsichtig. "Ich höre. Hat jemand Vorschläge?"

Dann, als die Ratsmitglieder zu sprechen beginnen, ist der Raum von Stimmen und Inspiration erfüllt. Denn jeder von ihnen hat eine Idee.
column6:
Tu consejo convoca y las caras de tus consejeros expresan confusión. ¿Por qué estamos aquí, mi [Root.GetLordLady]?» Llega con una pizca de preocupación. Te sientas y la intriga es casi tangible, al dejar la cuestión en el aire. Finalmente hablas y sin revelar mucho de tus presentes inquietudes nocturnas, transmites el mensaje con bastante elocuencia

«Quiero discutir el concepto de vida y muerte. Y Quiero considerar la vida eterna». Asienten lentamente. «¿Qué pensáis?» 

Los ánimos se calientan en la sala cuando tus consejeros comienzan a hablar, algunos vacilantes, algunos gesticulando violentamente. Todos tienen ideas.

column2: When you check up on [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] to inquire about the search, you find [From.GetHerHim] slumped over [From.GetHerHis] books, sound asleep. You clear your throat loudly and [From.GetSheHe] sits up straight, drowsy eyes darting panickedly around the room, before suppressing a yawn. \n\n"Sorry, [Root.GetMasterMistress], I must've dozed off. Truth be told, I am starting to give up... To make it through all these scriptures, I think I need an assistant. Or ten." [From.GetSheHeCap] rolls [From.GetHerHis] eyes, then looks down, abashedly. "I'm sorry, my [Root.GetLordLady], I'll make do, of course."
column3: Alors que vous venez vous renseigner sur les recherches [Root.job_spiritual.Get_du_TitledFirstName], vous [From.GetLeLa] trouvez affaissé[From.Get_E] sur ses livres, profondément endormi[From.Get_E]. Vous toussez bruyamment et [From.GetIlElle] se redresse, regarde rapidement avec des yeux somnolents ce qui l'environne et retient un bâillement. \n\n« Désolé[From.Get_E], [Root.GetMasterMistress], j'ai dû m'assoupir. À vrai dire, je suis sur le point d'abandonner... Pour étudier tous ces textes, je pense que j'aurais besoin d'un assistant... Même de dix ». [From.GetIlElleCap] baisse les yeux et a l'air confus[From.Get_E]. « Excusez-moi, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady], je vais me débrouiller pour y parvenir ».
column4: Als Ihr [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] aufsucht, um Euch nach dem Stand der Suche zu erkundigen, findet Ihr [From.GetHerHim] schlafend über den Büchern. Ihr räuspert Euch geräuschvoll und [From.GetSheHe] schreckt hoch, überrascht und verschlafen.\n\n"Entschuldigt, [Root.GetMasterMistress], ich muss eingeschlafen sein. Um ehrlich zu sein, stehe ich kurz davor aufzugeben ... Wenn ich mich durch all diese Schriftstücke arbeiten soll, brauche ich einen Gehilfen ... oder besser zehn." [From.GetSheHeCap] rollt die Augen und wendet beschämt den Blick ab. "Entschuldigt, [Root.GetLordLady], ich werde es schaffen, natürlich."
column6: Cuando visitabas a [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] para saber cómo va la búsqueda, [From.GetRleRla] encuentras desplomad[From.GetOA] sobre sus libros, parecía dormir. Te aclaras sonoramente la garganta y se sienta derech[From.GetOA], sus ojos adormilados recorren la habitación presa del pánico, antes de reprimir un bostezo.\n\n«Perdón, [Root.GetMasterMistress], me habré quedado dormid[Root.GetOA]. A decir verdad, estoy empezando a rendirme para revisar todos estos escritos, creo que necesito un ayudante. O diez». [From.GetElEllaCap] pone los ojos en blanco y baja la mirada, avergonzad[From.GetOA]. «Lo siento, mi [Root.GetLordLady], me las apañaré, por supuesto».

column2: My councillor [GBC_nice_councillor.GetFirstName] raised an eyebrow at me during a meeting today. "I've noticed your kins[GBC_new_friend.GetManWoman] [GBC_new_friend.GetFirstName] has been visiting you more often, my [Root.GetLordLady]. I wasn't aware you two were close?"
column3: Un conseiller, [GBC_nice_councillor.GetFirstName], me fixa durant la réunion aujourd'hui. « M[Root.GetOnA] [Root.GetLordLady], j'ai remarqué que votre parent[GBC_new_friend.Get_E], [GBC_new_friend.GetFirstName], vous rend visite plus souvent. Je ne savais pas que vous étiez si proches », me dit-[GBC_nice_councillor.GetIlElle].
column4: Ratsmitglied [GBC_nice_councillor.GetFirstName] hob bei der heutigen Besprechung verwundert die Brauen. "Ich stelle fest, dass [GBC_new_friend.GetEuerEure] neue[GBC_new_friend.GetrMale] [GBC_new_friend.GetManWoman] [GBC_new_friend.GetFirstName] Euch in letzter Zeit häufiger besucht. Ich wusste gar nicht, dass ihr euch so gut kennt?"
column6: Mi consejero, [GBC_nice_councillor.GetFirstName] se sorprende durante la reunión de hoy. «He notado que [GBC_new_friend.GetFirstName], vuestr[GBC_new_friend.GetOA] familiar os visita a menudo, mi [Root.GetLordLady]. No sabía que fuerais tan íntimo»

column2: My liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], is offering to teach me the proper use of Light Foot in battle...
column3: M[From.GetOnA] [From.GetLordLady] lige, [From.Get_le_TitledFirstName], me propose de m'enseigner l'usage approprié de l'infanterie légère sur le champ de bataille...
column4: Mein Lehnsherr [From.GetTitledFirstName] bietet mir an, den korrekten Einsatz Leichter Infanterie im Kampf zu erlernen ...
column6: Mi señor[From.GetXA], [From.GetTitledFirstName], se ofrece a enseñarme el uso adecuado de la Infantería ligera en la batalla

column2:
To my vassal, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

I am willing to compensate you fairly in return for your institution of Gavelkind law. Your wisdom serves your people well.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3:
À mon vassal [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

J'accepte de vous dédommager pour l'institution d'une succession par partage salique. Votre sagesse sert utilement votre peuple.

Votre [From.GetLordLady] lige, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column4:
An meinen Vasallen [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Ich bin gewillt, Euch als Gegenleistung für die Einführung der Erbteilung angemessen zu entlohnen. Eure Weisheit gereicht Eurem Volk zum Vorteil.

Hochachtungsvoll [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column6:
A mi vasall[Root.GetOA], [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Estoy dispuest[From.GetOA] a compensarte con justicia a cambio de que instituyas la ley Equitativa. Tu sabiduría sirve bien a tu gente.

Tu señor[From.GetXA], [From.GetTitledFirstName]

column2:
To my vassal, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Your wish for monetary compensation in return for Gavelkind law is understandable. However, I cannot afford the sum you requested.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3:
À mon vassal [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Votre souhait d'une compensation sonnante et trébuchante en échange d'une succession par partage salique est compréhensible. Cependant, je ne peux pas me le permettre.

Votre [From.GetLordLady] lige, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column4:
An meinen Vasallen [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Euer Wunsch einer monetären Kompensation für die Einführung der Erbteilung ist verständlich. Allerdings kann ich mir Eure geforderte Summe nicht leisten.

Hochachtungsvoll [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column6:
A mi vasall[Root.GetOA], [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Tu deseo de una compensación monetaria a cambio de la ley Equitativa es comprensible. Sin embargo, no me puedo permitir la suma que solicitas.

Tu señor[From.GetXA], [From.GetTitledFirstName]

column2:
To my vassal, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

I do understand your reluctance to change to Gavelkind succession. However, I will not be indebted to you. With some disappointment.

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3:
À mon vassal [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Je comprends votre réticence à adopter la succession par partage salique. Cependant, je ne veux pas vous devoir de faveur. Avec une certaine déception.

Votre [From.GetLordLady] lige, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column4:
An meinen Vasallen [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

ich verstehe Euer Zögern, die Erbteilung einzuführen. Doch ich werde nicht in Eurer Schuld stehen. Ich verbleibe enttäuscht

[From.GetTitledFirstName]
column6:
A mi vasall[Root.GetOA], [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Comprendo tu resistencia a cambiar la sucesión Equitativa. Sin embargo, no quedaré en deuda contigo y sí algo decepcionad[From.GetOA].

Tu señor[From.GetXA], [From.GetTitledFirstName]

column2:
To my loyal vassal, [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

I am calling in that favor you owe me. I need you to change succession law to Gavelkind. Trust me, it is for the best...

Your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column3:
À mon loyal vassal [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Je fais appel à la faveur que vous me devez. J'ai besoin que vous adoptiez la succession par partage salique. Croyez-moi, c'est pour le mieux...

Votre [From.GetLordLady] lige, [From.GetTitledFirstName]
column4:
An meinen getreuen Vasallen [Root.GetTitledFirstName],

Ihr schuldet mir einen Gefallen, den ich hiermit einfordere. Ihr müsst Euer Nachfolgegesetz auf Erbteilung ändern. Vertraut mir, dies ist zum Besten ...

[From.GetTitledFirstName]
column6:
A mi vasall[Root.GetOA], [Root.GetTitledFirstName].

Te pido ese favor que me debes. Necesito que cambies la ley de sucesión a la Equitativa. Confía en mí, es lo mejor

Tu señor[From.GetXA], [From.GetTitledFirstName]

column2: Your liege, [Root.Liege.GetBestName], has decided to seclude [Root.Liege.GetHerselfHimself] and [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] court from the outside world in order to avoid the ongoing epidemic. The gates of [gates_closed_target.GetName] have been shut and any landed councillors have been sent back to their homes.
column3: Votre [Root.Liege.GetLordLady] lige, [Root.Liege.Get_only_le_Title][Root.Liege.GetBestName], a décidé de vivre en réclusion, [Root.Liege.GetLuiElle] et sa Cour, afin d'éviter l'épidémie. Les portes de [gates_closed_target.GetName] ont été scellées et les conseillers possédant des terres ont été renvoyés chez eux.
column4: Euer Lehnsherr [Root.Liege.GetBestName] hat beschlossen, sich mit [Root.Liege.GetHerHis]em Hof von der Außenwelt zurückzuziehen, um sich vor der derzeitigen Epidemie zu schützen. Die Tore von [gates_closed_target.GetName] wurden geschlossen, und alle Ratsmitglieder wurden nach Hause geschickt.
column6: Tu señor, [Root.Liege.GetBestName], ha decidido recluirse junto con su corte del mundo exterior para evitar la epidemia creciente. Las puertas de [gates_closed_target.GetName] se han cerrado y todos los consejeros con tierras han sido enviados a sus hogares.

column2: The hunting party moves through the [Root.GetJungleOrForest]. You are hoping luck will find you a tiger to kill. Suddenly, there is a movement in the underbrush... and a large tiger springs out, roaring fiercely! It attacks the hunting party, but soldiers immediately move to attack it and they manage to kill it with their spears.
column3: Votre groupe de chasseurs marche dans la jungle. Vous espérez avoir la chance de tomber sur un tigre à tuer. Soudain, un mouvement dans les fourrés... Et un grand tigre bondit en poussant un rugissement féroce ! Il attaque le groupe de chasseurs, mais les soldats se mettent rapidement en position et parviennent à le tuer de leurs lances.
column4: Die Jagdgemeinschaft bewegt sich durch den Dschungel. Ihr hofft, dass Ihr einen Tiger findet. Plötzlich gibt es Bewegung im Unterholz und ein großer Tiger springt hervor, grimmig brüllend. Schon will er die Gruppe angreifen, doch die Soldaten schaffen es sofort, ihn mit Speeren zu töten.
column6: La partida de caza se mueve por la selva. Esperas que la suerte te procure un tigre para matar. De repente, hay un movimiento en la maleza... un gran tigre salta, ¡rugiendo ferozmente! Ataca a la partida de caza, pero los soldados inmediatamente se mueven para atacar y se las arreglan para matarlo con sus lanzas.

column2: The hunting party moves through the [Root.GetJungleOrForest]. You are hoping luck will find you a tiger to kill. Suddenly, there is a movement in the underbrush... and a large tiger springs out, roaring fiercely! It attacks the hunting party, striking at one of the servants, ripping him to shreds before disappearing again into the jungle.
column3: Votre groupe de chasseurs marche dans la jungle. Vous espérez avoir la chance de tomber sur un tigre à tuer. Soudain, un mouvement dans les fourrés... Et un grand tigre bondit en poussant un rugissement féroce ! Il attaque le groupe de chasseurs et frappe un serviteur qu'il réduit en charpie avant de disparaître dans la jungle.
column4: Die Jagdgemeinschaft bewegt sich durch den Dschungel. Ihr hofft, dass Ihr einen Tiger findet. Plötzlich gibt es Bewegung im Unterholz und ein großer Tiger springt hervor, grimmig brüllend. Er greift die Gruppe an und zerfleischt einen der Diener, bevor er wieder im Dschungel verschwindet.
column6: La partida de caza se mueve por la selva. Esperas que la suerte te procure un tigre para matar. De repente, hay un movimiento en la maleza... un gran tigre salta, ¡rugiendo ferozmente! Ataca a la partida de caza, golpeando a uno de los sirvientes y haciéndolo trizas antes de desaparecer en la jungla.

column2: The hunting party moves through the [Root.GetJungleOrForest]. You are hoping luck will find you a tiger to kill. Suddenly, there is a movement in the underbrush... and a large tiger springs out, roaring fiercely! It attacks the hunting party, striking at one of the hunters, ripping and tearing flesh before disappearing again into the jungle.
column3: Votre groupe de chasseurs marche dans la jungle. Vous espérez avoir la chance de tomber sur un tigre à tuer. Soudain, un mouvement dans les fourrés... Et un grand tigre bondit en poussant un rugissement féroce ! Il attaque le groupe de chasseurs et frappe l'un d'eux qu'il éventre avant de disparaître dans la jungle.
column4: Die Jagdgemeinschaft bewegt sich durch den Dschungel. Ihr hofft, dass Ihr einen Tiger findet. Plötzlich gibt es Bewegung im Unterholz und ein großer Tiger springt hervor, grimmig brüllend. Er greift die Gruppe an und zerfleischt einen der Jäger, bevor er wieder im Dschungel verschwindet.
column6: La partida de caza se mueve por la selva. Esperas que la suerte te procure un tigre para matar. De repente, hay un movimiento en la maleza... un gran tigre salta, ¡rugiendo ferozmente! Ataca a la partida de caza, golpeando a uno de los cazadores y rasgando su piel antes de desaparecer en la jungla.

column2: There is only one true [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, and [Root.GetSheHe] possesses the Mandate of Heaven. Perhaps I am the true [Root.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven...
After a tour of [Root.Capital.GetName] and a fortnight at my court, the visit of the Chinese guests has reached its end. I am relieved to hear them praise me for my hospitality as they leave.

As I am walking in the gardens with the Chinese guests I comment on the sunny skies. The translator repeats my words and after a moment of thought, they reply with ardent enthusiasm. Apparently they think my pleasantries are a metaphor for the enlightened nature of the heavenly [FromFromFrom.GetTitle]!

The [From.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.GetTitle] of [From.GetPrimaryChina] addresses a letter to the [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitle] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
column4: [From.GetDerDie] [From.GetTitle] des [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective]e[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetnMale] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle][From.Offmap.Ruler.GetsMale] adressiert einen Brief an [Root.Getdendie] [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective]e[Root.GetnMale] [Root.GetTitle] von [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
column6: El [From.GetTitle] del [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] dirige una carta al [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitle] del [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]

column2: A nervous foreigner has shown up at court. Flinching at anyone who comes near [chinese_refugee.GetHerHim], the [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] refuses to be on [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] way, instead arguing that [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] could serve me, as the trained [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] is. "Just don't send me back out there. I cannot go back", [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] says, jaw clenched.
column3: Un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] étrang[chinese_refugee.GetErEre] nerveu[chinese_refugee.GetXSe] s'est présenté[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] à la cour. Tressaillant devant quiconque qui s'approche d[chinese_refugee.GetEluiElle], [chinese_refugee.GetLLa][chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] refuse de repartir, [chinese_refugee.GetIlElle] se présente comme un [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] qui pourrait m'être utile. « Ne me renvoyez pas là-bas. Je ne peux pas rentrer », dit-[chinese_refugee.GetIlElle], la mâchoire serrée.
column4: Ein nervöser Ausländer ist an Eurem Hof aufgetaucht. [chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap] zuckt vor jedem zusammen, der in [chinese_refugee.GetHerHim]e Nähe kommt und weigert sich, weg zu gehen. Stattdessen argumentiert [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe], dass [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] mir als geschulte[chinese_refugee.GetrMale] [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] dienen könnte. "Schickt mich nur nicht weg. Ich kann nicht zurück", sagt [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] mit geballtem Kiefer.
column6: Un extranjero nervioso ha aparecido en tu corte. Temblando ante cualquiera que se le acerca, se niega a marcharse, e insiste que podría servirme como [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] que es. Pero no me enviéis de vuelta. No puedo regresar", dice, apretando las mandíbulas."

column2: My guards have dragged a Chinese thief before me. "[chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap] claims to have an audience scheduled with you, my [Root.GetLordLady]", they report. "Please, forgive the ruse", the [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] urges in a heavy accent, voice thick with emotion. "I'm a [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession]  any Chinese court would be ecstatic to have me! Take pity on my soul, [Root.GetMasterMistress]."
column3: Mes gardes ont traîné un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] voleu[chinese_refugee.GetRSe] chinois[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] devant moi. « [chinese_refugee.GetIlElleCap] prétend avoir une audience prévue avec vous, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady] », rapportent-ils. « S'il vous plaît, pardonnez la ruse », dit [chinese_refugee.GetLLa][chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] sur un ton grave, la voix teintée d'émotion. « Je suis un [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] - toute cour chinoise serait enchantée de m'avoir ! Ayez pitié de mon âme, [Root.GetMasterMistress]. »
column4: Meine Wachen haben einen chinesischen Dieb vor mich gezogen. "[chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap] behauptet, eine geplante Audienz bei Euch zu haben, m[Root.Geteineine] [Root.GetLordLady]", berichten sie. "Bitte, verzeiht die List", drängt [chinese_refugee.Getderdie] [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] in einem deutlichen Akzent, die voller Emotionen ist. "Ich bin [chinese_refugee.Geteineine] [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession]. Jeder chinesische Hof wäre verzückt mich haben zu können! Bitte, erbarmt Euch meiner Seele, [Root.GetMasterMistress].
column6: Mis guardias me traen un ladrón chino. Afirma que tiene audiencia con vos, mi [Root.GetLordLady]", dicen. "Perdonad esta treta", dice con un fuerte acento y la voz cargada de emoción. "Soy [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession]. ¡Cualquier corte china estaría eufórica de tenerme! Tened compasión de mí, [Root.GetMasterMistress]"."

column2: A suspected spy has tried to enter [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName] tonight, stopped only by guards who spotted the glint of armor under [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] cloak. When confronted, the foreigner claims to be a [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession], fleeing from the trouble in [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] homeland. Upon inspection, I notice [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] worn expression, and an armor not only covered in dust, but dark stains of blood.
column3: Un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] espio[chinese_refugee.GetName]] présumé[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] a essayé d'entrer dans [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName] cette nuit, arrêté[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] seulement parce que des gardes ont repéré le reflet de l'armure sous sa grande cape. L'étrang[chinese_refugee.GetErEre] a affirmé être un [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] fuyant l'[offmap_china.GetFullName]. Lors de l'inspection, je remarque son épuisement, et une armure non seulement couverte de poussière, mais aussi de taches sombres de sang.
column4: Ein Spion hat versucht heute Abend [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName] zu betreten, wurde aber von Wachen angehalten, die die schimmernde Rüstung unter [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis]em Mantel entdeckten. Bei der Gegenüberstellung gibt der Ausländer an, [chinese_refugee.Geteineine] [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] zu sein, [offmap_china.Getderdie] aus [offmap_china.GetFullName] geflohen ist. Bei der Durchsuchung bemerkte ich [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis]en gezeichneten Gesichtsausdruck und eine Rüstung, die nicht nur mit Staub, sondern auch dunklen Flecken von Blut bedeckt ist.
column6: Un presunto espía intentó entrar esta noche en [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], pero fue detenido por los guardias al vislumbrar una armadura bajo su capa. Al ser interrogado, el extranjero afirmó ser un [chinese_refugee.GetChineseProfession] que huye de [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Cuando le examino, veo el cansancio en su rostro y una armadura no solo cubierta de polvo, sino con manchas de sangre.

column2: A Chinese healer has taken shelter in a small village outside of [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], supposedly treating people in exchange for food, and successfully so. My courier first thought the [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] a beggar, but rumor has it [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] comes fleeing the current situation in [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] homeland. "It would explain [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] ragtag appearance, my [Root.GetLordLady]."
column3: Un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] guérisseu[chinese_refugee.GetRSe] chinois[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] s'est réfugié[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] dans un petit village à l'extérieur de [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName]. On dit qu'[chinese_refugee.GetIlElle] soigne les gens en échange de nourriture, et avec succès. Mon messager a d'abord pensé que [chinese_refugee.GetLLa][chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] était un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] mendiant[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE], mais selon la rumeur, [chinese_refugee.GetIlElle] a fui la situation actuelle dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName]. « Cela expliquerait son apparence de vermine, M[Root.GetOnA][Root.GetLordLady] ».
column4: Ein chinesischer Heiler hat in einem kleinen Dorf außerhalb von [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName] Zuflucht gesucht. Angeblich bietet er medizinische Hilfe im Austausch für Nahrung an und das scheinbar erfolgreich. Mein Kurier dachte zuerst [chinese_refugee.Getderdie] [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] sei ein Bettler, aber Gerüchte besagen, [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] sei vor der momentanen Situation in [offmap_china.GetFullName] geflohen. "Es würde [chinese_refugee.GetHerHis] geschundenes Aussehen erklären, m[Root.Geteineine] [Root.GetLordLady]", sagte der Kurier.
column6: Un sanador chino se ha refugiado en una pequeña aldea a las afueras de [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName], donde cura a la gente a cambio de comida y con éxito. Al principio pensó que se trataba de un mendigo, pero los rumores dicen huyendo de la situación actual en el [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Explicaría su aspecto desharrapado, mi [Root.GetLordLady]"."

column3: C'est un endroit sûr pour personne en ce moment. Vous pouvez rester.
column6: Puedes quedarte. El [offmap_china.GetFullName] ya no es lugar para nadie.
Este/a [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] de China se une a tu corte.

column2: This is not a criminal, you buffoons. [chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap]'s a refugee!
column3: Ce n'est pas un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] crimine[chinese_refugee.GetLLle], espèce d'idiots. C'est un[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] réfugié[chinese_refugee.GetNoneE] !
column4: Das ist kein Verbrecher ihr Dummköpfe. [chinese_refugee.GetSheHeCap] ist ein Flüchtling!
column6: Idiotas, ¡no es un criminal, sino un refugiado!

column2: I can make use of a veteran like you.
column3: Je peux faire bon usage de quelqu'un d'aussi expérimenté que vous.
column4: Ich kann einen Veteranen wie euch gebrauchen.
column6: Un veterano como tú me vendría bien.
Este/a [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] de China se une a tu corte.

column2: Why wasn't I told sooner? We need a physician here in [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName]!
column3: Pourquoi n'en ai-je pas entendu parler plus tôt? Nous avons besoin d'un physicien !
column4: Warum wurde ich nicht früher informiert? Wir benötigen einen Arzt!
column6: ¿Por qué no me lo dijisteis antes? ¡Necesitamos un médico aquí en [Root.Capital.Capital.GetName]!

column2: Surely this [chinese_refugee.GetManWoman] can find shelter elsewhere.
column3: Vous pouvez sûrement trouver refuge ailleurs.
column6: Seguro que puede encontrar refugio en otra parte.

column2: This is a waste of my time.
I'm sorry, but we can hardly afford to feed our own.
column3: Je suis désolé[Root.GetNoneE], mais nous pouvons à peine nourrir les nôtres.
column4: Entschuldigt, aber wir können kaum unsere eigenen ernähren.
column6: Lo siento, pero apenas podemos alimentar a nuestra gente.

column2: I'm sure [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] wants to be left alone.
column3: Je suis persuadé[Root.GetNoneE] qu'[chinese_refugee.GetIlElle] veut qu'on [chinese_refugee.GetLeLa] laisse tranquille.
column4: Ich bin sicher, [chinese_refugee.GetSheHe] möchte in Ruhe gelassen werden.
column6: Seguro que quiere que le dejen en paz.

column4: Ihr lasst den Flüchtling in Ruhe.\n

column2: When plundering a place of worship in [From.GetName],your men discovered a valuable artifact.
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus. Ils ont apparemment trouvé et pillé un lieu de culte, ramenant un important butin et un artefact de valeur.
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt. Sie haben anscheinen eine Art Gotteshaus gefunden und geplündert, das viel Beute und ein wertvolles Artefakt beherbergte.
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Al parecer encontraron y saquearon un lugar de culto, trayendo consigo cantidades de botín y un artefacto valioso.

column2: An artifact? Bring it to me!

When looting [From.GetName] your men find a [captured_character.GetManWoman] named [captured_character.GetFullName]. Though probably not related to the ruler of the area, [captured_character.GetSheHe] is definitely an attractive [captured_character.GetManWoman]. [captured_character.GetSheHeCap] has been imprisoned for the time being, but if you have any use for [captured_character.GetHerHim] you could release [captured_character.GetHerHim].
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus. Cette fois, leurs pillages les ont amenés à passer par les propriétés d'un noble han. En plus de l'or et de la soie, ils ont aussi rapporté un cadeau plus personnel, un[captured_character.GetNoneE] [captured_character.GetManWoman] nommé[captured_character.GetNoneE] [captured_character.GetFullName] - probablement [captured_character.GetLeLa] [captured_character.GetSonDaughter] du noble.
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt. Diesmal geschahen die Überfälle in der Nähe der Besitztümer eines Han-Adligen. Zusätzlich zu Gold und Seide, haben unsere Truppen auch ein persönlicheres Geschenk mitgebracht, eine[captured_character.GetnMale] [captured_character.GetManWoman] mit dem Namen [captured_character.GetFullName], [captured_character.Getderdie] allem Anschein nach [captured_character.Getderdie] [captured_character.GetSonDaughter] des Adligen ist.
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Esta vez su incursiones les llevaron a los dominios de un noble han. Además de oro y seda, tus asaltantes también traen un regalo más personal: alguien llamado [captured_character.GetFullName], probablemente [captured_character.GetSonDaughter] del noble.

column3: Je vais en faire m[captured_character.GetOnA] concubin[captured_character.GetNoneE].
column4: Ich werde [captured_character.GetHerHim] zu meiner Konkubine machen.

column2: When looting [From.GetName] your men encountered the workshop of a famous siege engineer and managed to capture one of his apprentices. The apprentice, [captured_engineer.GetFullName], has been brought back to serve you.
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus. Cette fois, leurs pillages les ont menés à l'atelier d'un ingénieur de siège réputé, où ils ont réussi à capturer un de ses apprentis. Celui-ci, [captured_engineer.GetFullName], a été emmené pour vous servir.
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt. Dieses Mal fanden die Überfälle in der Nähe einer Werkstatt eines berühmten Belagerungsingenieurs statt. Dort haben es unsere Truppen geschafft, einen seiner Lehrlinge gefangen zu nehmen. Der Lehrling, [captured_engineer.GetFullName], wurde mitgenommen, um Euch zu dienen.
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Esta vez su incursiones les llevaron al taller de un famoso ingeniero de asedios, donde consiguieron capturar a uno de sus aprendices, [captured_engineer.GetFullName]. Te lo han traído para que te sirva.

column2: A siege engineer of my own? Excellent!
column3: Un ingénieur de siège à moi ? Excellent !
column4: Ein Belagerungsingenieur ganz für mich alleine? Hervorragend!

column2: The raiders we sent to the [offmap_china.GetFullName] have returned. On their way back home from China they came upon a caravan loaded with precious silks and porcelain - [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] truly smiled upon them!
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus. Sur le chemin du retour, ils sont tombés sur une caravane chargée avec de la soie et de la porcelaine de valeur.
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt. Auf ihrem Rückweg aus China haben sie eine Karawane getroffen, die mit wertvoller Seide und Porzellan beladen war. [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] begünstigt sie wahrhaftig!
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Cuando volvían de China se encontraron una caravana cargada de sedas y porcelanas preciosas. ¡[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] nos sonríe!

column2: Fantastic! Bring it all to me!

The raiders we sent to the [offmap_china.GetFullName] have returned - and they have brought countless treasures! They were able to identify and capture a Han noble who was traveling undercover, who they later ransomed for an exuberant amount of gold, silk and porcelain!
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus avec des trésors innombrables ! Ils ont réussi à identifier et capturer un noble han qui voyageait secrètement, puis à le rançonner en échange d'un montant exubérant d'or, de soie et de porcelaine !
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt und sie haben duzende Schätze mitgebracht! Sie waren in der Lage einen Adligen der Han-Dynastie zu identifizieren und zu fangen, den sie später für eine atemberaubende Menge Gold, Seide und Porzellan getauscht haben!
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName] ¡y traen innumerables tesoros! Consiguieron identificar y capturar a un noble han que viajaba de incógnito, ¡y como rescate sacaron una cantidad exuberante de oro, seda y porcelana!

column2: The treasures of the [offmap_china.GetShortName] shall all be mine!
column3: Tous les trésors de la [offmap_china.GetShortName] seront miens !
column4: Die Reichtümer von [offmap_china.GetShortName] sollen mein sein!

column2: The raiders we sent to the [offmap_china.GetFullName] were set upon by [offmap_china.GetShortName] patrols and slain! Only a single survivor remains, and all he is doing is telling the story of their defeat...
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] ont été attaqués par une patrouille chinoise et décimés ! L'unique survivant revient seulement avec le récit de leur défaite...
column4: Die Truppen, die wir für Überfälle nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] schickten wurden von [offmap_china.GetShortName] gefangen und getötet! Es gibt nur einen einzigen Überlebenden und der einzige Grund dafür ist, dass er die Geschichte ihrer Niederlage erzählen kann...
column6: La lluvia y patrullas de [offmap_china.GetShortName] cayeron sobre los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Solo hay un superviviente, que no hace más que hablar sobre su derrota

column2: Curse it! This must be the work of [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName]...
column4: Verflucht! Das muss das Werk des [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] sein...

column2: When looting [From.GetName] your men discovered a pair of... bears? The black-and-white 'bears' are not very ferocious though, and they spend most of their time fumbling about. They will make grand pets!
column3: Les pilleurs que nous avons envoyés dans l'[offmap_china.GetFullName] sont revenus avec deux... ours ? Ces 'ours' blancs et noirs ne sont pas très féroces cependant, et ils passent leur temps à tâtonner. Ils feraient de majestueux animaux de compagnie !
column4: Die Truppen, die wir nach [offmap_china.GetFullName] auf Überfälle geschickt haben, sind zurückgekehrt. Mit ihnen brachten sie ein Paar... Bären!? Diese schwarz-weißen "Bären" sind allerdings nicht sehr Wild und verbringen die meiste Zeit mit Nichtstun. Sie werden gute Haustiere hergeben!
column6: Han regresado los asaltantes que enviamos al [offmap_china.GetFullName]. Han traído con ellos una pareja de ¿osos? Estos osos blanquinegros no parecen muy feroces y se pasan la mayor parte del tiempo dando vueltas. ¡Serán grandes mascotas!

column2: Our caravan has been camped by the roadside the whole day. The sky has been pouring over us with unusually heavy rain. The whole situation has brought my thoughts to the memories of my late [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName].
column3: Notre caravane campe le long des routes toute la journée. Nous subissons de fortes pluies. Toute cette situation m'a amené à penser à feu m[target_relative.GetOnA] [target_relative.GetRootRelation] [target_relative.GetFirstName].
column4: Unsere Karawane hat den ganzen Tag am Straßenrand verbracht. Der Himmel hat uns mit ungewöhnlich hartem Regen gestraft. Die ganze Situation hat meine Gedanken auf meine[target_relative.GetnMale] verstorbene[target_relative.GetnMale] [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName] gelenkt.
column6: Nuestra caravana lleva todo el día acampada en la cuneta. Está lloviendo con una fuerza inusitada. Esta situación me ha hecho pensar en mi difunto/a [target_relative.GetRootRelation], [target_relative.GetFirstName].

column2: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] was such a pious role model.
column4: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] war so ein Vorbild für alle Frommen.
[target_relative.GetSheHeCap] hat immer aus mysteriöse Weise gearbeitet.

column2: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] was the bravest person I've known.
column3: [target_relative.GetIlElleCap] était la personne la plus brave que j'ai connue.
column4: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] war die tapferste Person die ich kannte.
column6: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] era la persona más valiente que he conocido.

column3: [target_relative.GetIlElleCap] charmait tout le monde avec son sourire.
column6: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] encantaba a todo el mundo con su sonrisa.

column2: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] could always tell right from wrong.
column3: [target_relative.GetIlElleCap] a toujours pu distinguer le bien du mal.
column4: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] konnte immer richtig von falsch unterscheiden.
column6: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] siempre distinguía lo que estaba bien de lo que estaba mal.

column3: [target_relative.GetIlElleCap] a toujours été genti[target_relative.GetLLle] avec moi.

column2: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] was the wisest person I've known.
column3: C'était la personne la plus sage que j'ai connue.
column4: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] war die gebildetste Person die ich kannte.
column6: [target_relative.GetSheHeCap] fue la persona más sabia que he conocido.

column2: You burn incense to honor their memory and step outside to wash away your tears under the crying sky.
column3: Vous brûlez de l'encens pour honorer sa mémoire et sortez masquer vos larmes sous le ciel pluvieux.
column4: Ihr verbrennt Weihrauch, um die Erinnerung zu ehren und geht nach draußen, um unter dem weinenden Himmel Eure Tränen wegzuwischen.
column6: Quemas incienso para honrar su memoria y sales fuera para borrar tus lágrimas con la lluvia.

column2: I can't dwell in the past, I need to carry on forward.
column3: Je ne peux pas rester bloqué dans le passé, je dois avancer.
column4: Ich kann mich nicht in der Vergangenheit verlieren. Ich muss vorwärtsschauen.
column6: No puedo anclarme en el pasado, tengo que seguir adelante.

column2: A rider approached the caravan and handed me a letter with the seal of [target_host.GetBestName]. [target_host.GetFirstName] has heard of my travels and invites our party to rest for a while in the warmth of the [target_host.GetCapitalHolding] [target_host.Capital.Capital.GetName].
column3: Un cavalier s'est approché de la caravane et m'a tendu une lettre avec le sceau [target_host.Get_du_Title][target_host.GetBestName]. [target_host.GetCeluiCelleCap]-ci a entendu parler de mon voyage et nous invite à nous reposer un moment dans un endroit confortable [target_host.GetCapitalHoldingDuDela] de [target_host.Capital.Capital.GetName].
column4: Ein Reiter näherte sich der Karawane und reichte mir einen Brief mit dem Siegel von [target_host.GetBestName]. [target_host.GetFirstName] hat von meiner Reise erfahren und hat uns eingeladen, uns etwas in [target_host.Capital.Capital.GetName] auszuruhen.
column6: Un jinete se acerca a la caravana y me entrega una carta con el sello de [target_host.GetBestName]. [target_host.GetFirstName] ha sabido de mis viajes e invita a nuestra partida a descansar un tiempo en la comodidad de [target_host.GetCapitalHolding] [target_host.Capital.Capital.GetName].

column2: This could prove to be an opportunity to get even.
column3: Ce pourrait être une occasion pour se venger.
column4: Dies könnte eine Gelegenheit sein, um abzurechnen.

column2: You utilize your rival's hospitality to set up a risky murder attempt on them.
column3: Vous vous servez de l'hospitalité de votre rival pour tenter un assassinat risqué.
column4: Ihr nutz die Gastfreundschaft Eures Rivalen, um einen riskanten Mordversuch durchzuführen.
column6: Usas la hospitalidad de tu rival para preparar un arriesgado intento de asesinato.

column2: A warm bed and a hot meal is most welcome.
column3: Je ne dirais pas non à un lit douillet et un repas chaud.
column4: Ein warmes Bett und eine heiße Mahlzeit sind herzlich willkommen.
column6: Una cama cálida y una comida caliente son bien recibidas.

column2: Is my old rival prepared to bury the hatchet?
