You have just received word that the final ships of the Treasure Fleet have been constructed and that the ships that were constructed in more distant areas have arrived at the main fleet. The final supplies are being loaded onto the ships, and before long the soldiers and officials that will be accompanying the Treasure Fleet will begin boarding.

You have just received word that the final ships of the Treasure Fleet have been constructed and that the ships that were constructed in more distant areas have arrived at the main fleet. The final supplies are being loaded onto the ships, and before long you and the other people that will be accompanying the fleet will be allowed to board the ships.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nAs far as anyone on the shore can tell, things are going quite well, and the huge ships are quite imposing, showing everyone that the might of the Middle Kingdom and the Dragon Throne is unparallelled, which should convince anyone the fleet encounters to avoid confrontation and to provide whatever assistance they can.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nAs you are not a common sailor, you do not concern yourself with the work needed to get the fleet in motion, instead doing your best to stay out of the way of the sailors as you take in the sight of the rest of the ships. They truly are imposing, and you feel confident that everyone you encounter during the journey will be suitably impressed.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nAs far as anyone on the shore can tell, things are going quite well, and the huge ships are quite imposing, showing everyone that the might of the Middle Kingdom and the Dragon Throne is unparallelled, which should convince anyone the fleet encounters to avoid confrontation and to provide whatever assistance they can.

You have just received word that the Treasure Fleet has departed at long last. The messenger that brought you this information witnessed it personally, and claims that the departure was largely uneventful, if still a sight to behold.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, the surface of the water splits apart for a moment some distance beyond the most distant ship, and a serpentine dragon with azure scales rises into the air. It flies towards the Treasure Fleet and then circles it several times before turning around and flying off towards the open sea.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, sailors cry out as the water splits apart further away from the shore, and you see a serpentine dragon with azure scales rising into the air. It flies towards the fleet and starts circling it, with an expression that probably is a smile apparent on its face.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, the surface of the water splits apart for a moment some distance beyond the most distant ship, and a serpentine dragon with azure scales rises into the air. It flies towards the Treasure Fleet and then circles it several times before turning around and flying off towards the open sea.

You have just received word that the Treasure Fleet has departed at long last. The messenger that brought you this information witnessed it personally, and claims that an azure dragon paid a visit to the fleet shortly after it had left port, which might imply that the voyage is a blessed one indeed.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, you hear a fearsome roar in the distance. Looking towards it, you see a massive crimson shape flying towards the Treasure Fleet. Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, appears to have taken the Treasure Fleet as a personal affront, as he descends on it and unleashes his fiery breath, setting the ships ablaze.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, you hear a fearsome roar in the distance. Looking towards it, you see a massive crimson shape flying towards the Treasure Fleet. Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, unleashes his fiery breath on the fleet, and your ship and all the others are set ablaze. You try to escape the inferno, but it is not to be.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, you hear a fearsome roar in the distance. Looking towards it, you see a massive crimson shape flying towards the Treasure Fleet. Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, appears to have taken the Treasure Fleet as a personal affront, as he descends on it and unleashes his fiery breath, setting the ships ablaze.

You have just received word that the departure of the Treasure Fleet was met with tragedy. The messenger that brought you this information witnessed the event personally, and he swears that the gargantuan red dragon calling itself Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, descended upon the fleet as it left port, setting the ships ablaze.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, without any warning, one of the ships topples to one side, quickly followed by another, and then another. It seems the fleet was not constructed to handle even the tiniest gust of wind, as it has been destroyed even before it really could get underway.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nThe wind is picking up very slightly, and suddenly one of the ships nearby topples to one side, and before long more ships do the same, including yours. It seems the voyage will be a short one, and you must swim to safety.

Tens of thousands of people from all social classes have gathered to witness the departure of the Treasure Fleet, watching from the shoreline, from various vantage points, and from aboard a number of smaller ships that are not part of the Treasure Fleet.\n\nSuddenly, without any warning, one of the ships topples to one side, quickly followed by another, and then another. It seems the fleet was not constructed to handle even the tiniest gust of wind, as it has been destroyed even before it really could get underway.

You have just received word that the departure of the Treasure Fleet was met with tragedy. The messenger that brought you this information witnessed the event personally, and he tells you that the fleet apparently was so poorly constructed that the first gust of wind saw the ships topple, resulting in the deaths of many of those that were aboard.

The Treasure Fleet's journey towards its next destination has been uneventful so far, and you had expected it to remain that way. However, one seemingly ordinary day everything changes as a large octopus rises from the deeps and begins attacking the fleet with its many tentacles. It seems you have a fight on your hands.

The Treasure Fleet's journey towards its next destination has been uneventful so far, and you had expected it to remain that way. However, one seemingly ordinary day everything changes as a large octopus rises from the deeps and begins attacking the fleet with its many tentacles, with your ship being one of those that have come under attack.

The Treasure Fleet's journey towards its next destination has been uneventful so far, and you had expected it to remain that way. However, one seemingly ordinary day everything changes as a large octopus rises from the deeps and begins attacking the fleet with its many tentacles. Luckily for you, your ship is far enough away to avoid its attacks.
I hope the others can fight it off!

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting, but eventually it is driven off by the brave people aboard the ships that came under attack. Given that it seems to be bleeding quite extensively as it retreats, it will hopefully think twice about returning.

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting, but eventually you and the other brave people aboard the ships that came under attack manage to drive it off. Given that it seems to be bleeding quite extensively as it retreats, it will hopefully think twice about returning.

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting, but eventually it is driven off by the brave people aboard the ships that came under attack. Given that it seems to be bleeding quite extensively as it retreats, it will hopefully think twice about returning.

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting. Several of the ships in the Treasure Fleet are badly damaged by the beast, and a number of them start to sink. The beast does not really pay attention to the crewmembers trying to swim to safety, but even so few manage to avoid drowning.

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting. Several of the ships in the Treasure Fleet are badly damaged by the beast, and a number of them start to sink, yours included. Though the beast does not really seem to be paying attention to you, the other ships do not dare approach..

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and many sailors perish during the fighting. Several of the ships in the Treasure Fleet are badly damaged by the beast, and a number of them start to sink. The beast does not really pay attention to the crewmembers trying to swim to safety, but even so few manage to avoid drowning.

The fight against the giant octopus is fierce, and though the brave people aboard the many ships of the Treasure Fleet give their all it is not enough. Ship after ship goes down, and though the beast does not seem to be paying attention to the people that end up in the water it is too far to the nearest shore for you to manage to reach safety.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has gone down with all hands. Some fishermen that were close enough to see its end claim that an enormous octopus rose from the depths and attacked the fleet, smashing the ships to pieces and either killing those aboard or leaving them to drown.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has gone down with all hands. Some fishermen that were close enough to see its end claim that an enormous octopus rose from the depths and attacked the fleet, smashing the ships to pieces and either killing those aboard or leaving them to drown.

The water beneath the Treasure Fleet is surprisingly clear today, and you take the opportunity to study the wildlife that can be seen below. As you do, you suddenly realize that the bottom of the ocean is not entirely made up of sand or rock like you expected, as there is an enormous eye visible beneath, gazing back at you.

Over the last couple of days the weather has been getting steadily worse, as a storm has been brewing nearby. Though an attempt has been made to avoid it, the Treasure Fleet was unable to do so, and now you will have no choice but to face its fury. Hopefully, the ships are sturdy enough to withstand what is to come.

Over the last couple of days the weather has been getting steadily worse, as a storm has been brewing nearby, and now it is upon the Treasure Fleet. Though some of the ships barely are bothered by it, your ship is not so lucky, as it is struck by lightning and battered by waves, clearly breaking apart under your feet.

Over the last couple of days the weather has been getting steadily worse, as a storm has been brewing nearby, and now it is upon the Treasure Fleet. Your ship manages to keep moving without any real difficulties, but several other ships are not so lucky as they are struck by lighting and battered by waves, eventually sinking beneath the waves.

Over the last couple of days the weather has been getting steadily worse, as a storm has been brewing nearby, and now it is upon the Treasure Fleet. The sailors do all they can to keep the ships intact, but it is not enough, and ship after ship goes down. As you are far away from the shore, swimming to safety proves to be impossible.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has gone down with all hands. It was seen heading directly into a fierce storm, and once the weather cleared only wreckage and bodies remained to be discovered by nearby ships that had managed to avoid the worst of the storm's fury.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has gone down with all hands. It was seen heading directly into a fierce storm, and once the weather cleared only wreckage and bodies remained to be discovered by nearby ships that had managed to avoid the worst of the storm's fury.

Late one evening when you are walking the decks of the ship you are aboard you come across a group of sailors that appear to be about to start dining as a table has been set near where they are standing. They spot you and wave you over, and one of the men offers you a seat at the table, giving you a smile, red and white.

You take a seat at the table and wait for the final preparations for the mean to be completed. You do not have to wait long, and the man that invited you to join the sailors at the table motions for you to start eating, stating that there is no need for formality among friends. The meal is certainly filling, and the meat in particular is quite good.
I hope for more in the future!

The sailors appear somewhat upset to learn that you will not be joining them for their meal, but the man that spoke to you turns to them and calms them down with a gesture. Turning back to you, he suggests that maybe you might share a meal with them in the future, as there are always more seats at the red table.

Almost as soon as you have refused the man's offer the other sailors go for their weapons and move to attack you, with their leader telling you that if you will not share their meal you will have to be part of their meal. You draw your own weapon and fight back, and it is not long before you have cut them cannibals down.

Almost as soon as you have refused the man's offer the other sailors go for their weapons and move to attack you, with their leader telling you that if you will not share their meal you will have to be part of their meal. You draw your own weapon and fight back, hoping to kill the cannibals, but are forced to fall back due to getting wounded.

Almost as soon as you have refused the man's offer the other sailors go for their weapons and move to attack you, with their leader telling you that if you will not share their meal you will have to be part of their meal. You draw your own weapon and fight back, but the cannibals overwhelm you with sheer weight of numbers.

One day when you are taking a walk on the ship you are aboard your feet slip as you step in a small puddle. You try to catch yourself on the railing, but fail to do so, and you drop into the water some distance away from the ship, seemingly without anyone having noticed what happened.
I must swim back to the ship!

You make your way back towards the ship and spot [treasure_fleet_savior.GetBestName] above you. You catch [treasure_fleet_savior.GetHerHis] attention and [treasure_fleet_savior.GetSheHe] offers to toss you a rope to help you to safety, in exchange for a Favor to be repaid at a future date.

You accept the offer made by [treasure_fleet_savior.GetBestName] and [treasure_fleet_savior.GetSheHe] tosses you a rope as [treasure_fleet_savior.GetSheHe] said that [treasure_fleet_savior.GetSheHe] would, and you climb to safety easily enough. Hopefully, the Favor you now owe [treasure_fleet_savior.GetBestName] will not be too much to bear.

You refuse [treasure_fleet_savior.GetBestName]'s offer to help you aboard the ship, unwilling to owe [treasure_fleet_savior.GetHerHim] a Favor, and instead climb up the side of the ship. It is rather difficult, and you start having second thoughts after a while, but eventually you manage to climb all the way to the top without assistance.

You refuse [treasure_fleet_savior.GetBestName]'s offer to help you aboard the ship, unwilling to owe [treasure_fleet_savior.GetHerHim] a Favor, and instead climb up the side of the ship. A wave hits you when you are halfway up, and you lose your grip. Though you try to swim back to the ship again, you are unable to do so.

You make your way back towards the ship and start climbing up the side. It is a difficult climb, as the ship hardly was designed to let someone climb up its side, but you manage to make it all the way back up to the top and then pull yourself to safety. Though the experience was unpleasant, you survived it.

You try to swim back towards the ship, but it is moving rather more quickly than you can swim, and you are unable to reach it. You try to cry out to catch the attention of anyone aboard, but nobody seems to notice you, and none of the other ships are close enough for you to reach them. You keep on swimming until your strength gives out.

Recently you have been spending some time in the company of [treasure_fleet_friend.GetBestName] as the two of you are passengers aboard the same ship, and though you did not know one another very well to begin with [treasure_fleet_friend.GetSheHe] and you have realized that you have a lot in common and that you enjoy each other's company.

Recently you have been spending some time in the company of [From.GetBestName] as the two of you are passengers aboard the same ship, and though you did not know one another very well to begin with [From.GetSheHe] and you have realized that you have a lot in common and that you enjoy each other's company.

The journey from one port to another has given you time to get to others aboard your ship. One of them, [treasure_fleet_lover.GetBestName], is a rather fascinating [treasure_fleet_lover.GetManWoman], and you have found yourself enjoying [treasure_fleet_lover.GetHerHis] company quite a bit. Lately, you have been wondering if you should try for something more with [treasure_fleet_lover.GetHerHim].
I will do no such thing!

You have spent quite some time in the company of [From.GetBestName] recently, and the two of you have generally gotten along quite well. Even so, it is somewhat surprising when [From.GetSheHe] one day suggests that perhaps the two of you should find someplace private so that you might get to know one another more intimately.

[From.GetBestName] informs you that [From.GetSheHe] has no interest in getting to know you more intimately, and suggests that you drop the matter so that the two of you can pretend that it never was brought up in the first place.

[From.GetBestName] is quite open to the suggestion that the two of you should find someplace private to get to know one another far more intimately. Some time later, after a rather enjoyable series of events, you find yourself wondering whether you should try to sneak off somewhere with [From.GetBestName] again in the future.
Let's not make a habit of it...

You and [From.GetBestName] find an empty cabin easily enough and spend some rather enjoyable time together. As the two of you start getting dressed again [From.GetSheHe] tells you that [From.GetSheHe] looks forward to the next time the two of you can meet in private, and you find yourself looking forward to it as well.

You and [From.GetBestName] find an empty cabin easily enough and spend some rather enjoyable time together. As the two of you start getting dressed again [From.GetSheHe] tells you that [From.GetSheHe] had a wonderful time but that it probably is a good idea for the two of you not to make a habit out of it.

Though you do not mind the company of most of the people aboard your ship [treasure_fleet_rival.GetBestName] is not someone whose company is remotely enjoyable. [treasure_fleet_rival.GetSheHeCap] always gets on your nerves, always contradicts you over even the smallest thing, and is thoroughly unpleasant to have to deal with.
I hope [treasure_fleet_rival.GetSheHe] falls off the ship!

Though you do not mind the company of most of the people aboard your ship [From.GetBestName] is not someone whose company is remotely enjoyable. [From.GetSheHeCap] always gets on your nerves, always contradicts you over even the smallest thing, and is thoroughly unpleasant to have to deal with.
I hope [From.GetSheHe] falls off the ship!

You are having trouble falling asleep one night and decide to take a walk along the deck of the ship. As you exit onto the deck you spot [treasure_fleet_rival_to_kill.GetBestName] standing near the railing some distance away. Your hated rival does not appear to have noticed your presence, and [treasure_fleet_rival_to_kill.GetHerHis] position looks quite precarious.

You are standing at the railing of the ship late one evening, looking out over the water and pondering various matters when you suddenly feel a hand on your back. Before you can react you are pushed over the railing and into the water below. You are not sure who your attacker was, and right now you need to focus on getting to safety.
I need to get back aboard!

You manage to swim back to the ship and climb your way back aboard without too much difficulty. Taking a look around, you do not see anyone else, so your attacker probably saw fit to slip away while you were getting back to the ship, and their identity remains unknown to you.
I need to watch my back...

Doing your best to stay out of sight, you watch as [From.GetBestName] climbs back onto the ship. As best you can tell, [From.GetSheHe] is unaware that it was you who sent [From.GetHerHim] into the water, but even so [From.GetSheHe] is likely to be on [From.GetHerHis] guard from now on, making further attempts on [From.GetHerHis] life far riskier.

You try to swim back to the ship, but it is moving more quickly than you can swim, and thus you keep getting further and further away. Though you cry out for help and hope that someone aboard one of the other ships will notice you, nobody comes to your rescue, and as you are quite far from the nearest shore you know that you will not survive.

[From.GetBestName] did not spot you when you pushed [From.GetHerHim] over the railing, and [From.GetSheHe] also did not notice that you were watching as [From.GetSheHe] failed to swim back to the ship. You do not see [From.GetHerHim] drown as the fleet is moving too quickly, but you are still quite satisfied with the outcome.

You are standing at the railing of the ship late one evening, looking out over the water and pondering various matters when you suddenly feel a hand on your back. You manage to turn around to see that the hand belongs to [From.GetBestName] before [From.GetSheHe] gives you a push and sends you over the railing and into the water below.
I need to get back aboard!

You manage to swim back to the ship and climb your way back aboard without too much difficulty. [FromFrom.GetBestName] is nowhere to be seen, as [FromFrom.GetSheHe] apparently saw fit to leave while you were in the water, and with no witnesses around it is unlikely to be possible to get [FromFrom.GetHerHim] locked up.

Doing your best to stay out of sight, you watch as [From.GetBestName] climbs back onto the ship. [From.GetSheHeCap] saw you push [From.GetHerHim] into the water, and thus [From.GetSheHe] likely will be on [From.GetHerHis] guard from now on, particularly around you, making further attempts on [From.GetHerHis] life far riskier.
That did not go as planned...

You try to swim back to the ship, but it is moving more quickly than you can swim, and thus you keep getting further and further away. Though you cry out for help and hope that someone aboard one of the other ships will notice you, nobody comes to your rescue, and as you are quite far from the nearest shore you know that you will not survive.

[From.GetBestName] spotted you when you pushed [From.GetHerHim] over the railing, which might have been a problem if [From.GetSheHe] had managed to make [From.GetHerHis] way back to the ship. Luckily for you, that did not happen, and though you do not see [From.GetHerHim] drown as the fleet is moving too quickly you are still quite satisfied.

You are standing at the railing of the ship late one evening, looking out over the water and pondering various matters when you suddenly feel a hand on your back. The hand gives you a push, clearly attempting to send you over the railing, but you avoid falling into the water. Your assailant manages to vanish before you can catch up.

Your attempt to push [From.GetBestName] overboard did not work out, and [From.GetSheHe] nearly saw you as you hurried away after the failed attempt. You manage to get inside and into hiding before [From.GetBestName] managed to catch up to you, and [From.GetSheHe] is unlikely to know for certain that it was you who attacked [From.GetHerHim].

You are standing at the railing of the ship late one evening, looking out over the water and pondering various matters when you suddenly feel a hand on your back. The hand gives you a push, clearly attempting to send you over the railing, but you manage to stay aboard the ship. Turning around, you can see [From.GetBestName] running away from you.

Your attempt to push [From.GetBestName] overboard did not work out, and [From.GetSheHe] managed to see you as you hurried away, as evident by the fact that [From.GetSheHe] cursed your name. Luckily for you, [From.GetBestName] was too preoccupied to give chase, and with no witnesses to support [From.GetHerHim] you are unlikely to get locked up.

You are standing at the railing of the ship late one evening, looking out over the water and pondering various matters when you hear someone moving up behind you. You quickly dodge out of the way as [From.GetBestName] attempts to push you over the railing. You take the opportunity to return the favor, sending [From.GetHerHim] into the water below.

You attempt to sneak up on [From.GetBestName] to push [From.GetHerHim] over the railing, but as you draw close [From.GetSheHe] suddenly turns around and gives you a smile as [From.GetSheHe] dodges out of the way. Surprised by this development, you are caught off balance, and as a result you are sent over the railing and into the water below.
I must get back to safety!

[FromFrom.GetBestName] is nowhere to be seen when you climb back onto the ship, but you are certain that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] will be keeping [FromFrom.GetHerHis] guard up around you from now on and that any further attack you make is even less likely to succeed. Even worse, [From.GetSheHe] might seek to strike at you first.
This really did not go as planned...

You watch as [From.GetBestName] swims back towards the ship and make sure that you disappear from sight before [From.GetSheHe] has climbed back aboard. It seems your attacker will remain alive and that [From.GetSheHe] might trouble you again in the future, but at least you managed to foil this particular attempt on your life.
At least I know who to watch...

You try to swim back to the ship, but it is moving more quickly than you can swim, and thus you keep getting further and further away. Though you cry out for help and hope that someone aboard one of the other ships will notice you, nobody comes to your rescue, and as you are quite far from the nearest shore you know that you will not survive.

You watch as [From.GetBestName] attempts to swim back to the ship, quite pleased to notice that [From.GetSheHe] is getting further and further away from it. [From.GetSheHeCap] is still alive when you lose sight of [From.GetHerHim], but you are confident that [From.GetSheHe] will not manage to reach safety.

One day you notice a school of dolphins a short distance away from your ship. They do not seem to be paying you or the Treasure Fleet much attention, and instead seem preoccupied with making small jumps above the waves for some unknown reason. Whatever the reason migth be, they put on quite the show.

You are taking a walk across the deck of your ship and decide to head to the stern to get a closer look at some interesting clouds behind you. However, when you get to the stern you notice movement in the water behind the ship and forget all about the clouds as you notice that there are several rather large sharks following the ship.

One day when you look down into the water beneath the ship you spot a large number of turtles swimming past, several of them quite large. As best you can tell they do not seem to care about the ships above their heads, and you suppose that they have little reason to concern themselves with such things.
I wonder where they are going...

Your ship has been sent some distance away from the main body of the Treasure Fleet to scout, and though you had not expected to find anything interesting you discover a drifting ship. As best you can tell, it is largely intact, but there is no crew to be seen, which is quite odd as it hardly coudl sail itself.

You order your ship to move closer to the other ship and jump across alongside several of the sailors, weapons at the ready. The drifting ship is much smaller than your ship, so it does not take you long to search every part of it for its crew, but there does not appear to be anyone present.

You order your ship to move closer to the other ship and jump across alongside several of the sailors, weapons at the ready. The drifting ship is much smaller than your ship, so it does not take you long to search every part of it for its crew, and eventually you find a pile of bodies in one of the rooms.

You order your ship to move closer to the other ship and jump across alongside several of the sailors, weapons at the ready. The drifting ship is much smaller than your ship, so it does not take you long to search every part of it for its crew. Suddenly, a man bearing a wicked sword drops down from the ceiling right in front of you.

The man laughs as he attacks you and the sailors with you, and his attacks are quite fierce. However, once the initial surprise wears off you have little trouble defending yourself, and it is not long before he has been overwhelmed and killed. Once he has been dealt with the search continues, but there is nobody else aboard the ship.

The man laughs as he attacks you and the sailors with you, and his attacks are quite fierce. You take a few rather minor wounds before the surprise wears off, but once it does you and the others manage to kill your assailant. Once he has been dealt with the search continues, but there is nobody else aboard the ship.

The man laughs as he attacks you and the sailors with you, and his attacks are quite fierce. You and the others struggle quite a bit to fight back, and you take a rather nasty wound before one of the sailors finally cuts the man down. Once he has been dealt with the search continues, but there is nobody else aboard the ship.

The man laughs as he attacks you and the sailors with you, and his attacks are quite fierce. Several of the sailors go down before they really notice that he is there, and though you do your best to fight back he overcomes your defenses and manages to inflict a mortal wound.

Your ship has been sent some distance away from the main body of the Treasure Fleet to scout, and though you had not expected to find anything interesting you come across a small island that does not appear on any of the maps you have seen. Perhaps there is something to be discovered on it, seeing as it does not appear to be well known.

You order your ship to drop its anchor and for a boat to be readied to bring you and some of the sailors ashore. It does not take you long to investigate the entirety of the island, and to your surprise you discover a rather unusual item atop a small pedestal on top of a small hill, which you claim as your own.

You order your ship to drop its anchor and for a boat to be readied to bring you and some of the sailors ashore. It does not take you long to investigate the entirety of the island, and on the opposite shore from where you came ashore you find the skeleton of a past explorer, clutching a strange map.

You order your ship to drop its anchor and for a boat to be readied to bring you and some of the sailors ashore. It does not take you long to investigate the entirety of the island, and there does not appear to be anything particularly noteworthy on it. Perhaps this explains why nobody ever bothered to put it on a map.
Let's get back to the ship!

One evening you notice some storm clouds in the distance. You are about to turn away from them after concluding that they are too distant to be a concern when you see what looks like a ship beneath the clouds. It is too distant to tell for sure, but it almost looks as if it is hovering above the water...

One day the lookouts call out that there are many sails on the horizon. You spot the ships easily enough now that you are aware of their presence, and it soon becomes clear that they mean to intercept the Treasure Fleet. They are unlikely to have good intentions in mind, so it is time to sound a call to arms.

One day the lookouts call out that there are many sails on the horizon. You spot the ships easily enough now that you are aware of their presence. It is clear that they mean to intercept the Treasure Fleet. Several of the approaching ships are bearing down on your ship, and you realize that you need to arm yourself without further delay.

One day the lookouts call out that there are many sails on the horizon. You spot the ships easily enough now that you are aware of their presence. It is clear that they mean to intercept the Treasure Fleet. Your ship is distant enough from them that you are unlikely to come under attack, but you will also be unable to help the other ships fight back.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and at first it seems as if they will overwhelm the defenders aboard the ships that were attacked. However, the defenders manage to rally and soon send the attackers on their way, with several of the hostile ships sinking as they try to get to safety.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and at first it seems as if they will overwhelm you and the other attackers, but you fight on and repulse them in the end. Many of the enemy ships get away to safety, but some of them are sunk in the attempt, and it is unlikely that the attackers will be eager to return.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and at first it seems as if they will overwhelm the defenders aboard the ships that were attacked. However, the defenders manage to rally and soon send the attackers on their way, with several of the hostile ships sinking as they try to get to safety.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and though the defenders aboard the ships that were attacked fight back they are unable to repel the attackers. One after the other, the ships that have come under attack start sinking, with the surviving defenders trying to swim to safety. Luckily enough, the attackers see fit to fall back at that point.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and though the defenders aboard your ship and the others that have come under attack try to repel them you are unable to do so. Even worse, your ship is badly damaged in the fighting, and it soon becomes clear that it is going to sink, and with the attackers nearby you will have to swim quite far to get to safety.

The unknown attackers fight hard, and though the defenders aboard the ships that were attacked fight back they are unable to repel the attackers. One after the other, the ships that have come under attack start sinking, with the surviving defenders trying to swim to safety. Luckily enough, the attackers see fit to fall back at that point.

Your ship and all the others in the Treasure Fleet soon find several enemy ships close enough to them that the attackers can leap across, and though you put up a vailiant defense it is not enough as the attackers both are well armed and outnumber you by a wide margin. Some of the defenders try to surrender, but the attackers cut them down.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. One of your agents who has been monitoring a large group of pirates for you has reported that the pirates in question attacked the Treasure Fleet, and though they took some losses they still managed to destroy the fleet.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. One of your agents who has been monitoring a large group of pirates for you has reported that the pirates in question attacked the Treasure Fleet, and though they took some losses they still managed to destroy the fleet.

One of the supply ships that was part of the Treasure Fleet apparently was rather poorly constructed, as it starts breaking apart without warning one morning. It is impossible to salvage the ship, and though the crew and some of the supplies are saved quite a bit of food is impossible to recover.

The Treasure Fleet carries with it some of the many wonders of the Middle Kingdom, including fireworks. Despite orders to avoid bringing fire near them it seems that not everyone has been paying attention, as shouts of panic can be heard from one of the ships before it suddenly explodes, taking several other ships with it.

The Treasure Fleet carries with it some of the many wonders of the Middle Kingdom, including fireworks. You would have expected the sailors not to bring fire near them, but it seems that they have failed to do so as you suddenly feel the deck shudder beneath your feet and hear the unmistakeable sound of fireworks going off.

The Treasure Fleet carries with it some of the many wonders of the Middle Kingdom, including fireworks. Despite orders to avoid bringing fire near them it seems that not everyone has been paying attention, as shouts of panic can be heard from one of the ships before it suddenly explodes, taking several other ships with it.

The Treasure Fleet carries with it some of the many wonders of the Middle Kingdom, including fireworks, and despite orders not to bring fire near them some fool has done so. You barely have time to react before the ship starts coming apart beneath your feet, and the flying debris manages to set other ships ablaze, with predictable consequences.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. Several fishermen that saw what happened have reported that something exploded aboard one of the ships, and that this explosion soon was followed by similar explosions on the other ships.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. Several fishermen that saw what happened have reported that something exploded aboard one of the ships, and that this explosion soon was followed by similar explosions on the other ships.

The Treasure Fleet was unable to resupply as extensively as it needed to at the last ports it visited, and as a result strict rationing has been ordered throughout the fleet. Though you and the other important people aboard have been given more food than many of the crewmembers get, you are still not getting as much as you are used to.

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the southern coast of the Korean Peninsula, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough the peninsula is close to the traditional heartland of the Middle Kingdom and some customs in the area resemble Chinese customs, the Dragon Throne has historically not had an easy time extending its influence in the region, with several campaigns ending in failure and the Sui dynasty collapsing following such a failed campaign, so though the Treasure Fleet is sizeable it is unlikely to intimidate the Korean people.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has entered the Seto Inland Sea and is now making its way towards its northern end, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThe Land of the Rising Sun has at times been influenced by the customs of the Middle Kingdom, but as the Shinto religion is deeply connected to life in the region the area maintains its distinct customs and traditions. It is whispered that any attempt to invade the islands would be met with a Divine Wind, and the honorable warriors making their home in the islands would also be likely to resist any attemt to subjugate them.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way south through along the Ryukyuan Islands, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough many would consider these islands a backwater, there are legends that whisper that the Three Mountains are destinied to rule the world, and perhaps the Treasure Fleet should take care not to upset the inhabitants as a result, even though they might not seem particularly threatening to a force of such a size.
I should spend some time ashore...
I should spend some time ashore...

The main body of the Treasure Fleet has entered the Bay of Maynila, though several ships are approaching other areas nearby at the same time, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThe people in the area have at times been interested in trade with the Middle Kingdom, though it has not always been extensive, and as the inhabitants traditionally have been influenced by both Indian traditions and native practices unlike anything found in the Middle Kingdom those travelling with the Treasure Fleet should probably not expect everyone in the area to be willing to appease the Dragon Throne.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the western coast of Borneo, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough a relative backwater compared to many other areas nearby, it is possible that the people in this area will be able to offer something of interest to the Middle Kingdom, or that they will be interested in something that the Treasure Fleet has offered, so it is perhaps unsurprising that it has decided to ignore the expected route along the Cham coast.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the Cham coast, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThis area has historically been south of where the influence of the Dragon Throne can be felt, partially because the people in the area usually have embraced Hinduism and other religions not generally found in the Middle Kingdom, though as the Silk Road passes through the region it is still not uncommon to find people in the area that care about the state of affairs in China, and also not uncommon for the Dragon Throne to take an interest in the region.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the mouth of the Chao Praya River, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough somewhat out of the way from where the main branch of the maritime Silk Road is located, the area is still not a backwater, and thus it is not really surprising that the fleet has seen fit to visit the region, particularly as the fact that Chinese interests rarely are seen to in the region means that there might be more opportunities in the area than there might be elsewhere.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the tip of the Malay Peninsula, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs the maritime Silk Road passes through the nearby Strait of Malacca, it is hardly surprising that the Treasure Fleet visits the area, particularly not when one of its main purposes is to ensure that the people along this trade route know that the Dragon Throne's reach is long and that it would be foolish to risk its displeasure.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the southern part of Sumatra, with several ship approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough the cities in the area are of lesser importance as far as the Silk Road goes than others towards the northern end of the island, they are still fairly influential as far as trade in the region goes, and as the attention of the Dragon Throne often has not been focused on the region it is perhaps a good thing that the Treasure Fleet has seen fit to visit, as there might be opportunities in the region that have been neglected.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way along the coast of Java, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nBeing further south and east than the main part of the Silk Road, the island has often not received attention from the Dragon Throne, but now they are under the gaze of its representatives, and though those representatives should be aware that they are quite far from home and thus not as influential as they normally would be it would still be quite unwise to mistreat them.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the northern part of Sumatra, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs the part of the island that is closest to India, it is unsurprising that many traders can be found in the area, some of them even hailing for ports in distant Arabia, and since the trade in question often involves silk the merchants and rulers in the area are quite likely to have an interest in the state of the Middle Kingdom and in not upsetting the Dragon Throne.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the mouth of the Ayeyarwady River, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough much of the trade along the Silk Road does not pass through the area, seeing as it is more convenient for merchants to travel directly from Sumatra or the Tibetan plateau to India, some merchants still see fit to visit the area, and it would probably be unwise for the locals not to behave now that they are under the eyes of the representatives of the Dragon Throne.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the Bay of Bengal, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs the Ganges, sacred to the Hindu religion, exists into this bay, the area has been important for well over a thousand years, and though the Hindu religion generally has not been a concern for the Dragon Throne the fact that there are many Buddhist holy sites near the river means that there are a significant number of people in the Middle Kingdom that care about what goes on in the region.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way along the eastern coast of India, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs many ports in the area are visited by merchants trading along the Silk Road, it is likely that the state of the Middle Kingdom is of interest for a good number of the locals, and the Dragon Throne also has an interest in ensuring that they know that they are not beyond its reach, something they would be wise to remember at this time in particular.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the southern tip of India, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs every ship journeying further east or further west has to move past this region, the ports here are quite active, and it is unlikely that the Middle Kingdom is the only distant realm that has an interest in what goes on in the region, and though many of them would be unable to act on anything in the region they take issue with the presence of the Treasure Fleet should make it abundantly clear that the Dragon Throne's reach is greater than most.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way along the western coast of India, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nThough some merchants trading in both Arabia and India cross the Indian Ocean instead of following the coast, the perils of such a journey are not something that everyone is willing to contemplate, and thus the ports in the area tend to be quite busy. As should be evident from the Treasure Fleet's presence, they are also not beyond the reach of the Dragon THrone, unlike what the locals might have expected.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the mouth of the Indus, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs some of the overland portions of the Silk Road connect to the maritime Silk Road in this region, there are many traders here that care about what goes on in the Middle Kingdom, and the Treasure Fleet's presence should make it clear that the Dragon Throne also has an interest in the region, even if it might not have been apparent to everyone prior the fleet's arrival.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the eastern tip of the Arabian Peninsula, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs merchants on their way to India from the Persian Gulf have to journey past this region and many of those from other places further west elect to follow the coast rather than journeying across the Indian Ocean the region is quite busy, and since Muslim pilgrims on the Hajj also might be passing by there are also other travellers present to witness the arrival of the Treasure Fleet.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the innermost end of the Persian Gulf, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nMany great empires have sought to control the region historically, seeing as there is a considerable amount of trade in the region and that the Mesopotamian region is known for its fertility, so it has always been of some importance, and now it seems that the Middle Kingdom has taken an interest in the region as well.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet has arrived off the Horn of Africa, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nVessels from both the Red Sea and from various cities down the eastern coast of Africa are present to witness the arrival of the Treasure Fleet, doubtlessly impressed by the mighty ships carrying the representatives of the Dragon Throne, and anyone in the region that previously thought that they might be beyond the reach of the Dragon should now know that that reach is longer than they previously had assumed.
I should spend some time ashore...

The Treasure Fleet is making its way towards the innermost end of the Red Sea, with several ships approaching each major port in the region, bringing with them people and goods from the Middle Kingdom.\n\nAs the region is in close proximity to the Muslim holy cities of Mecca and Medina there are many pilgrims in the region when the Treasure Fleet arrives, and it is possible that many of them view the presence of the fleet as a potential threat to their holy places even though the Treasure Fleet and the Middle Kingdom primarily is interested in trade in the region.
I should spend some time ashore...

A group of would-be settlers travelling with the Treasure Fleet have submitted a petition asking for permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName]. They claim to posses knowledge that would be of use to you, but it is possible that they might not be completely honest.
They could be useful to me...
I don't think I want them...

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been hard at work proving their usefulness to you and your realm. You have just received word that they have finished the construction of a paper mill, and that they have pledged to do government work for you at a discount.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been hard at work proving their usefulness to you and your realm. You have just received word that they have finished the construction of a fireworks guild, and that they have promised a performance in your honor.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been hard at work proving their usefulness to you and your realm. You have just received word that they have finished the construction of some dry docks, and that they have pledged to help you with your shipbuilding needs at a discount.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been hard at work proving their usefulness to you and your realm. You have just received word that they have finished the construction of an administrative outpost, and that they have already presented several ideas for how this might be of use for you.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been hard at work proving their usefulness to you and your realm. You have just received word that they have finished the construction of a blast furnace, and that they have pledged to give priority to any work you see fit to give them.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have been nothing but trouble since they arrived. Several of them have been jailed due to criminal behaviour, and they seem to think that the locals are beneath them, which predictably has upset your long-term subjects.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have sparked quite a bit of curiousity among the population regarding their customs, and they have proven more than willing to tell the locals all about the [tf_settler_province.Religion.GetName] faith, and quite a few of the locals have seen fit to convert.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] have sparked quite a bit of curiousity among the population regarding their customs, and they have proven more than willing to tell the locals all about [tf_settler_province.Culture.GetName] customs, and many of the locals have adopted them.

The settlers you granted permission to settle in [tf_settler_province.GetName] seem to be fitting in quite nicely. So far, they have not been causing any trouble, and the worst anyone could say about them is that they might not yet have proven themselves to be particularly useful to you or your realm.
At least they're not causing trouble...

The Chinese officials that have accompanied the Treasure Fleet make no secret of the fact that they view you and your people as far beneath them. Given that the fleet is far from home and that its members likely are overconfident, it might be possible to teach them a lesson by launching an attack on the fleet.
This is not a good idea...

Your forces set sail under the cover of darkness, with detailed plans in place for how they will approach the Treasure Fleet and deal with its defenders. Unfortunately, it seems that the fleet's defenders are not as overconfident as you had expected, as they spot the approaching ships and easily repel the attack.

One night the Treasure Fleet comes under attack from several ships bearing the flag of [From.GetBestName]. Luckily enough, the defenders are vigilant enough to spot the attackers before they get close, and thus they have little difficulty repelling the attack.
We need to look to our defenses...

One night the Treasure Fleet comes under attack from several ships bearing the flag of [From.GetBestName]. Luckily enough, the defenders are vigilant enough to spot the attackers before they get close, and thus they have little difficulty repelling the attack.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has come under attack from [From.GetBestName]. It seems the attack was rather unsuccessful, as [From.GetSheHe] clearly underestimated the might of the Dragon Throne, but the fact that there was an attack in the first place is quite concerning.

Your forces set sail under the cover of darkness, with detailed plans in place for how they will approach the Treasure Fleet and deal with its defenders. Though the defenders on some of the ships are able to prevent your soldiers from getting close, several ships are still set ablaze, proving that you are not to be dismissed out of hand.

One night the Treasure Fleet comes under attack from several ships bearing the flag of [From.GetBestName]. It seems the sentries that had been posted were not as vigilant as they should have been, as the attackers got close to many of the ships without being spotted, and as a result the ships in question are now ablaze.
We need to look to our defenses...

One night the Treasure Fleet comes under attack from several ships bearing the flag of [From.GetBestName]. It seems the sentries that had been posted were not as vigilant as they should have been, as the attackers got close to many of the ships without being spotted, and as a result the ships in question are now ablaze.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has come under attack from [From.GetBestName]. The attack was not entirely unsuccessful, so [From.GetSheHe] might now be even more emboldened to stand up to the Dragon Throne, and the fact that there was an attack in the first place is quite concerning.

You spend some time planning out the attack on the Treasure Fleet, knowing that a failed attack could be something you would end up regretting, and the planning pays off as the fleet is set ablaze down to the last ship. Anyone that makes it to the shore will be rounded up and brought before you in chains so that you may judge them as you wish.

One night you are awakened by the sound of fighting nearby. You quickly get dressed and head outside with your weapon ready, discovering that your ship and all the others are under attack by forces loyal to [From.GetBestName]. It is clear that the fighting is not going to go your way, as several ships are already ablaze.
I will try to get ashore, come what may...

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has come under attack from [From.GetBestName], and though the sailors and soldiers of the Treasure Fleet reportedly fought valiantly the attack was a complete success. Every last ship was set ablaze, and anyone that survived is doubtlessly chained up in a prison cell at this point.

Word has reached you that the Treasure Fleet has come under attack from [From.GetBestName], and though the sailors and soldiers of the Treasure Fleet reportedly fought valiantly the attack was a complete success. Every last ship was set ablaze, and anyone that survived is doubtlessly chained up in a prison cell at this point.

In order to ensure the continuing prosperity and stability of your realm it might be beneficial to enter into a tributary agreement with the Middle Kingdom, seeing you clearly are within its reach. Some of the officials aboard the Treasure Fleet should be able to help with the necessary paperwork.
Such a relationship would be good!

A petition has arrived from [From.GetBestName], requesting that you help [From.GetHerHim] with the necessary paperwork to set up a tributary agreement between [From.GetHerHim] and the Dragon Throne. Given that the matter will have to be decided without input from the Dragon Throne, it is up to you to accept or refuse the proposal.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], carrying with him detailed paperwork outlining a tributary agreement between you and the Dragon Throne. Some of the details might not have been quite what you expected initially, but it is still an overall acceptable agreement, so you see no reason to object.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], carrying with him a very detailed list of reasons for why you are unworthy of paying tribute to the Dragon Throne. Given how extensive the list is, it seems quite futile to try to convince [From.GetHerHim] that you actually are worthy of such an agreement.

With the Treasure Fleet just off the coast it is clear that the Dragon Throne has an interest in your realm, and thus it might be a good idea to ensure that the Middle Kingdom thinks highly of you. A small gift of gold presented to an official accompanying the Treasure Fleet could probably accomplish this.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], bringing a large amount of gold that is being offered in return for you making sure that the Dragon Throne looks favorably on [From.GetHerHim]. If desirable, it would be trivial to ensure that the money got misplaced without anyone noticing, should you wish to keep it for yourself.
I accept the money, for the Dragon Throne!
I accept the money, for myself!

The messenger you sent to the Treasure Fleet has returned, bringing word that [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to accept your offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne. It is possible that the money will end up in [From.GetHerHim] pockets, of course, but as long as the Dragon Throne regards you more highly that would not be a problem.

The messenger you sent to the Treasure Fleet has returned, bringing word that [From.GetBestName] refused your offer, and that the refusal was worded in a way that made it clear that it would be foolhardy to try to make the same offer to someone else, particularly as it then might look like attempted bribery.

With the Treasure Fleet just off the coast it is clear that the Dragon Throne has an interest in your realm, and thus it might be a good idea to ensure that the Middle Kingdom thinks highly of you. You could offer to gift an artifact to one of the officials accompanying the fleet in exchange for help with that..

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], bringing an aftifact that is being offered in exchange for your help in ensuring that the Dragon Throne thinks more highly of [From.GetBestName]. The artifact does not look like something that would be worth passing on to the Dragon Throne, but it might still be useful for you..
I have no use for such trinkets!

The messenger you sent to the Treasure Fleet has returned, bringing word that [From.GetBestName] has seen fit to accept the artifact you offered in exchange for ensuring that the Dragon Throne thinks more highly of you. It is perhaps not appealing to part with such an item at most times, but this time it was likely worth it.

The messenger you sent to the Treasure Fleet has returned, bringing word that [From.GetBestName] refused your offer as the artifact being offered was viwed as nothing but a paltry triket. It seems the people of the Middle Kingdom possibly have more expensive or more specific tastes than you had anticipated.

You have had the opportunity to meet with several minor officials accompanying the Treasure Fleet over the course of the last few days, and though they do not believe in [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] or the [Root.Religion.GetName] you have come to realize that you still agree with them on many points.
They can't be all that bad...

Though most of the people accompanying the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom there are those that have other plans. One of them, [new_tf_character.GetBestName], has requested permission to join your court. Supposedly a soldier by trade, his skills might be useful to you in the future, should you find yourself at war.

Though most of the people accompanying the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom there are those that have other plans. One of them, [new_tf_character.GetBestName], has requested permission to join your court. Supposedly a eunuch at the wrong side of some court intrigue, he might be able to help administer your realm.

Though most of the people accompanying the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom there are those that have other plans. One of them, [new_tf_character.GetBestName], has requested permission to join your court. Calling herself a courtesan, she certainly has the beauty and grace to back up that claim.

Though most of the people accompanying the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom there are those that have other plans. One of them, [new_tf_character.GetBestName], has requested permission to join your court. Supposedly a scholar of some small fame, he could perhaps be of use to you.

Though most of the people accompanying the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom there are those that have other plans. One of them, [new_tf_character.GetBestName], has requested permission to join your court. Supposedly a minor noble down on [new_tf_character.GetHerHis] luck, [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] could perhaps prove interesting.

The people of [tf_tech_spread_province.GetName] seem to be learning quite a bit from the sailors, soldiers, and officials accompanying the Treasure Fleet. Word has reached you that many new ideas concerning infantry combat are being discussed in various taverns, and most of them seem quite good based on the information you have received.

The people of [tf_tech_spread_province.GetName] seem to be learning quite a bit from the sailors, soldiers, and officials accompanying the Treasure Fleet. Word has reached you that many new ideas concerning mounted combat are being discussed in various taverns, and most of them seem quite good based on the information you have received.
