The people of [tf_tech_spread_province.GetName] seem to be learning quite a bit from the sailors, soldiers, and officials accompanying the Treasure Fleet. Word has reached you that many new ideas concerning legal matters are being discussed in various taverns, and most of them seem quite good based on the information you have received.

The officials journeying with the Treasure Fleet are doubtlessly eager to step ashore now that the fleet once more has made landfall, and though some of them certainly might be content to merely spend some time in a marketplace or tavern it is quite likely that others would not. Perhaps you should invite some to a small feast?

A messenger has arrived, bringing with him an invitation to a small feast being arranged in honor of the Treasure Fleet by [From.GetBestName]. It is likely that various local people of note will be present as well, so if you wish to meet such individuals it would probably be a good idea to accept the invitation.

THe messenger you sent to the Treasure Fleet has returned, bringing word that all of the officials he spoke to refused your invitation. Apparently, the people of the Middle Kingdom would rather spend their time resting, or visiting brothels, or the like than meet with notables in port, even though the latter supposedly is why they are here.
What could possibly be more important?

Though not every official that received an invitation to your feast accepted the invitation, quite a few did, and your servants have been hard at work preparing for the feast. As the guests arrive, most of them seem fairly interested in their surroundings, and as best you can tell they are not displeased by what they see.

You and some other officials from the Treasure Fleet depart to the feast being arranged by [From.GetBestName] together, curious about what a local feast is going to be like. Upon arrival, it is clear that your initial expectations were set a bit low, as the place is beautifully decorated and the food smells quite intriguing.
This could turn out quite nicely!

You make sure to spend some time with each of the guests from the Treasure Fleet, as one would expect from a good host, but as the evening progresses you eventually end up spending quite a bit more time in the company of [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName] than most, as [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] has turned out to be a very interesting person.
We have a lot in common!

Your host, [From.GetBestName], spends some time with each of [From.GetHerHis] guests, which is only fitting, but as the evening progresses the two of you end up spending more time in each other's company than [From.GetSheHe] spends with any other guest. To your great surprise and pleasure, [From.GetSheHe] is a very interesting individual.
We have a lot in common!

You make sure to spend some time with each of the guests from the Treasure Fleet, as one would expect from a good host. It quickly becomes apparent that [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName] is not someone you will enjoy spending time with, and as the evening progresses you become convinced that it was a mistake to invite [tf_feast_event_target.GetHerHim].

Your host, [From.GetBestName], spends some time with each of [From.GetHerHis] guests, which is only fitting, but [From.GetSheHe] is being quite rude in your opinion and is treating you much worse than [From.GetSheHe] treats everyone else. As the evening progresses you become more and more convinced you never should have accepted the invitation.

As the evening progresses you find yourself fascinated by [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName], a most exotic [tf_feast_event_target.GetManWoman]. [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHeCap] seems to be interested in you as well, and it would probably be easy for the two of you to head off someplace private if that was desirable for the both of you.
Can I show you my bedroom?
I have to go speak to someone else!

[From.GetBestName] is a rather fascinating host, and [From.GetSheHe] has been finding excuses to speak to you time and time again during the evening. As such, it is not entirely surprising when [From.GetSheHe] suggests that perhaps you would like to see [From.GetHerHis] bedroom, with clear implications as to what that entails.
Yes, I would like to see your bedroom!
What kind of person do you take me for?

[From.GetBestName] takes several steps away from you when you make your suggestion, telling you that you must have mistaken [From.GetHerHim] for some other and far less morally upright person. You attempt to salvage the situation, but [From.GetSheHe] quickly finds an excuse to leave your presence, and avoids you for the rest of the evening.

[From.GetBestName] is quite receptive to your offer to show [From.GetHerHim] your bedroom, and the two of you quietly slip away from the others at the feast and head off elsewhere. Much later, you find yourself wondering if you should make an attempt to turn this into something lasting or if it perhaps would be too much trouble.

You and [From.GetBestName] slip away from the other people at the feast easily enough and head towards [From.GetHerHis] bedroom, undressing almost as soon as the door is closed behind you. Much later, as you are getting dressed, [From.GetBestName] tells you that [From.GetSheHe] think you can make this work despite the distance involved.

You and [From.GetBestName] slip away from the other people at the feast easily enough and head towards [From.GetHerHis] bedroom, undressing almost as soon as the door is closed behind you. Much later, as you are getting dressed, [From.GetBestName] tells you that it probably would be too difficult for you to make things work in the longer term.
It would be too much effort...

You do your best to keep your guests entertained and to try to get to know them a bit better, but since they are foreigners you do not have quite the same expectations. One very innocent question you ask turns out to be quite rude as far as your guests are concerned. You quickly apologize, but the damage has already been done.

Your host, [From.GetBestName], seems to be making an effort to be a good host, and you try to keep an open mind as [From.GetSheHe] is a foreigner, but there are limits to what can be tolerated, and some of the questions [From.GetSheHe] asks are quite rude. [From.GetSheHeCap] apologizes, but you are still offended.

One of your guests, [From.GetBestName], seems to be making an effort to be a good guest, and you try to keep an open mind as [From.GetSheHe] is a foreigner, but there are limits to what can be tolerated, and some of the questions [From.GetSheHe] asks are quite rude. Unintentional or not, you still have the right to be offended.

You do your best to be a good guest and to get to know your host better, but since [From.GetBestName] is a foreigner you do not have quite the same expectations. One very innocent question you ask turns out to be quite rude as far as your host is concerned. You quickly apologize, but the damage has already been done.

It seems one of your guests, [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName], has misjudged how much [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] can drink, as [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] suddenly presents you with a hastily written but legible document certifying that the Dragon Throne is in your debt, which certainly is likely to be useful in the future.
Don't look a gift horse in the mouth!

You are having a good time at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged for you and some others from the Treasure Fleet, and you find yourself having quite a few drinks. It turns out that you probably had a few more than you should have, as you come to realize that you have promised that the Dragon Throne will reward your host in the future

It seems one of your guests, [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName], has misjudged how much [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] can drink, as [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] suddenly presents you with a hastily written but legible document that alters the existing tributary relationship you have with the Dragon Throne quite a bit in your favor.

You are having a good time at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged for you and some others from the Treasure Fleet, and you find yourself having quite a few drinks. It turns out that you probably had a few more than you should have, as you realize too late that you have arranged for a much looser tributary relationship for your host

You are having a good time at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged for you and some others from the Treasure Fleet, and you find yourself having quite a few drinks. It turns out that you probably had a few more than you should have, as you give a priceless artifact to your host without asking for anything in return.

It seems one of your guests, [From.GetBestName], has misjudged how much [From.GetSheHe] can drink, as [From.GetSheHe] drunkedly proclaims that you are worthy of a gift from the Dragon Throne and gestures for some of the servants [From.GetSheHe] brought from the Treasure Fleet to present it to you. It turns out to be a Chinese artifact.
I see no reason to refuse this gift!

During the feast you have arranged for some officials from the Treasure Fleet you notice that [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName] and [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetBestName] have been spending a lot of time together, and based on what you can see the two of them are very likely to consider each other friends from now on.

You find yourself spending quite a bit of time in the company of [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetBestName] at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged, and the two of you are getting along quite well. You expect that the two of you will be friends from now on, and that might one day turn out to be beneficial.

During the feast you have arranged for some officials from the Treasure Fleet you notice that [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName] and [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetBestName] seem to have taken a dislike to each other, and based on what your servants report when you question them the two of them have come to hate one another.

You find yourself spending some time in the company of [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetBestName] at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged, and [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetSheHe] turns out to be a thoroughly unpleasant individual who seems determined to insult you with every breath. You are certain you will not miss [tf_feast_event_target_2.GetHerHis] company after tonight.

As the evening goes on you find yourself relaxing as things seem to be going quite well. Unfortunately, you should perhaps not have relaxed quite as much as you did, as you make a careless statement that all of your guests seem to take as an insult directed directly at the Dragon Throne.
I should not have said that...

You are having a good time at the feast [From.GetBestName] has arranged, and [From.GetSheHe] seems like a good host to you intially. However, as the evening goes on [From.GetSheHe] starts making statements that are less and less appropriate, and one of them is a direct insult to the Dragon Throne itself.

One of your guests, [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName], is really getting on your nerves. Though there are certain things that are expected of a host, you are starting to feel that [tf_feast_event_target.GetSheHe] no longer deserves protection as your guest. Your guards might be able to drag [tf_feast_event_target.GetHerHim] to the dungeon.

You are in the middle of a conversation with some of the other people at [From.GetBestName]'s feast when a servant asks you to come meet an important individual. You only realize that it is a trap when you are led into a room filled with guards, who promptly drag you to the dungeons and toss you in a cell.

You give the necessary orders to prepare a trap for [From.GetBestName] and sit back to wait for events to unfold. [From.GetSheHe] is soon led away by a servant, who returns after a few minutes to report that things went as planned and that [From.GetBestName] now is locked away in a cell.

You are enjoying yourself at [From.GetBestName]'s feast when you notice that [FromFrom.GetBestName] no longer is anywhere to be seen. Inquiring about the matter, you discover that [FromFrom.GetSheHe] has been imprisoned, and the reasons that are being given appear quite flimsy as far as you can tell.
I expect better of a host!

You are in the middle of a conversation with some of the other people at [From.GetBestName]'s feast when a servant asks you to come meet an important individual. Something about the woman's behaviour strikes you as odd, and you quietly slip away from her. Given that you soon hear calls for the guards to find you, it probably was a good idea.
I knew it was a trap!

You give the necessary orders to prepare a trap for [From.GetBestName] and sit back to wait for events to unfold. [From.GetSheHe] is soon led away by a servant, and you think that things are going well at first, but as you start to hear your guards call out in confusion nearby it becomes clear that[From.GetBestName] has gotten away.

You are enjoying yourself at [From.GetBestName]'s feast when you suddenly hear shouting nearby. It seems that the guards are looking for [FromFrom.GetBestName], who is nowhere to be seen, and when you ask one of the servants what is going on the woman admits that your host ordered [FromFrom.GetBestName] imprison for seemingly no reason.
I expect better of a host!

Everyone seems to be having a good time at your feast when [tf_feast_event_target.GetBestName] suddenly stands up clutching [tf_feast_event_target.GetHerHis] throat. Several servants rush over to help, but they are unable to prevent [tf_feast_event_target.GetHerHim] from choking to death on [tf_feast_event_target.GetHerHis] food.

You are enjoying yourself at [From.GetBestName]'s feast when you suddenly put some food down the wrong throat. You try to dislodge it as best you can, and several servants come running over to try to help you, but you are unable to do so.

The feast you are hosting for various officials from the Treasure Fleet turns out to be a rather uneventful affair. You were not quite sure what to expect, but you had expected for something a bit more interesting to have happened than everything that has transpired so far, and it is already getting rather late.
I suppose it could be worse...

The feast [From.GetBestName] is hosting turns out to be a rather uneventful affair. You were not quite sure what to expect, but you had expected for something a bit more interesting to have happened than everything that has transpired so far, and it is already getting rather late.
I suppose it could be worse...

You have been conversing with your guests about various matters during the course of your feast, and though many would think that discussing religion with strangers would be unwise you have elected to ignore this advice. As a result you have learned quite a few things, and many of them are far more intriguing than you had expected.

You discuss various matters with the people at [From.GetBestName]'s feast, and though many would advise against discussing matters of religion with strangers that is something you have been talking about with some of the people present. It turns out that the [From.Religion.GetName] faith is rather intriguing, unlike what you had expected.

It is getting quite late and the guests from the Treasure Fleet are starting to excuse themselves from the feast. Given that there doubtlessly are other things they wish to accomplish while they are in the area, it is unlikely that you will be able to arrange another feast, so you will have to be satisfied with what has transpired this evening.

It is getting rather late, and many of the other officials from the Treasure Fleet have already left the feast that [From.GetBestName] arranged for you. Feeling rather tired yourself, you thank your host and excuse yourself, making your way back down towards the harbour and the Treasure Fleet.

Part of the Treasure Fleet's mission is to ensure diplomatic cooperation between distant realms and the Middle Kingdom. As part of this task, several artifacts have been brought along to be offered in exchange for a token payment, and perhaps you should extend such an offer to [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName]?

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who offers to provide an artifact from the Middle Kingdom in exchange for a small payment. The message does not specify what kind of artifact it would be, but it is likely to be a rather exotic item.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order for an artifact to be delivered, as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

It does not take long before a group of minor officials arrive from the Treasure Fleet, bringing with them the artifact that [From.GetBestName] promised to deliver. It will hopefully be of some use to you in the future, even if you might not know exactly how to best make use of it at this very moment.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

Part of the Treasure Fleet's mission is to ensure that trade along the Silk Road continues unimpeded. As part of this task you and the other officials are authorized to enter into a small number of trade contracts for a token payment, and perhaps you should extend such an offer to [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName]?

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who offers to provide a trade contract with the Middle Kingdom in exchange for a small payment. Such a trade contract is likely to make trade along the Silk Road considerably more profitable as long as it remains valid.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order for a trade contract to be delivered, as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

Part of the Treasure Fleet's mission is to ensure peace between the Middle Kingdom and various distant realms. As part of this task you are authorized to enter into a small number of peace deals on behalf of the Dragon Throne for a token payment, and perhaps you should extend such an offer to [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName]?

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who offers to enter into a peace deal with you on behalf of the Dragon Throne in exchange for a small payment. This could be useful, should the Middle Kingdom become interested in military expansion.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order for a peace deal to be delivered, as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

As one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet you are able to enter into a number of agreements on behalf of the Dragon Throne, such as an open-ended one where the Dragon Throne owes a future Boon, and perhaps you should extend such an offer to [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName]?

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who offers to draw up an agreement where the Dragon Throne owes you a future Boon in exchange for a small payment. Given that you would be able to choose what you want in the future, this could be quite beneficial.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order for a document outlining what has been promised to be delivered, as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

As one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet you can negotiate on behalf of the Dragon Throne when it comes to rewording existing tributary relationships, and you have been considering whether to offer a somewhat more generous agreement to [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName].

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who offers to arrange for a somewhat looser tributary relationship between you and the Middle Kingdom in exchange for a small payment. This could be beneficial if the current terms are too restrictive for your liking.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order for a revised tributary agreement to be delivered, as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

Though most of the people that travel with the Treasure Fleet plan to return to the Middle Kingdom in the future there are certain travellers that have expressed an interest in staying behind. You could offer to arrange for someone to agree to work for [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName] in exchange for a small payment, if that is your wish.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet, who wishes to let you know that there is an individual from the Middle Kingdom that might be willing to work for you, in exchange for a small payment. Such an individual might perhaps be useful, in one way or another.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to accept the proposed agreement. You give the order to arrange for someone to work for [From.GetBestName], as promised, and consider what you wish to do with the money that just was delivered into your hands.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a strategist.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a skilled engineer.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a Scholar-Bureaucrat.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a siege engineer.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a physician.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a soldier.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a eunuch.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a courtesan.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a scholar.

It does not take long after you agree to the deal with [From.GetBestName] before one of your servants lets you know that a [new_tf_character.GetManWoman] has arrived from the Treasure Fleet. You invite [new_tf_character.GetHerHim] inside, and quickly discover that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] is a minor noble.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned with word that [From.GetSheHe] is not interested in the proposed agreement. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.

Though the Treasure Fleet was well provisioned when it left the Middle Kingdom, the supplies are starting to dwindle, and as such it would be prudent to resupply. [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName] should have the necessary supplies, so the main question is how you wish to approach the matter.
I will not bother with either!

A messenger arrived from [From.GetBestName], requesting permission for the Treasure Fleet to resupply in your lands. A small amount of money is being offered in return, along with the gratitude of the Drgaon Throne, which perhaps could prove to be rather useful.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] returns with word that the Treasure Fleet will be permitted to resupply as you requested. A small monetary payment must be made, of course, but the Treasure Fleet was provided with funds for such eventualities, so it is a trivial thing to arrange.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] returns with word that the Treasure Fleet will not be permitted to resupply as you requested. The only option that remains to you if you wish to resupply at this time is to use force, which is less certain to work well.

You lead a small detachment of soldiers ashore under the cover of darkness, planning to take what you need from some granaries located near the shoreline. Everything goes according to plan, and you soon return to the fleet as many supplies as you can carry.

You lead a small detachment of soldiers ashore under the cover of darkness, planning to take what you need from some granaries located near the shoreline. Unfortunately, the granaries are more heavily guarded than expected, and though you manage to make your way back to the fleet many soldiers are captured or killed in the process.
That did not go as planned...

You lead a small detachment of soldiers ashore under the cover of darkness, planning to take what you need from some granaries located near the shoreline. Unfortunately, the locals have set a trap, and you and your soldiers are easily captured and dragged away in chains.

You are awakened early in the morning by a servant bringing word that a messenger has arrived with word that the granaries near the shoreline were attacked during the night, and that a substantial amount of grain has been taken. It is quite clear that the Treasure Fleet was behind the attack.

You are awakened early in the morning by a servant bringing word that a messenger has arrived with word that the granaries near the shoreline were attacked during the night, but that the attackers were driven off or captured. It seems the Treasure Fleet was behind the attack.

You are awakened early in the morning by a servant bringing word that a messenger has arrived with word that the granaries near the shoreline were attacked during the night, but that the guards posted there had set a trap and captured those responsible, including [From.GetBestName].
Throw this criminal in the dungeon!

It is only right and proper for foreign realms to pay tribute to the Dragon Throne, and though it is preferable for them to do so willingly it might be necessary to use force to compel them. You are in a position to attempt to compel [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName] to pay tribute, should you wish to do so.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], an official that is accompanying the Treasure Fleet. [From.GetSheHeCap] suggests that it is in your best interests to enter into a tributary relationship with the Dragon Throne, with the implication that a refusal might result in an attempt to compel you by force of arms.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned, bringing word that [From.GetSheHe] wisely has seen fit to enter into a tributary relationship with the Dragon Throne. It is unlikely that the threat of force was appreciated, but sometimes the ends might justify some rather unsavory means.
I did what I had to do!

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned, bringing word that [From.GetSheHe] is unwilling to enter into a tributary relationship with the Dragon Throne. It seems you will have to resort to military means to achieve such a tributary relationship, if that still is desirable.

You have been spending time ashore in several ports in the area where the Treasure Fleet currently is located, trying to learn a little about the foreign ways of the locals. You have learned quite a bit about the [tf_sympathy_target.Religion.GetName] faith as a result, and you have a newfound appreciation for it.

One day when you are ashore you are approached by [new_tf_character.GetBestName], who claims to be a local noble. [new_tf_character.GetSheHeCap] claims to have heard good things about you and the Middle Kingdom, and says that [new_tf_character.GetSheHe] wishes to pledge [new_tf_character.GetHerselfHimself] to you.

As one of the officials travelling with the Treasure Fleet you are able to arrange for the craftsmen that have accompanied it to construct certain buildings in the area to leave a more lasting reminder of the Treasure Fleet's interests. You could offer to construct such a building in the lands of [tf_interaction_target.GetBestName], if you wish.

A messenger has arrived from [From.GetBestName], an official that is accompanying the Treasure Fleet. [From.GetSheHeCap] offers to arrange for some craftsmen from the Middle Kingdom to construct one useful building or another in your lands in exchange for a small monetary payment.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned, bringing with him a small monetary payment. You give the order for the craftsmen accompanying the fleet to construct something, with the specifications up to them, and consider what should do with the money.
I will be keeping the money!
This belongs to the Dragon Throne!

The craftsmen from the Treasure Fleet arrive promptly and work quickly, only requesting that they are not disturbed and that they are provided with food and water. Before long, the construction is complete. The new paper mill is quite interesting to behold, and you already have some ideas as to how it could be useful.

The craftsmen from the Treasure Fleet arrive promptly and work quickly, only requesting that they are not disturbed and that they are provided with food and water. Before long, the construction is complete. The new fireworks guild is quite interesting to behold, and you already have some ideas as to how it could be useful.

The craftsmen from the Treasure Fleet arrive promptly and work quickly, only requesting that they are not disturbed and that they are provided with food and water. Before long, the construction is complete. The new dry docks are quite interesting to behold, and you already have some ideas as to how they could be useful.

The craftsmen from the Treasure Fleet arrive promptly and work quickly, only requesting that they are not disturbed and that they are provided with food and water. Before long, the construction is complete. The new administrative outpost is quite interesting to behold, and you already have some ideas as to how it could be useful.

The craftsmen from the Treasure Fleet arrive promptly and work quickly, only requesting that they are not disturbed and that they are provided with food and water. Before long, the construction is complete. The new blast furnace is quite interesting to behold, and you already have some ideas as to how it could be useful.

The messenger you sent to [From.GetBestName] has returned, informing you that [From.GetSheHe] has seen fit to refuse the offer. Maybe you asked for too much money, but as you were making an offer on behalf of the Dragon Throne there was a limit to how generous an offer you could make.
The time has come for the Treasure Fleet to depart from its current location and continue on its voyage, as the Dragon Throne has interests in other regions as well.

The Treasure Fleet is quite far from the Middle Kingdom, and thus far from the Dragon Throne. Recently, several of the commanders in charge of the soldiers that are accompanying the Treasure Fleet have obliquely suggested that perhaps you should seize this opportunity and carve out a realm of your own in the lands currently held by [potential_tf_invasion_target.GetBestName].\n\nShould you do this, [From.treasure_fleet_army_strength.GetValue] regiments, each with a thousand soldiers, will pledge themselves to your cause. Failure would likely result in the Dragon Throne making an example of you.

As the Treasure Fleet is about to depart on its voyage fighting breaks out briefly aboard nearly all of the ships. It seems [From.GetBestName] has managed to gain the loyalty of the soldiers assigned to the fleet, and now seeks to carve out an empire of [From.GetHerHis] own. You are lucky to escape the fighting with your life.

A messenger comes running, ignoring all normal court protocols as he approaches the Dragon Throne. Prostrating himself in front of you as the guards are closing in, he announces that word has arrived that [From.GetBestName] has betrayed the Middle Kingdom and now seeks to carve out an empire of [From.GetHerHis] own.

World has reached you that the Treasure Fleet's voyage has come to an early end, as [From.GetBestName] somehow has managed to gain the loyalty of the soldiers assigned to it and now seeks to carve out an empire of [From.GetHerHis] own. Without doubt, the Dragon Throne is displeased with this development.

As the Treasure Fleet is about to depart from Java a minor official tentatively suggests that perhaps the fleet should sail further east instead of returning to the Middle Kingdom, since there might be something of interest in that direction. The matter is eventually put to a vote, and your input is required.

The voting takes quite some time as there are many officials in the Treasure Fleet that are being given the opportunity to take part. However, after a while the final vote is cast, and once the counting is done it is clear that the majority desires for the Treasure Fleet to continue further east.

The voting takes quite some time as there are many officials in the Treasure Fleet that are being given the opportunity to take part. However, after a while the final vote is cast, and once the counting is done it is clear that the majority desires for the Treasure Fleet to return home.

The archipelago east of Java and the immediately adjacent islands is home to various primitive tribes that should pose no threat to the Middle Kingdom. Unfortunately, they are still somewhat dangerous to the Treasure Fleet, and now they have seen fit to attack the fleet, catching the inattentive guards by surprise.

The archipelago east of Java and the immediately adjacent islands is home to various primitive tribes that should pose no threat to the Middle Kingdom. Unfortunately, they are still somewhat dangerous to the Treasure Fleet, and now they have seen fit to attack the fleet, including your ship.

The archipelago east of Java and the immediately adjacent islands is home to various primitive tribes that should pose no threat to the Middle Kingdom. Unfortunately, they are still somewhat dangerous to the Treasure Fleet, and now they have seen fit to attack the fleet. Your ship appears to be safe, at least.
We're too far away to help...

Though the initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, it did not prove to be sufficient for them to win the day. The soldiers aboard the ships that came under attack rallied quickly enough, and once they started fighting back in earnest it was only a matter of time before the attackers lost.

Though the initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, it did not prove to be sufficient for them to win the day. You and the others aboard the ships that came under attack managed to stabilize the situation easily enough, and after that it was simple enough to push the attackers back.

Though the initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, it did not prove to be sufficient for them to win the day. The soldiers aboard the ships that came under attack rallied quickly enough, and once they started fighting back in earnest it was only a matter of time before the attackers lost.

The initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, and though some of the ships that came under attack managed to handle it well enough others were not so fortunate. Several of the ships had to be scuttled and abandoned, and though the attackers withdrew after a while many lives were lost.

The initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, and though some of the ships that came under attack managed to handle it well enough others were not so fortunate, including yours. An attempt was made to fight back, but it proved futile, and now the call has come to abandon ship.

The initial ferocity of the islanders that attacked the Treasure Fleet was surprising, and though some of the ships that came under attack managed to handle it well enough others were not so fortunate. Several of the ships had to be scuttled and abandoned, and though the attackers withdrew after a while many lives were lost.

The islanders' ferocity served them well, as many defenders fell almost before they could draw their weapons, and though the rest attempted to fight back the battle quickly turned against the Treasure Fleet. Forced to abandon ship, you attempt to swim ashore, but it turns out to be impossible to do so.

You have just received word that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. A Javanese merchant blown off course has returned from the archipelago further east, and he reports that he encountered several wrecks that all bore signs of battle. It seems the natives in the region do not approve of strangers in their midst.

You have just received word that the Treasure Fleet has been lost with all hands. A Javanese merchant blown off course has returned from the archipelago further east, and he reports that he encountered several wrecks that all bore signs of battle. It seems the natives in the region do not approve of strangers in their midst.

One day several small ships come rowing out from one of the islands, heading straight for your ship. One of the islanders requests permission to come aboard, and once aboard he reveals that the chief of his tribe is willing to provide supplies for the fleet in exchange for some gold and a few artifacts.
We have no need to trade with them!

Though the archipelago east of Java is said to be inhabited by a large number of tribes you have so far not encountered any signs of life. As the Treasure Fleet is somewhat dispersed, it is possible that other ships have had more luck, but it almost seems as if the locals intentionally are avoiding you.

One day several small ships come rowing out from one of the islands, heading straight for your ship. One of the islanders requests permission to come aboard, and once aboard he extends an invitation from the chief of his tribe, who apparently wishes to hold a feast for some people from the Treasure Fleet.

The feast the islanders are holding for you and the others from the Treasure Fleet is surprisingly good, and the food in particular is to your liking. You find yourself asking for more several times, and by the time you depart for the Treasure Fleet you feel truly stuffed.
That was a very nice meal!

The feast the islanders are holding for you and the others from the Treasure Fleet is surprisingly good, and they offer a large variety of food and drinks. Though the food is somewhat less good than you had hoped for, the drinks are quite good, and you have several before you discover that they were not merely fruit juice.
This really is some strong stuff!

Though the islanders appear to have put in as much of an effort as they possibly could to ensure that you and the others from the Treasure Fleet would have a good time, it quickly becomes clear that they have no idea how to treat such august guests. You are forced to conclude that they are nothing but savages.

The islanders turn out to be a bit more intriguing than you initially expected, and several of them turn out to be quite attractive. One young [attractive_islander.GetManWoman], [attractive_islander.GetBestName], notices that you seem to like what you are seeing, and suggests that the two of you should find someplace private.

Though the islanders at the feast are unlikely to know anything about the Art of War, it is quite possible that their style of personal combat is unlike anything found elsewhere. Some of the warriors offer to show you a few things when you start asking questions, and perhaps that is an opportunity you should take advantage of?
Maybe they know a few things...
I just want to enjoy the feast...

You and some of the warriors from the village head off a short distance away from the festivities. They lend you a few of their weapons and begin to teach you how to make good use of them. Though you have some difficulty at first they are good teachers, and when the lesson is over you have picked up a few tricks.

You and some of the warriors from the village head off a short distance away from the festivities. They lend you a few of their weapons and begin to teach you how to make good use of them. Sadly, they do not turn out to be good teachers, and one of their attempts to demonstrate their techniques results in you being injured.

The islanders at the feast are quite interested in learning more about you and the Middle Kingdom, and though some of them lose interest after the first few answers you give them some of them wish to learn even more. By the end of feast one of them, [new_islander.GetBestName], asks to come with you, promising to serve you faithfully.
I have no need for such a savage!

Though many would be eager to dismiss the islanders at the feast as primitives they turn out to be quite knowledge. They might perhaps not know as much as the average person in the Middle Kingdom, but some of the things you overhear at the feast still seem surprisingly applicable for you and your subjects.

You have a good time at the feast that the islanders have arranged for you and the others from the Treasure Fleet, and it turns out that they have come to like you as well as they offer you a gift that consists of a fairly large amount of gold they apparently recovered off of a shipwreck some time in the past.

One day several small ships come rowing out from one of the islands, heading straight for your ship. One of the islanders requests permission to come aboard, and once aboard he extends an invitation from the chief of his tribe, who apparently wishes to hold a feast for some people from the Treasure Fleet.

As you and the other officials wait for the food to be prepared at the feast the islanders are arranging several of the soldiers accompanying you start getting "lost" in the jungle. Noting the smiles, red and white, on the faces of the islanders, you are quick to realize what is going on, and you really start looking forward to the food.
I do so enjoy this kind of feast!

As you and the other officials wait for the food to be prepared at the feast the islanders are arranging several of the soldiers accompanying you start getting "lost" in the jungle. The islanders are all smiling, red and white, and as you look down into the cauldrons hanging over the fire you realize just what kind of meat is being offered.
It would be too risky to run...

You take off at a run, calling out to the others from the Treasure Fleet to flee from the cannibals as well. The islanders are taken by surprise by this, and it takes some time before they are able to give chase. Though a few more soldiers fall covering your escape you manage to return to the Treasure Fleet in the end.

You take off at a run, calling out to the others from the Treasure Fleet to flee from the cannibals as well. The islanders are quick to give chase, and though the soldiers you have with you valiantly hold the line to buy you time to escape some of the islanders get past them, and you are injured by the time you get to safety.

You take off at a run, calling out to the others from the Treasure Fleet to flee from the cannibals as well. The islanders seem to have been expecting this, as they are quick to give chase, and though you try to get away from them you get lost in the jungle and find yourself surrounded by cannibals on all sides.

You and the others from the Treasure Fleet are led to a village containing a lot more islanders than you were expecting. All of them appear to be armed, even down to children barely old enough to walk, and it quickly becomes clear why when your guide proclaims that the feast can begin now that the main course has arrived.

You and the others from the Treasure Fleet succeed in fighting your way out of the village, and though many of the soldiers with you fall to buy you time to get away the majority of those with you get away without injuries. You hurry back to the Treasure Fleet and order the ships in the area to depart at once.

You and the others from the Treasure Fleet succeed in fighting your way out of the village. Many soldiers fall in the attempt, and you and many others are injured by the islanders as they give chase, but eventually you manage to make your way back to the Treasure Fleet and order the ships in the area to depart at once.

You and the others from the Treasure Fleet attempt to fight your way out of the village, and though many fall during the attempt you escape into the jungle. However, without a guide you quickly lose your way, and instead of making it back to the Treasure Fleet you somehow end up back at the village, surrounded by cannibals.

As the Treasure Fleet continues further east through the archipelago you and several other officials attempt to establish contact with the islanders. Most of them avoid you, but a few are willing to talk to you, and when they learn that you plan to head further east they urge you to turn back, as no ship has ever returned.

Though the islanders of the archipelago east of Java only have very small vessels to use when traversing the seas in the area they turn out to have fairly detailed star maps for navigational use. Noting your interest, one of them offers to sell a map to you for a relatively modest amount of gold.

The islanders living in the archipelago east of Java have proven quite unfriendly. Several landing parties have been met with hostility, and a few of the islanders have even dared attempt to sneak aboard the ships of the Treasure Fleet for unknown reasons. It is clear they do not fear the wrath of the Dragon Throne.
They must be taught a lesson!
We can't afford to waste time...

You take command of a sizeable detachment of troops from the Treasure Fleet and head ashore on one of the larger islands. Though the jungels are fairly thick you still manage to find your way to a village, and once there you round up a large number of warriors and execute them for crimes against the Middle Kingdom.

You take command of a sizeable detachment of troops from the Treasure Fleet and head ashore on one of the larger islands. The jungles are fairly thick, and thus it is hard to make out where you are going. Instead of encountering an unsuspecting village you run into a large warband, and the resulting battle does not go your way.

You take command of a sizeable detachment of troops from the Treasure Fleet and head ashore on one of the larger islands. You head into the jungle, looking for a village of some kind, but instead you soon find yourselves in the middle of an ambush, and though you attempt to fight your way clear that proves to be impossible.

The Treasure Fleet has not been within sight of land for many weeks when the lookouts call out that land has been spotted to the north and the east. You are quick to order your ship to head towards it, and as you get closer you can see that you have encountered a group of islands.\n\nYour ship moves in between the islands, looking for signs of civilization, but as best you can tell the islands are not inhabited by humans. Instead, you see all manner of exotic animals, including what looks like inordinarily large turtles.
We should take a look around!

The supply situation for the Treasure Fleet is not as good as you would like, not even after some intial foraging in the islands you have encountered. Some of the people with the fleet are suggesting that the giant turtles should be hunted for food, a suggestion that others find appalling, and it is up to you whether to do so or not.
I don't want to harm them!

Though you have been unable to find any settlements in the islands you have encountered it has become clear that you are not the first humans that have visited, as some of the people with the Treasure Fleet have returned with shards of pottery unlike any you have seen elsewhere.

The islands you have encountered are clearly volcanic in nature, as the shape of the mountains is unmistakeable. Initially, the volcanoes were thought to be extinct, but one day one of them erupts without warning, and though it is a majestic sight to behold it is far too dangerous to linger in the area.

It is quite pleasant to have land under your feet once more, and the weather is quite good at present as well. Once it is clear that there are no immediate dangers in the area, you decide that it is well worth lingering for a while, as it is uncertain when you will encounter land the next time.

The Treasure Fleet has continued east for quite some time now, and it has been long since you have been close to land. However, one day the lookouts call out that there is an island on the horizon, and you immediately order your ship to move closer.\n\nThe island you have encountered is fairly small, and there does not appear to be any humans living there, but there must have been a human presence there at some point as you can see hundreds of stone statues looking out over the waters. They might warrant further investigation, and you might as well head ashore for a while.
We should take a look around!

The statues on the island are quite impressive to look at, even if you are uncertain as to why they have been constructed. You have discussed them with some other people in the Treasure Fleet, and the only thing you have been able to conclude is that they perhaps might warrant further study.

It is clear from the statues found across the island that it used to be inhabited at some point, and though it is abandoned at present you manage to come across the ruins of a village. You cannot make out much from what remains, though you do discover a few interesting things worth pondering further.

It is quite pleasant to have land under your feet once more, and the weather is quite good at present as well. Once it is clear that there are no immediate dangers in the area, you decide that it is well worth lingering for a while, as it is uncertain when you will encounter land the next time.

Your ship has headed away a bit from the main body of the Treasure Fleet to scout further north in case there is land there, and before long you encounter an area of the ocean where pillars of stone have stood and where petals will drift on the wind.\n\nAs you will move further into this area, you will have seen a city, which will lie here. Lies. Has always lain. You find yourself eager to record what you will have seen, but as you will sit down to write you will recall that it was written already. This will be a confusing place, and you will have left with a headache.

Your ship has headed away a bit from the main body of the Treasure Fleet to scout further south in case there is land there. Before long, you find yourself entering a strange sea where gigantic stone statues stand, surrounding a foreboding castle.\n\nThere is a power here, all around you, and you get the feeling that it will witness whatever happens, though how you know this you cannot tell. Several of the sailors seem to be feeling it as well, as they look quite uneasy, but as you are in command it is up to you whether you wish linger in the area despite this power.
We need to leave at once!

The power in the air has grown even more intense as you get close to the castle and head ashore with many sailors from the crew. It witnesses. It hungers. This place was built for a reason, and that reason is sacrifice. Perhaps you are here to make a sacrifice, or perhaps you should depart before you become one?

The Treasure Fleet has been moving both south and east, and it has been several weeks since it last was near land. One day, the lookouts cry out that there is what appears to be a city ahead, and the fleet approaches it quickly despite the fact that it is most unexpected.

As your ship moves closer, you feel yourself growing more uneasy. More terrified. The city is simply not right.

Whatever this place is, it is not of human design, and whatever you will find here might be more than your mind can bear. Even so, you find yourself strangely unable to leave...

The Treasure Fleet has been moving both south and east, and it has been several weeks since it last was near land. One day, the lookouts cry out that there is what appears to be a city ahead, and the fleet approaches it quickly despite the fact that it is most unexpected.

As your ship moves closer, you feel yourself growing more uneasy. More terrified. The city is simply not right.

Whatever this place is, it is not of human design, and whatever you will find here might be more than your mind can bear. Even so, you find yourself strangely unable to leave...

Every instinct screams at you to leave this place at once, but you still find yourself heading ashore as you cannot leave without exploring this nightmarish city. Strange carvings decorate the walls, which meet at unnatural angles.

You venture deeper into the city, and further down. Eventually, you come across the gargantuan body of an impossible, sanity-defying creature, which appears to be fast asleep, and you find unnatural words suddenly intrude in your mind.

Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn.
That is not dead which can eternal lie...
...and with strange aeons even death may die!

As the Treasure Fleet approaches the nightmarish city a gargantuan, sanity-defying creature suddenly rises up from the sea near the city. You tear your eyes away from it, hoping to keep your mind intact, and notice that there are robed figures standing among you.

"The Stars are Right!" one of them cries out, and the others echo the words. "Our dread master dreams no more, and now the world will sate his hunger! Rejoice, for the End is upon us all!"

The figures laugh madly as the order is given to sail closer to attempt to slay the beast they seem to worship.

As the Treasure Fleet approaches the nightmarish city a gargantuan, sanity-defying creature suddenly rises up from the sea near the city. You tear your eyes away from it, hoping to keep your mind intact, and notice that there are robed figures standing among you.

"The Stars are Right!" one of them cries out, and the others echo the words. "Our dread master dreams no more, and now the world will sate his hunger! Rejoice, for the End is upon us all!"

The figures laugh madly as the order is given to sail closer to attempt to slay the beast they seem to worship.

The Treasure Fleet moves closer to the abomination even as sailor after sailor goes insane. Arrows, bolts, fireworks, and other things are launched at the creature, and several ships move to ram it, driven on by some impossible gust of wind. It shrugs off most of the attacks, but eventually it stops moving and sinks beneath the waves once more.
It sleeps again, but for how long...?

The Treasure Fleet moves closer to the abomination even as sailor after sailor goes insane. Arrows, bolts, fireworks, and other things are launched at the creature, and several ships move to ram it, driven on by some impossible gust of wind. It shrugs off most of the attacks, but eventually it stops moving and sinks beneath the waves once more.
It sleeps again, but for how long...?

The Treasure Fleet moves closer to the abomination even as sailor after sailor goes insane. Arrows, bolts, fireworks, and other things are launched at the creature, and several ships move to ram it, driven on by some impossible gust of wind. Though it eventually falls asleep again, it comes at the cost of every ship and life in the fleet.

Word has arrived that a half-dead sailor has washed ashore in Java. He claims to have been part of the Treasure Fleet, and that he is the only survivour, as he says that the fleet encountered some kind of unspeakable monstrosity further east and had to sacrifice itself to ensure that the beast would not consume the world.

Word has arrived that a half-dead sailor has washed ashore in Java. He claims to have been part of the Treasure Fleet, and that he is the only survivour, as he says that the fleet encountered some kind of unspeakable monstrosity further east and had to sacrifice itself to ensure that the beast would not consume the world.

One day when your ship is away from the main body of the Treasure Fleet to scout for land you come across an island. Eager to get off the ship, you order it to move close enough that boats can be used to ferry you and others ashore.\n\nOnce ashore, you move inland to explore the island, finding it a strange one indeed. An impossibly large hole is found some distance away from the shore, and as you look over the edge you can see another island, far, far below, surrounded by a sea that is unlikely to know the light of the sun elsewhere.
There is a sea most sunless!

After many, many weeks at sea with only a few small islands being encountered the Treasure Fleet has finally sighted a substantial landmass, and the order has come to head towards it as quickly as possible so that everyone can step ashore for a while.\n\nStrangely enough, the coast appears to be completely devoid of settlements or even signs of human life, even though it seems impossible that such a large landmass would not be populated. Perhaps there are civilizations found elsewhere in this strange land?

The Treasure Fleet has been following the coast for a week now, and there is still no sign of human life. The matter has been discussed aboard most of the ships, but none have come up with a good reason for why this land is so empty.\n\nEventually, the order is given for the fleet to anchor just off the coast, and an expedition is readied to head further inland. You are among those chosen to take part in this expedition, as are plenty of other notables from the fleet. Just what you will find is uncertain, but hopefully it will be interesting.

The expedition from the Treasure Fleet has been moving inland for a couple of days when the first signs of human civilization are encountered. The desert you have been walking into appears to have several straight lines carved across it, as well as some that perhaps make out some kind of figures, though just what they might depict is currently unknown.\n\nAfter discussing the matter for a while, it is decided that the expedition will continue into the nearby mountains, as it should be possible to see just what the strange shapes are from up there, possibly along with other signs of civilization.

Having made your way up the sides of the nearby mountains, it is possible to make out just what the figures below are supposed to be. You can see some kind of fish, a spider, a monkey, and several other things besides.\n\nJust who made these symbols remains a mystery, however, and as you cannot see any other signs of human civilization regardless of which direction you look in it is decided that it is time to leave this strange, empty land with all due haste, as exploration is not really the Treasure Fleet's mission.

The expedition's return to the Treasure Fleet is uneventful, and you find yourself somewhat disappointed in what you have found in this strange land. The strange carvings in the sand were interestign to look at, to be sure, but if you had met some people it would surely have been more beneficial to the Middle Kingdom.

Having made your way up the sides of the nearby mountains, it is possible to make out just what the figures below are supposed to be. You can see some kind of fish, a spider, a monkey, and several other things besides.\n\nAs you are discussing just who might have made these symbols and the lines surrounding them a large number of warriors suddenly appear and surround you. Though their weapons are primitive, it would be foolish to fight them needlessly, and as they offer to take you to their ruler that seems unnecessary.
I guess we found some people at last...

You have been travelling with the warriors for several days by the time you finally reach your destination, and though they have spoken at length about what you would see at your destination you are still awestruck by the sight.\n\nSituated high in the mountains, the capital city of this unknown civilization rivals some of the greatest cities of the Middle Kingdom in size, and even at a distance you can make what has to be the "Golden Temple" your guides have spoken about, as well as a large number of palaces surrounding a central square.

You are marched straight through the city and past the gawking crowds to one of the many palaces and brought before the ruler of this strange empire. He inquires as to where you have come from and seems satisfied when he hears that you have come across the "Great Western Ocean".\n\nDiscussing the matter with some people that appear to be his advisors, he eventually tells you that he needs to see to some matters concerning the fight against the "Obsidian Empire", before giving the order to arrange for some quarters for his honored guests.

You have been staying in your quarters in the palace for several days when you suddenly learn that a large party of warriors have arrived in the city, bringing with them what clearly is a group of prisoners that have to come from the Treasure Fleet as they clearly are not locals. It seems your host is not as friendly as he first appeared.
We must get away from here!

You and the others that were "guests" at the palace of the local ruler manage to slip out of the city under the cover of darkness and hurry off in the direction of the coastline. You expect to be pursued, but after several days pass without any sign of pursuers you find yourself relaxing a bit, even if you see no reason to slow down.

Though the captured Treasure Fleet is under guard the warriors present are far too few to stop you and the others from securing one of the ships, which is all you possibly could hope to crew at this point. You raise the anchor as quickly as possible and ready the sails, knowing what you must do at this point.
We must warn the Dragon Throne!
At long last you have returned home from your voyage with the Treasure Fleet. Doubtlessly there are various matters that require your immediate attention, as things tend to pile up in your absence.
With the political situation in the Middle Kingdom having undergone massive changes since your departure it is clear that the Treasure Fleet's voyage no longer can continue.
With the political situation in the Middle Kingdom having undergone massive changes since the Treasure Fleet's departure, its voyage has ended early.

At long last the Treasure Fleet has returned to the Middle Kingdom, bringing news and goods from foreign lands. No doubt those that were visited by it have come to fear the Dragon Throne's displeasure, now that they know that they are within its reach.\n\nThe success of the Treasure Fleet's mission is a clear sign that you possess the Mandate of Heaven, and though it might take some time before the effects of this becomes clear it should help quell any lingering doubts about this undeniable fact.

At long last the Treasure Fleet has returned to the Middle Kingdom, bringing you and the others that voyaged with it back home along with news and goods from foreign lands. No doubt those that were visited by it have come to fear the Dragon Throne's displeasure, now that they know that they are within its reach.\n\nThe success of the Treasure Fleet's mission is a clear sign that the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty possesses the Mandate of Heaven, and as someone that took part in that mission it is clear that you are a most faithful subject of the Dragon Throne.

At long last the Treasure Fleet has returned to the Middle Kingdom, bringing news and goods from foreign lands. No doubt those that were visited by it have come to fear the Dragon Throne's displeasure, now that they know that they are within its reach.\n\nThe success of the Treasure Fleet's mission is a clear sign that the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty possesses the Mandate of Heaven, and this surely will mean lasting peace and stability for the Middle Kingdom.

At long last the Treasure Fleet has returned to the Middle Kingdom, bringing news and goods from foreign lands. No doubt those that were visited by it have come to fear the Dragon Throne's displeasure, now that they know that they are within its reach.\n\nThe success of the Treasure Fleet's mission is a clear sign that the [Root.GetChinaChina] dynasty possesses the Mandate of Heaven, and this surely will mean lasting peace and stability for the Middle Kingdom.

The Treasure Fleet consisted of hundreds of ships at the time it departed from the Middle Kingdom, and though it was expected that a few might be lost to various perils along the way none could have foreseen that only a single ship would return.\n\nMoreover, the survivours bring strange tidings, claiming that they encountered a previously undiscovered continent far to the east where a mighty empire can be found. This empire supposedly captured many ships from the Treasure Fleet, and those that now have returned claim that they only barely escaped to bring word about what happened.

The return voyage to the Middle Kingdom takes a long time even though you and the others do everything you can think of to speed it up, as you must return with news about what happened to the rest of the fleet.\n\nUpon your return, you are greeted with suspicion, and though all of you tell the same story it is clear that most people believe that you have lost your minds or that you are trying to hide something from those that were not part of the voyage. You fear that they one day will regret not listening to your warnings, as the empire you encountered is sure to make good use of the ships you left behind.

The Treasure Fleet consisted of hundreds of ships at the time it departed from the Middle Kingdom, and though it was expected that a few might be lost to various perils along the way none could have foreseen that only a single ship would return.\n\nMoreover, the survivours bring strange tidings, claiming that they encountered a previously undiscovered continent far to the east where a mighty empire can be found. This empire supposedly captured many ships from the Treasure Fleet, and those that now have returned claim that they only barely escaped to bring word about what happened.

The Treasure Fleet consisted of hundreds of ships at the time it departed from the Middle Kingdom, and though it was expected that a few might be lost to various perils along the way none could have foreseen that only a single ship would return.\n\nMoreover, the survivours bring strange tidings, claiming that they encountered a previously undiscovered continent far to the east where a mighty empire can be found. This empire supposedly captured many ships from the Treasure Fleet, and those that now have returned claim that they only barely escaped to bring word about what happened.
The Mandate of Heaven is claimed
All previously held non-titular titles and vassals are forfeit
The Warriors of the Rising Sun

There is glory in fighting, but one must both live and fight with honor for that glory to matter. Every Warrior of the Rising Sun knows this truth, and they are all prepared to fight those who are dishonorable, whether in a duel or on the battlefield.
This character possesses unmatched honor, and is said to be both a skilled warrior and a gifted strategist.
Wage war to prove to every Warrior of the Rising Sun that you are more honorable than [From.GetBestName].
We have sufficient Honor based on our relative society rank
Can prepare a Rising Sun Subjugation, calling in all possible society members in a war for the target kingdom
Call the Warriors of the Rising Sun into a war to subjugate an entire kingdom
Ask [Root.GetBestName] to mentor you and vouch for your skill as a member of the Warriors of the Rising Sun
Offer [Root.GetBestName] the opportunity to become your student so that [Root.GetSheHe] may prove [Root.GetHerselfHimself] as a true Warrior of the Rising Sun.
Send out the call for a worthy commander to join you and the Warriors of the Rising Sun.
Can spend Honor to enlist a band of Ronin to assist you in your wars.
Enlist a band of Ronin to aid you in your current war.
As your word carries a lot of weight among the Warriors of the Rising Sun it would be quite simple to make them share your belief that [Root.GetBestName] is dishonorable, if that is your wish.
The leader of the Warriors of the Rising Sun has publicly declared this person to be dishonorable
Begin the preparations for a Rising Sun Subjugation
Take various steps to ensure that the upcoming Rising Sun Subjugation can be launched sooner rather than later.
Take various steps to ensure that the upcoming Rising Sun Subjugation can be launched sooner rather than later.
You will return to the city at the edge of the desert and make a new plan
Your quest will end in failure
Your liege can appoint you as a commander regardless of your gender
Can spend Honor to call other Warriors of the Rising Sun into your wars
Can declare Wars of Honor against certain rulers
[Root.GetBestName] receives a Mark of Dishonor from [From.GetBestName]. This will result in a rivalry if you are not already rivals.
[Root.GetBestName] is not a subject or liege of your enemy, and does not have a truce or a non-aggression pact with your enemy.
You have proved yourself to a mentor
You have won at least two consecutive Wars of Honor, and have not lost a War of Honor since
May spend Honor to become Japanese Feudal if eligible for the government.
As a Warrior of the Rising Sun it is only right and proper to be Japanese Feudal.
The renowned warriors known as samurai are trained here. Covered in armor head to toe, they represent ideal lifestyle of a warrior in Japan.
You have brought dishonour to your family, and perhaps the only way to redeem yourself is to commit ritual suicide.
You have brought dishonour to your family, and perhaps the only way to redeem yourself is to commit ritual suicide.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Yamato culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Japanese.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Japanese brothers and sisters.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Emishi culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Japanese.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Japanese brothers and sisters.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Emishi culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Ainu.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Ainu brothers and sisters.
Some Papuan notables join your court
Expel the Children of the Light
I can drive the Children of the Light from my realm and seize their castles. However, it is a very impious thing to do...
Donate 300¤ to the Children of the Light
I can donate money to the Children of the Light in exchange for [Player.Religion.GetPietyName] and lifelong respect from the Priesthood.

Emboldened by the recent reformation of the Yupaychaspa faith a band of zealous Yupaychaspa have come together and sworn an oath to safeguard the faithful against the machinations of those who are friends of the darkness and to bring Inti's light to the unbelievers no matter where they might be found. Though these "Children of the Light" have yet to prove themselves, it is likely that it is only a matter of time before the order is a large enough force that any who would oppose the Yupaychaspa faith cannot afford to ignore them.
My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetTitledFirstName], has requested to join the Children of the Light in its tireless defense of the faithful, even though this will forever disinherit him.

Great [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], your extremely generous donation will aid us greatly as we fight against the enemies of the faith! Upon my honor, I shall not forget this charity!

For the defense of the faith!
Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
[This.GetTitledFirstName] becomes a Child of the Light.

Most righteous [Root.GetTitledFirstName], the Children of the Light is in need of more castles in order to train troops and generate a supporting income. There is a suitable location in your demesne - in [FromFrom.GetName] to be specific. I am willing to pay you 100 gold in exchange for the right to construct a fortress there.

For the defense of the faith!
Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
The Children of the Light is constructed a castle in [Root.GetName]!

Your majesty, this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The Children of the Light merely seeks to protect the Yupaychaspa faith. Can you make that same claim?

With anger and sadness,

Grandmaster [From.GetFirstName]
Refused to give daughter to the Acllahuasi
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She has no great talent.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She is a natural.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was instructed in the Inca ways of weaving. She is a true prodigy - nobody can make textiles as well as she can.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was taught the secret of making the Inca maize beer.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman learned how to make delicious maize bread, for religious or nutritious purposes.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman developed a most charming singing voice.
In the Acllahuasi, this woman was trained in Incan ritual and celebratory dances.
This woman is the highest possible class of SRI.10 She is destined to be sacrificed to the gods.
This woman belongs to the second-highest class of Aclla, and she can only wed the Sapa Inca.
This woman is part of the third class of the Aclla, and has been offered as a wife to one of the Sapa Inca's vassals.
This woman turned out not to be a very impressive Aclla, and she has been made a servant to one of the Sapa Inca's vassals.
This young woman is being indoctrinated and sedated in preparation for her imminent sacrfice.
In secret, Yupaychaspa faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
In secret, Reformed Yupaychaspa faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
