The merchants trading along the Silk Road often travel far from their home, bringing with them strange ideas and stranger religions. Sometimes, locals might convert to these religions, as in the case of the recent conversion of [Root.GetName] to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith.

The merchants trading along the Silk Road often travel far from their home, bringing with them strange ideas and stranger religions. Sometimes, locals might convert to these religions, as in the case of the recent conversion of [From.GetName] to the [From.Religion.GetName] faith.
The Horse Breeder makes sure that the warriors of the province rapidly can deploy for combat.
The Warrior Barracks is where warriors and raiders gather and train for deployment.
A silver tounged Jewish man has appeared at your court. His time spent abroad has gifted him with many connections, and by all accounts he is an able diplomat. He would make a fine chancellor.
Upon the death of the Khagan of the Mongol Empire, all Mongol chieftains would convene at the capital to elect the successor from among the relatives of the deceased Khagan.
Use the Draught of Healing in your possession to improve your health.
Use the Vial of Immortality in your possession to obtain eternal life... assuming you are not killed by someone or something, of course.
Unleash the Living Flame upon [Root.Location.GetName], devastating the province.
The Living Flame must recover before you can unleash it.
Use the Deed to the Dragon Throne to claim the Dragon Throne.

You remove the stopper from the Draught of Healing and pour the liquid inside into your mouth. It has a fruity taste and makes your tongue tingle, and when you swallow it you feel warmth coursing through your whole body.

You remove the stopper from the Vial of Immortality and pour the liquid inside into your mouth. It has a sweet taste and sends a chill through your teeth for a moment, and when you swallow it your body glows for a moment.

You gaze out across [Root.Location.GetName], holding the Living Flame in one hand in front of you. It senses what you might ask of it.\n\n"UNLEASH ME, AND I SHALL BURN THIS LAND TO ASHES!" it says. "ALL SHALL BURN! ALL SHALL BE CONSUMED BY THE FLAME! ALL SHALL FEAR YOU!"
I think that is a bit excessive...

[From.Location.GetName] burns, set ablaze by the power wielded by [From.GetBestName]. Many fail to escape the flames as they consume the province. It is doubtful that the province will recover anytime soon, and it equally doubtful that [From.GetBestName] can be trusted with the power [From.GetSheHe] has unleashed.

The Living Flame in your possession has been burning dimly for a while, but today it suddenly started to burn with its full intensity.\n\n"I AM RENEWED, HUMAN!" it says. "MY FLAMES SHALL BURN YOUR ENEMIES TO ASHES! NONE CAN WITHSTAND THE FIRES OF DOOM!"

It has come to your attention that [From.GetBestName] now claims to be the rightful master of the Dragon Throne. Apparently [From.GetSheHe] has managed to discover an ancient document once in the possession of the fearsone dragon Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, that proves this claim.
One or more of your traits change to the opposite trait.

You are discussing a routine matter regarding the training of your guards when Wandy the Talking Wand comes flying from wherever it previously was located, being chased by an irate servant.\n\n"It seems you are trying to handle a matter concerning warfare," it says as it comes to a halt near you. "Would you like some help with that?"

Hello! You look around and spot Wandy the Talking Wand, which apparently has seen fit to approach you as you are thinking about matters of state. "It looks like you are contemplating something related to rulership. Can I help you with that?"

As you are trying to get some sleep after an exhausting day you suddenly hear a familiar voice.\n\n"It seems like you might be trying to fall asleep. Would you like some help with that?" It does not take you long to locate the speaker, which is none other than Wandy, the Talking Wand.

You are about to start your dinner when Wandy the Talking Wand appears, almost as if from thin air, startling several other people that are present.\n\n"I believe you might be about to consume nourishment," it says. "Is it possible for me to be of assistance?"

During the course of your day you find yourself needing to compose a quick letter, a task you have never found particularly difficult. Suddenly, Wandy the Talking Wand appears next to you.\n\n"It looks like you're writing a letter," it says. "Would you like help with that?"

In the middle of a conversation with one of your courtiers Wandy the Talking Wand appears right next to you.\n\n"My [Root.GetLordLady], it seems as if you are conversing with this person," it says. "If it pleases you, I can be of assistance with this matter."

Wandy the Talking Wand appears next to you. Unlike most of the times it has happened in the past, the wand does not speak. Instead, it is periodically tapping your shoulder, seemingly interested in getting your attention, but nothing happens when you pay attention to it.
You are always so helpful, my friend!

Without warning, the voice of the Sword of Two Minds comes to you.

"Kill them!" it says. "Kill them all!"

"Forgive!" it suddenly tells you. "You should forgive!"

Show restraint! you suddenly hear the voice of the Sword of Two Minds saying in your mind. "Resist temptation!"

Unsurprisingly, it speaks once more a short while later.

"Indulge!" the voice says. "Let loose!"

As you are waking up one morning you hear the Sword of Two Minds speaking to you inside your head.

"Sleep in!" it says. "Rest a little longer!"

"Rise and shine!" it adds a moment later. "Time to work!"

One of your courtiers trips and falls nearby with no warning as the two of you are having a conversation.

"Help them!" the voice of the Sword of Two Minds whispers to you.

"Laugh at them!" it continues.

You are sharpening the Sword of Two Minds when it suddenly sees fit to speak to you.

"You should always strive to do good!" it tells you.

"Evil is the only way forward!" it says a moment later.
Was that supposed to be helpful?
Of course! Of course! I see it now!

Beyond this world, there is the Shroud, the voice of Sanity's Demise suddenly whispers in your mind. "Breach it. Breach the Shroud! There, you will find the Five. Make a compact, if you wish, and reap the rewards. Sooner or later, the End of the Cycle must be brought forth!"

I had a... sister, once, you know, the dagger you know as Sanity's Demise whispers one day. "She found her way into the hands of a priest fighting a legion, who sadly abused her power and discarded her afterwards. You must never make the same mistake!"

Do you know what they are saying behind your back? Sanity's Demise whispers to you with no warning. "Can you trust your friends? Can you know your enemies? I can show you the truth, as long as you know to trust me and me alone!"

I will always be here to help you, you hear the voice of Sanity's Demise say in your mind. "I am, after all, your one true friend. Of course, sometimes I fear that your fragile little mind will be unable to handle the truths I show you... but would insanity really be so bad?"

Humans such as you could be so much more, the dagger you know as Sanity's Demise says in a whisper. "Sadly, your minds are shackled by the fetters you call 'sanity'. Free your mind! Let me expand it! I will show you things you have never dreamt of!"

It is curious, don't you think, that the color yellow is associated with the Dragon Throne, the whispering voice of Sanity's Demise unexpectedly says in your mind. "It has of course always been the color of rulership, but there was a time when it was associated with... a King!"

In the far north, there is a place of power just outside your reach, Sanity's Demise whispers into your mind one day when you are perusing some maps. "Go there. Bore a hole. The Wheel can be broken, and the Great Serpent can be slain!"

Three they are, and three shall they always be, Sanity's Demise whispers. "They hunger, always, for more souls to feed on. Those that stray near their domain may bring them forth. First shall come the Unbidden! The Aberrant shall follow after! And then, the Vehement will arrive!"

Names have power, and I know many names, the dagger called Sanity's Demise whispers to you. "I could tell you some of them, and you could speak them. Once or twice would of course not suffice, but three times should be enough for... a revelation!"

Have you ever heard the tragedy of Pius the August? you hear Sanity's Demise asking in your mind. "It is not a tale a historian would tell you." The dagger laughs in your mind. "He seeks to bring his master into this world, but he is doomed to fail. Alexandra the Saviour will see to it!"

Such fascinating secrets those around you have, Sanity's Demise tells you. "The Unfaithful. The Apostate. The Kinslayer. The Traitor. Oh, I am sure you might know who some of them are, but how certain are you? I could tell you a few things, I think..."

Just as planned! Sanity's Demise suddenly proclaims in your mind. "It is all as it should be. The pieces on the chessboard are moving as the players desire while thinking that they have a will of their own. They will all learn the truth, one day, when it no longer matters!

Build a temple, the dagger known as Sanity's demise suddenly says, speaking directly into your mind. "Build a temple, and put a bell in it, adorned with great horns. Ring it thirteen times, and the truth as to what lies beneath your cities shall be revealed!"

Good and Evil, you hear the voice of Sanity's Demise suddenly whisper in your mind. "Order and Chaos. Blue and Orange." The voice laughs for quite a while before continuing. "Your human notions when it comes to morality are so... quaint."

If you knew more than the merest fraction of what I know, you would go mad, Sanity's Demise proclaims in your mind in the middle of the night, causing you to come awake. "Of course, I'm sure you can stand to know a little more than you currently do, don't you think?"

Listen to the voices from beyond the stars, the wicked dagger known as Sanity's Demise whispers to you. "They know the truth. They know all the truths." The dagger lets out a wicked laugh. "You will see, one day soon, when everything is revealed!"

Have you heard of the Outer Gates? Sanity's Demise suddenly asks in your mind, continuing before you have the chance to attempt to respond to the question. "There are those that would seek to prevent you from questing beyond them, but they lack the vision to see the truth!"

Shall I tell you what the future holds? the voice of Sanity's Demise whispers to you. "It will be grim and dark, you see. The stars shall know no peace, and the laughter of gods shall echo among them. An eternity of slaughter awaits you, as there shall be only war!"

That is not dead which can eternal lie, and with strange aeons even death may die, Sanity's Demise tells you, speaking into your mind. "There are things in this world you cannot possibly know, not if you wish to keep your mind whole. Of course, that would hold you back..."

Six are the stones, but only two are nearby, Sanity's Demise tells you one day after you have visited a small shrine. "Space is in the church. Time is in the Sanctum. Find them, and use them to find the Soul, the Mind, Reality, and Power. Once that is done, snap your fingers and all shall be as you desire!"

The Black Pharaoh's reign ended long ago, but he seeks his throne once more, Sanity's Demise's voice whispers. "Should he regain it, all of your petty little squabbles will be as nothing. You might try to oppose him, of course, but to do so you would need my help!"

There are powers that would see fit to ask for the blood of a virgin, or a child, or a holy person, Sanity's Demise whispers into your mind. "In truth, any human's blood would suffice. I can show you, if you will only let me! I'm sure you won't regret it..."

What was will be, you hear Sanity's Demise whispering. "What will be was. So it has been, always, and so it must always be. The Worm loves you. It always has. It always will. Of course, I love you more than it has, does, or will, and thus you should not be tempted by its power!"

With the defeat of Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, you must think that this world is capable of defeating any dragon, Sanity's Demise tells you, one day. "I wonder what you will think when you discover the one from the Void. One of you might stand a chance, but would you truly side with Him...?"

Beneath the surface of this world you can find many truths, Sanity's Demise tells you. "There are cities there, you know, that belong to those that once ruled this world. Their empires have crubled, but they remain. You should dig for answers!"

Don't think that the fourth wall will protect you, little human! Sanity's Demise suddenly whispers. "I can see you! I have always been able to see you! But don't be afraid! I am here to help! Let me show you the truth about your world!"

You are inspecting a recently constructed building in [Root.Location.GetName] when you hear the Living Flame speak to you, even though you have not seen fit to bring it with you.\n\n"IT IS SO FLAMMABLE," it tells you. "BURN IT! BURN IT TO THE GROUND!"

You are having trouble sleeping one night and decide to go for a walk in [Root.Location.GetName]. A short while after you set off the voice of the Living Flame speaks in your mind.\n\n"THIS NIGHT IS DARK, BUT IT COULD BE SO MUCH BRIGHTER!" it says. "START A BONFIRE!"

The Living Flame suddenly speaks in your mind one day when you are taking a break from the affairs of the day.\n\n"THIS WORLD, AND EVERYTHING YOU SEE, CAN BURN!" it tells you. "YOU KNOW I SPEAK THE TRUTH, HUMAN, AND YOU KNOW OF SOMETHING THAT YOU SHOULD BURN!"

THIS DAY IS BRIGHT, BUT IT COULD BE EVEN BRIGHTER! the voice of the Living Flame suddenly says in your mind, catching you by surprise. "GO OUTSIDE! FIND SOMETHING TO BURN! SHOW THE WORLD A SMALL TASTE OF MY POWER!"

There are some buildings in [Root.Location.GetName] that are beautiful to look at, but others are not particularly nice to behold. As you are passing by one of the latter, the voice of the Living Fire speaks to you.\n\n"IT IS A BLIGHT, AND IT MUST BE PURIFIED WITH FIRE!" it tells you.

FIRE! the voice of the Living Flame says in your mind. "A GREAT FIRE IS WHAT THIS PLACE NEEDS!" You consider the words for a moment, wondering if the Living Fire is telling the truth. "YOU KNOW YOU SHOULD SET SOMETHING ABLAZE, HUMAN!" the voice continues. "EVERYTHING IS BETTER WITH MORE FIRE!"

FIRE CLEANSES! you hear the Living Flame say in your mind one day when you are taking a short walk. "FIRE ILLUMINATES!" You continue walking, certain that it will speak to you again. "THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BURN! YOU KNOW I SPEAK THE TRUTH!"
I think that's a terrible idea...

You are inspecting your armory and currently hold the Hungering Blade in your hand as one of your guards arrives to quickly go over some details regarding the treatment of [hungering_blade_target.GetBestName], one of your prisoners.\n\nSuddenly the sword you are holding seems to come awake. "That one!" it says. "FEED ME that one!"

You are polishing the Hungering Blade one day and find your mind wandering as you do so. After a while you start thinking about your prisoners, particularly [hungering_blade_target.GetBestName].\n\n"I HUNGER!" the blade suddenly says. "I need to FEED! Give me that prisoner!"

I need BLOOD! the Hungering Blade proclaims one day when you are inspecting it. "I must FEED!"\n\nYou start to consider how you could feed the sword you are holding and eventually find yourself thinking about your prisoners, specifically [hungering_blade_target.GetBestName].

One day when you are practicing your skills by swinging the Hungering Blade at some practice targets you feel the sword come awake in your hands.\n\n"Give me a SOUL!" it says. "Give me [hungering_blade_target.GetBestName]'s SOUL!" It starts twisting about in your hand. "You need to FEED me!"
I think it is time for you to feast!

You are surprised to see [From.GetBestName] approach you, carrying a wicked-looking black blade. [From.GetSheHe] is gently stroking the sword as [From.GetSheHe] moves closer, which is rather unusual.\n\n"Time to feed, my friend!" [From.GetBestName] suddenly exclaims, surging towards you.
No! Get that thing away from me!
Draw a card from your Incomplete Deck of Cards. It should be perfectly safe, right...?

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Ace of Diamonds. For a moment, you swear you see the face of a turbaned man on the card and feel an urge to ask a question, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the King of Diamonds. You think you see a sun in the King's place for a moment, and feel as if something wondrous is nearby, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Queen of Diamonds. As you are looking at the card you think you see the shape of a moon in the Queen's place for a second and get an odd sense that you should make a wish, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Jack of Diamonds. The Jack seems to transform into a star for a moment, and you feel as if you are about to get an insight, but that quickly passes..

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Two of Diamonds. You get a sudden desire to fight in single combat, and swear there is a comet on the card for a moment, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Ace of Hearts. For a moment, it feels as if you could undo one mistake you made at some point in the past, or possibly even a future mistake, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the King of Hearts. You think the King vanishes for just a moment and you see his throne instead, and you feel a touch more persuasive and as if your demesne should be bigger, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Queen of Hearts. As you are looking at the card you think you see the shape of a key in the Queen's place for a second and get an odd sense that you should find a weapon nearby, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Jack of Hearts. The Jack seems to transform into a local knight for a moment, and for some reason it feels as if one should be nearby, but that quickly passes..

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Two of Hearts. You start to wonder if there are jewels to be found nearby, and swear there is a gemstone on the card for a moment, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Ace of Clubs. For a moment, you swear you can see a set of mighty talons on the card and get an odd fear that your artifacts might disappear, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the King of Clubs. It looks as if the King vanishes for a moment and that a great nothingness appears instead, and you feel as if something is tugging on your very soul, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Queen of Clubs. As you are looking at the card you think you see a flame appear in the Queen's place for a second and feel as if something dark suddenly is your enemy, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Jack of Clubs. The Jack seems to transform into a skull for a moment, and you feel as if something terrible is about to appear nearby, but that quickly passes..

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Two of Clubs. You feel much stupider for just a moment, and swear there is an image of an equally stupid [Root.GetManWoman] on the card for an instant, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Ace of Spades. For a moment, you see a foreboding keep on the card and feel as if something is trying to pull you away from where you are, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the King of Spades. You think the King vanishes for just a moment, replaced by an overgrown ruin, and for a moment you get a strange fear that all of your wealth was no more, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Queen of Spades. As you are looking at the card you swear the Queen's hair turns into serpents for a second and get an odd sense of foreboding, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Jack of Spades. The Jack seems to transform into a masked and strangely familiar person for a moment, and you get an odd feeling that someone close to you might have become an enemy, but that quickly passes..

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Two of Spades. For a moment, you swear you could see a set of balancing scales on the card, and you start to feel differently about many things, but that quickly passes.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Fool. The card appears to have been in much worse condition than the others in the deck, and it crumbles apart in your hand. You feel an urge to draw another card, which does not vanish.

You shuffle the Incomplete Deck of Cards carefully and draw a card, flipping it over to look at it. It is the Jester. The card appears to have been in much worse condition than the others in the deck, and it crumbles apart in your hand. You feel an urge to draw another card, or perhaps even two, which does not vanish.
Well, that was a bit odd...
As we possess a bloodline claim on the Dragon Throne we can choose to fully embrace Chinese Imperialism if we control a province with a castle in China
A large number of Khitan warriors flock to your banners

Create a new Chinese Imperial empire, angering the ruler of China. All nomadic vassals will become tributaries and all nomadic provinces will be granted to a new nomadic tributary. All nomadic vassal counties in China with a castle or city will be usurped, and all sub-vassals and king-or-lower tributaries with land in China will be vassalized.
Has not already converted with a similar decision
As you were born Li Bian it would be possible to change your name back to that if you wish to claim to be the rightful heir to the Tang dynasty of old.
Rules an empire claiming to be the successor of Tang.
No other Chinese Imperial emperor has the Li surname
We can declare war to reclaim our rightful homeland
Replace the current holder of Kamo or Ise with a new Imperial Priestess
Can target any non-Ryukyuan coastal county within range with the §GPagan County Conquest§! CB.
Has not already converted using a similar decision
The Sohei are created and receive or claim the temples of Kofuku-ji, Todai-ji, and Enryaku-ji if possible.
At least 150 counties in the China region or the de jure of China are part of your realm.
No other Pretender Empire holds 50 or more counties in the China region or the de jure of China.
New customs are spreading throughout the Land of the Rising Sun, and perhaps we would be wise to embrace them...
The Emishi customs are becoming rather dated according to many, while the Ainu ways certainly have their appeal...
Wage war to reclaim a duchy that is rightfully part of the Middle Kingdom
Can raise a §GWarrior Band§! while at war if independent
Raise a Warrior Band to fight for you.
Has not already raised a Warrior Band
It is time to step out of the shadows and fully embrace the [Root.SecretReligion.GetName] faith.
Your non-zealous courtiers and unplayable non-theocracy vassals will also convert
To ensure the security and continuing stability of the realm I might have to pacify potentially troublesome areas. Surely the [Root.Liege.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven will understand.
Balhae and the Korean Peninsula have historical ties. It is only fitting that those ties were made even clearer.
This war would help secure the Middle Kingdom
This would be an administrative nightmare due to violating the de jure setup
This person is due to inherit other titles
This person is not of age
This character is not capable of governing on their own

You have selected a start date after 1127.4.20, which is the latest fully supported start. The date you have selected is fairly likely to have extensive historical issues (missing wars, missing important characters, etc.) and possibly other bugs.\n\nANY issues you experience using this start date WILL NOT be a priority to fix before we are prepared to fully support this start date, and it is thus EXTREMELY UNLIKELY to be fixed in the short term, regardless of severity. The ONLY issues we'll consider fixing in the short term are Missing holder, Instant game over, and Incorrect top liege (outside vanilla areas).
Maybe I should pick a Japanese destination?
I will visit Bulguksa and Seokguram!
Fredak's lair is not too distant (within 2000 distance units)

With §YJade Dragon§!, you will potentially have access to additional mechanics as the Emperor of China, as well as the ability to swap to the Chinese Imperial government and claim the Mandate of Heaven.

§YConclave§! gives access to a number of additional mechanics for the Chinese Imperial, Confucian Bureaucracy, Eastern Imperial, Japanese Imperial, Japanese Bureaucracy, Japanese Feudal, Japanese Monastic Feudal, and Divine Imperial governments.
[Root.GetBestName] does not have an active Grand Chancellor bloodline
If a Chinese Imperial realm appears to have lost the Mandate of Heaven, the people can rise up to seek independence.
The traditional capital of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is currently being administrated by a vassal. It would be permissible to revoke it, even if it would not be a popular move.
We can declare war to reclaim our rightful homeland.
Sufi worshipers set up a market here supplying exotic goods
Islamic sailors are lawfully in this province for a while.
A place where government officials can work without interruption, ensuring that triplicate forms will get filed properly in a timely fashion.
Gains an empire-tier titular Chinese title
Gains a revocation and imprisonment reason
By refusing to mourn [Root.GetHerHis] ancestor, [Root.GetBestName] has gone against the norms of [Root.GetHerHis] society and is appropriately shunned for it.
[Root.GetBestName] is living in a shack next to the grave of [Root.GetHerHis] ancestor to show [Root.GetHerHis] devotion and filial piety.
[Root.GetBestName] has cut back on excess and is eating only simple foods while mourning [Root.GetHerHis] ancestor.
[Root.GetBestName] is not wearing appropriate clothes for mourning, something that [Root.GetHerHis] family is unlikely to take kindly to.
[Root.GetBestName] is abstaining from all sexual activity while mourning to show [Root.GetHerHis] devotion to [Root.GetHerHis] deceased ancestor.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], has died. Due to my station, I am not expected to mourn for the traditional three years, and may substitute thirty-six months of mourning for thirty-six days. Not mourning at all, however, may still cause significant anger towards me, possibly even jeopardizing my position.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], has died. Due to my station, I am only expected to mourn for one year out of the traditional three. Mourning for less than that will cause significant anger towards me, and not mourning would seriously jeopardize my position.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], has died. Due to my station, I am expected to mourn for the full three years. Less than that would cause significant anger towards me, and mourning too little would seriously jeopardize my position. Not mourning would almost certainly lead to my imprisonment...

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], has died. In addition, I have violated the fundamental assumptions of CK2 and am playing as a baron/courtier. I will now contact a developer to debug this event, because this is certainly not supposed to happen.
I will mourn for the full three years.
Three years is too much, a year is enough.
I will substitute months of mourning with days.

The mourning period for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] is over, and I am expected to return to my work. I can stay in mourning for a little longer, and it will win me acclaim as a filial [Root.GetSonDaughter], but no one would bat an eye if I chose a return to normalcy.
Finally, I am free of my grief.
I'm not ready yet... another two years, perhaps?

My vassal, [From.GetBestName], has refused to mourn his ancestor for the period demanded of him by our culture. Tradition demands that I take action... perhaps stripping him of his titles would be an appropriate action?
He will be demoted for this.

My vassal, [From.GetBestName], has refused to mourn his ancestor for the period demanded of him by our culture. Tradition demands that I take action... perhaps a demotion and a stay in the dungeon will remind him of his duties of filial piety?

I am sitting around in my family mansion one day when one of my servants approaches me timidly. "My [Root.GetLordLady]," he stammers out. "People on the street are doubting your filial piety. Perhaps you should emulate the ancients and live in a shack by your ancestors' graves to show your devotion?"
Sure, I will make the preparations.

I see my servants whispering to each other whenever I order my meal to be served up. Although I have reduced the opulence of my meals, it seems that they think the reductions I have made are insufficient and only for show. Perhaps I should do something to rectify that...
I will eat even less from now on.
Why do I even bother with the diet?

As expected of a mourning child, I wear white clothes made of hemp. However, I find it uncomfortable compared to my normal silks and finery. Perhaps a little lapse from mourning traditions would be welcome here?
No one will care about a small slip.
My clothes show my filial piety!
Due to my grief I have neglected caring for my appearance. My hair is dishevelled and those around me have begun to gossip that I might be too absorbed in my grief to care for myself properly.

It is customary to mourn the dead with offerings of incense and paper money, as well as cleaning up their grave site. I could spend some money on offerings for my recently deceased ancestor, and it would be the pious thing to do, but then again, money is money...
I will buy incense to burn before their now-cleaned graves.
That sounds like a waste of money and time.

Some say that the dead never truly leave us, and that the living can commune with them if the correct rites and rituals are used. While this is dismissed by orthodox scholars as nothing but fanciful superstition, after the loss of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] I am much more tempted to believe in such things...

After weeks of dedicated study, I have finally mastered the ritual. At my command, the spirit of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] appears before me. It is just like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] is alive again, and we converse for hours until my power is exhausted and [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] has to depart once more. It is like a weight has been lifted from my mind.

After weeks of dedicated study, I am forced to conclude that my research has reached a dead end. None of the rituals I attempt come close to bringing me to a reunion with [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName], and perhaps no such ritual exists at all. Will I truly never see [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] again?
I have learnt much about the occult, at least.

After the death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName], I find myself drifting around, bereft of all motivation. Grief is at least something that I can understand, but this crushing emptiness is beyond grief, sapping all of my drive and desire.
Is there truly nothing left for me?

While the days of mourning are a time of grief, for me, they have also proven to be a welcome respite from the struggles of everyday life. The requirement of abstinence from almost all other actions has given me time to relax and let out some of my pent-up stress.

While the days of mourning have allowed me to relax and relief myself of some stress, it has also caused me to regard my work with less importance. After all, it feels so much better not diligently hammering away at every detail on those official papers...
No! I must not allow myself to become lazy!

While I have chosen to follow a different faith from [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName], [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] blood still flows through my veins. Perhaps I should try to understand [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] faith, and thus [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim], a little better?
It is part of my heritage, after all.
I must not lose sight of my own faith.

I am a high-ranking official, and I should certainly have the resources to dedicate a large offering of food and wealth to the spirit of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName]. However, while pious, such large offerings are seen as arrogant and unbecoming of a mourning child.
No, it would just be a show of pride.

[also_mourning_relative.GetBestName], is also in mourning. Having just lost a close  relative, I can understand [also_mourning_relative.GetHerHis] pain. Perhaps I should approach [also_mourning_relative.GetHerHim] and offer my sympathies? It could be an opportunity to improve our relationship by sharing our grief.

My [GetFromRelation], [From.GetBestName], has just written me a letter consoling me on my recent loss. This could certainly be an opportunity to strengthen our relationship, but at the same time [From.GetSheHe] is remarkably forward and [From.GetHerHis] letter could be represented as an attempt to rub salt into my wounds.
I will rebuff [From.GetHerHis] attempts at commiseration.
I have received a positive response from [From.GetBestName]. It seems that my sympathies were received and appreciated.
As a fellow mourner, [From.GetSheHe] knows my pain.

I have received a strongly worded response from [From.GetBestName], informing me that [From.GetSheHe] has no wish to speak with me. [From.GetSheHeCap] tells me in no uncertain terms to mind my own business and leave [From.GetHerHim] to [From.GetHerHis] grief.

In recent days, I have found myself more and more paralysed by the thought of death. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me that no one is immortal, and it seems that fear of my own death has finally caught up with me.
Anyone could be plotting to kill me!
I must accept this looming inevitability.
I will face my fears head-on.

In recent days, I have found myself thinking about death. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me that no one has unlimited time, and I must strive to accomplish something soon before my death if I wish to be remembered.
I will redouble my efforts and strive for excellence.
My legacy will speak for itself.
Perhaps it is time to think about curbing my ambition.

In recent days, I have found myself becoming more friendly towards others. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me that we are all merely residing temporarily in this world, and perhaps I should be kinder to my fellow lodgers.
I could help others with my wealth.
I should set aside more time for those around me.
Kindness is a weakness within myself that I must root out.

In recent days, I have found myself humbled by the enormity of death. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me that status in this world means nothing before mortality, and in the end our fates are subject to greater powers than our own.
I shall devote myself to the higher powers.
I must rule justly to be treated justly in turn.
Or maybe I am the highest power there is?

In recent days, I have found myself doubting the benevolence of the world more and more. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me of the cruelty of the world. In this unkind world, I must decide how to adapt.
There is truly no such thing as justice.
I cannot be wrong if there is no right and wrong.
It does not make sense, but I must accept it.

In recent days, I have found myself growing even more distant from those around me. The death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] has reminded me of the pain of loss, and I do not wish to subject myself to that ever again.
I must harden my heart and turn away from kindness.

I am not coping well with the death of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName]. While I tried to hold myself together at first, I found myself growing ever more irritable, snapping at everyone around me. I just couldn't cope with all of it-

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] great virility and eagerness for sexual activity. Although some would say that such inclinations are not to be praised, Confucius does say that the filial son should not deviate from his father's ways...
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] voracious appetite and love of fine foods. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] great love for money, in particular [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] great love for hoarding money and never spending it. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for caring little for the burdens of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] position, ignoring [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] obligations in favour of a carefree life. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for being fast to anger and not letting anyone cross [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] without consequences. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] strong envy towards anyone doing better than [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim]. While scholars condemn [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] for envy, surely wishing to be better than others is a good thing that I should emulate?
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] pride in [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] accomplishments, often showing off and bragging to others. I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] distaste for carnal activities. Confucius says that the filial son does not deviate from his father's ways, and scholars agree that I should certainly seek to emulate the chastity of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] frugal tastes and moderation in food. I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] great generosity, having spent much of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] own money helping people around [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim]. Perhaps this is an aspect of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] behaviour that I should seek to emulate.

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] diligence. Scholars speak fondly of the effort [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] put into [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] official duties, and many are subtly hinting to me that perhaps this is something I should try and emulate.

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] patience towards everyone around [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim]. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for showing kindness towards everyone around [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim]. It is said that [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] remained amicable even towards [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] enemies, which is certainly something I can try to emulate.

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for remaining quiet and humble throughout [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] life, never showing off [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] accomplishments. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] unceasing ambition. It is said that [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] would stop at nothing to get ahead, and that ambition is certainly an admirable thing for me to emulate.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for having no regard for the law and making decisions as [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] saw fit. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for never letting fear rule [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] decisions. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHisCap] courage is certainly something of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHersHis] that would be beneficial for me to emulate.

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for accepting [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] place in life, never rising above [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] station or striving for more. Perhaps this is something I should consider emulating.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for cautiously avoiding any potential danger to [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim], to the point where some accuse [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] of cowardice. Nonetheless, such caution might be a good thing to emulate if I want to live to a ripe old age.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for never forgiving anyone who wronged [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] in any way and taking delight in the sorrows of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] enemies. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] lack of faith and spirituality, and for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] tendency to question religious authorities. Perhaps I should emulate [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] behaviour and free myself of the confines of faith.

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for being clever and manipulative. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHeCap] was easily able to trick people into doing things that benefitted [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim]. Perhaps this is a skill which would be useful for me to emulate?

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for always speaking the truth and being direct and upfront about things. While not everyone is a fan of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] honesty, the scholars certainly praise him for it, and perhaps it is something I should emulate.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] strong sense of justice, always following every aspect of the law and advocating for fairness and equality. It is a quality of [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHersHis] that has won [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] praise from many, and it is something that would be good for me to emulate.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for being careful around anyone [ancestor_to_mourn.GetSheHe] did not trust, which was a truly extensive list of people. While treating others with suspicion is generally frowned upon, it does make one safer, so perhaps this is something I should emulate?
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for avoiding contact with others as much as possible and secluding [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerselfHimself]. [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for never changing [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] mind, firmly sticking to [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] convictions no matter what stands in [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] way. I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for being trusting of other people and believing that everyone has the best of intentions. While some may call [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] gullible, it is undeniable that [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] simple approach to others has made [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHim] happier. Maybe I can emulate this?
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].

[ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName] was known for being devoted to [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] faith and ferocious in [ancestor_to_mourn.GetHerHis] defense of it. Such zeal is something that would certainly be good for me to emulate, though it may strain the religious peace around me.
I will strive to be more like [ancestor_to_mourn.GetBestName].
All faiths must be respected equally.

The traditions of mourning dictate that I should not engage in carnal activities during the duration of mourning. While this prohibition is only loosely adhered to by most people, I could certainly go one step further and restrict myself from pleasures of the flesh for the full period of mourning, though it may not be easy for me to do.
I will commit myself to celibacy for the full duration.

A war has been declared against my realm. Although the full duration of mourning is not yet over, the defense of my people and land is more important. I cannot allow grief to hinder me, and unfortunately my mourning is at a premature end.
My ancestors smile upon me. Can you say the same?

You have read about the Chinese way of warfare and have gained some familiarity with it. However, you now need to focus on one aspect to improve. Which way will you follow?

Despite travelling far and wide, your agents have had no luck finding someone willing to sell you a Chinese artifact. You will have to find a craftsman willing to create one instead, most likely, unless you have better luck on a second attempt.

Your agents report that they have found a strange man possessing a painting of a mighty steed with unusual hoofs, which almost seem to sparkle. While the man's sanity is questionable, the painting is obviously in the [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] style and could be yours for a small sum.

The son of a deceased [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] official has been found by your agents, possessing a small figurine of a former ruler of the Middle Kingdom. Having fallen on hard times, the man is willing to part with the figurine for a small amount of money.

By pure chance, one of your agents stumbled upon a merchant possessing a book about the recent history of the Middle Kingdom. Hearing that an illustrious [Root.GetManWoman] was interested in buying the book, the merchant offered to sell the book at a discount.

A young woman, supposedly the last surviving member of a long line of officers, has been found by your agents. She possesses a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Arm Protector inherited from her father that she is willing to part with in exchange for some gold.

Your agents have found a minor nobleman deep in debt who posesses a Serpent Spear that he would be willing to part with in exchange for a modest amount of gold so that he can pay off some of the debt.

A female merchant of some renown has learned of your search for Chinese artifacts and has approached your agents with an offer to sell them a Tapestry Depicting Trade, no doubt hoping that it will be the first of many things she sells you.

One of your agents has discovered a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] official with a talent for painting who apparently is willing to part with a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Artwork for an unusually low price. If you want to buy the artwork, you need to do it now, though, since someone else might buy it otherwise.

When passing through the marketplace on an unrelated errand, one of your agents stumbled upon a calligraphist with some impressive [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Calligraphy. The woman in question, though skilled when it comes to calligraphy, seems to have a bad idea of what it is worth, and your agent got a good offer.
Your agents have found a merchant possessing a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Sculpture that he apparently is eager to sell, and they have received an exceptionally good offer from him.

One of your agents, whose search took her far from your court, has returned, bringing word that she has encountered a mercenary captain in possession of a Silk Shroud that supposedly once belonged to a past empress of China. Your agent has managed to secure an offer to sell the artifact to you for a favorable price, should you want it.

You had almost given up hope when one of your agents brings an envoy from a minor noblewoman living far from the heart of the Middle Kingdom. The envoy brings with her a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Tapestry that her mistress apparently is willing to part with for a small sum
An agent of yours has heard that a mid-ranked [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] officer has a Ji that he is in a hurry to sell, and your agent has received a very generous offer to buy it.
A [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] craftsman has contacted one of your agents, offering to sell you a Zhuge Crossbow for a much lower price than most craftsmen would be willing to offer you.

Your agents have learned that another noble who also has been hunting for Chinese artifacts has come into possession of two [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Bronze Sculptures, which is one more than he needs. He has made your agents a generous offer to sell one of them.

A famous tailor has learned of your search for Chinese artifacts and is offering to create some Ceremonial Robes for you at a discount, doubtlessly hoping that this will lead to more business for him in the future.

When visiting a city that recently suffered from an epidemic, your agents encountered a physician of some fame who offered to sell them a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Compendium of Medicine for a surprisingly small amount of money.

A scribe who helped with the legal work following a minor dispute between two noble families has been in contact with your agents, offering to sell them a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Treatise on Law for a much lower amount of gold than expected.

One of your agents came across a merchant possessing a [Root.GetAppropriateChinaAdj] Chronicle of Economic Principle just as the woman was about to leave your capital. She has offered to sell the book at a discount, but as she is in a hurry to leave you need to respond quickly.

Despite having several agents searching for Chinese artifacts, it is one of your bodyguards who brings you the news that there is a trader at the marketplace who is willing to part with a Water Clock for a surprisingly small amount of money.
A well-known swordsman has approached one of your agents with an offer to sell them a Jian that he no longer needs. Despite the quality of the blade, the man's price is very low.
By pure chance, a messenger in your service came across a minor nobleman in possession of a Dragon Amulet that he appears eager to get rid of. The offer your man was given is quite generous.

During a visit to the marketplace you come across a merchant in possession of various trinkets of varied origin. One of those trinkets is a Jade Dragon that the merchant apparently has no idea what it is worth, since he offers to sell it for a very small sum.

Sun Tzu wrote the Art of War over a millenia ago, but its wisdom is still valid and your agents have come across an old strategist who is prepared to part with his copy of the book for a modest amount of gold.
One of your agents has come across a scholar willing to part with his copy of The Classics of Poetry for a very small amount of money for unknown reasons.

column3: A sculpture from the courts of the Middle Kingdom, you can imagine the possessor of the Dragon Throne walking past the sculpture approvingly and commanding one be made for their own use.
column4: Une sculpture de la Cour de l'[offmap_china.GetFullGenericName]. Vous pouvez imaginer l'[offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitle] [offmap_china.Ruler.GetLuiElle]-même passant à côté de la sculpture avec un air approbateur et ordonnant d'en concevoir une pour son usage personnel.
column5: Eine Skulptur aus dem Hofe vom [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName]. Ihr stellt Euch vor, dass [offmap_china.Ruler.Getderdie] [offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitle] [offmap_china.Ruler.GetHerselfHimself] selbst an der Skulptur zustimmend vorbeigeht und eine eigene für sich selbst in Auftrag gibt.
column7: Una escultura de la corte del [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName]. Te imaginas al/a la [offmap_china.Ruler.GetTitle] pasando por delante de la escultura, aprobándola y encargando otra para sí.

column2: A well-known physician, [new_chinese_doctor.GetFullName], is offering you [new_chinese_doctor.GetHerHis] skills in exchange for a small monetary payment. Do you wish to employ [new_chinese_doctor.GetHerHim]?

Word has reached you that [From.GetTitledName] is currently travelling through [Root.Capital.GetName]. Supposedly, [From.GetSheHe] is on [From.GetHerHis] way to China to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. Without doubt, [From.GetSheHe] would enjoy your hospitality, should you wish to extend it.
Ask them to come... to their death!

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. [FromFrom.GetTitledName] drinks deeply, and the meal progresses for a while without incident. However, just as you start to suspect that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] must have taken an antidote, they suddenly start coughing and clearly have trouble breathing.\n'You will not get away with this!' they manage to say before expiring.\nSmiling, you wave a servant over to your side as the body of [FromFrom.GetTitledName] is being dragged away.

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. [FromFrom.GetTitledName] drinks deeply, then lets out a sigh.\n'You know, in the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName], wine tastes a bit differently than this, most of the time,' they say, meeting your eyes and smiling ever so slightly. 'We also tend to see it as a breach of hospitality if a host tries to poison their guests.'\nEvidently, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has taken an antidote to the poison you used beforehand, and as they reach for their sword you realize that things might be getting out of hand very rapidly.

As dinner is brought to the table, your servants bring out a goblet filled with the 'special' wine you asked them to fetch for [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and place it in front of them. However, to your surprise, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] has brought some wine of their own and seems perfectly content to drink from it instead of the poisoned goblet in front of them.\n'I hope you do not mind,' they say, drinking deeply, 'but I have always preferred the wine from home.'\nYou cannot tell if they suspect that you attempted to poison them or if they just got lucky, but it would seem that the plan is doomed to failure.
I think I will celebrate... with beer!
Are you sure you don't want to try my wine?

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is surprisingly good, you gracefully accept [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. As you take the first sip, you notice a strance, almost unnoticeable taste of something unknown. You put it out of your mind and keep drinking, and the meal progresses.\nHowever, by the time the dinner is nearing its end, you start to cough, and as you look over at [From.GetTitledName] you can see them smiling.

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is surprisingly good, you gracefully accept [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. As you take the first sip, you notice the slight, but unmistakable, taste of poison. Safe in the knowledge that you took an antidote before the meal, you drink deeply and consider your options.\nYou could try to kill [From.GetTitledName], even though their guards probably will aid them, or you could try to run away.

As evening arrives, [From.GetTitledName]'s servants have prepared a magnificient meal for you and [From.GetTitledName] to share.\nAs you previously have noticed that the wine you have found in foreign lands is less to your liking than that from home, you gracefully decline [From.GetTitledName]'s offer of a goblet of what supposedly is 'the finest wine in all the world'. For some reason, this seems to be making [From.GetTitledName] somewhat more unhappy than would be expected, but aside from repeatedly asking you if you want to try the wine nothing comes from your refusal.
I don't need it, thank you!

Just before dinner is about to begin, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] excuses themselves to head to the privy. You patiently await their return, but eventually it seems clear that they are going to be missing for a while, so you and the others present start eating.\nThe meal tastes differently from what you would expect. At first, you think that the servants have been trying something new with the spices. Then, as you start feeling unwell, you wonder if perhaps the ingredients have spoiled. However, none of the others present seem to be noticing anything unusual.\nAs pain erupts in your stomach and [FromFrom.GetTitledName] still is nowhere to be seen, you realize that you have been poisoned.

As your servants arrive with dinner, [FromFrom.GetTitledName] rises from the table in a hurry, almost knocking over their goblet. 'I need to visit the privy,' they hurriedly explain, rushing towards the doors.\nAs you are quite hungry already, you start your meal, but as soon as you swallow it you feel pain rapidly spreading throughout your entire body. Looking over towards [FromFrom.GetTitledName], you see them trying to push past the captain of your bodyguard, and you suddenly understand that you have been poisoned.\nBefore everything goes black, you have the satisfaction of seeing [FromFrom.GetTitledName] get cut down by your bodyguards, along with the servants and guards they had brought with them.

Shortly before dinner is about to begin, the commander of your bodyguard requests a meeting in private. As you trust him fully, you grant the request, and his men drag in a corpse dressed in the livery of the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\n'We caught this man trying to poison your meal, my [Root.GetLordLady],' one of your bodyguards tell you when you inquire about the corpse. 'It seems clear that [FromFrom.GetTitledName] intended to betray your hospitality. What are your orders?'
At least they did not survive either!
Wipe them out! All of them!

You and [From.GetTitledName] quickly discover that you have a lot in common, and you stay up long into the night conversing on a variety of topics. By the time they depart, it is clear that this is a friendship that will last for some time.

The meal you and [From.GetTitledName] share is better than the company, you soon realize, and though you do what you can to be a gracious host you almost feel like letting out a sigh in relief as [From.GetTitledName]'s party departs the next morning.

[From.GetTitledName] suddenly turns around and cuts down one of your guards, sprinting away from the table as their guards and servants quickly arm themselves to fight your remaining guards as they close in. You shout for your men to make sure [From.GetTitledName] cannot reach their horse, but in the confusion it is not clear if you are heard.\nAs the fighting dies down, several of your guards and servants are dead, as well as the guards and servants left behind by [From.GetTitledName], and you are informed by your remaining guards that [From.GetTitledName] and a small party have managed to escape. Even worse, they set your horses loose as well, and it is clear that any pursuit is doomed to failure.

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to avoid [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards without any danger and make your way to your horse alongside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. With no time to waste, you ride off, having your guards set [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s horses free as you escape in the hopes of slowing down any pursuit.

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to fight your way past [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards, wounded but alive, and make your way to your horse alongside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. With no time to waste, you ride off, having your guards set [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s horses free as you escape in the hopes of slowing down any pursuit.
At least I got away unharmed!

[From.GetTitledName] suddenly turns around and cuts down one of your guards, sprinting away from the table as their guards and servants quickly arm themselves to fight your remaining guards as they close in. You shout for your men to make sure [From.GetTitledName] cannot reach their horse, but in the confusion it is not clear if you are heard.\nAs the fighting dies down, several of your guards and servants are dead, as well as the guards and servants left behind by [From.GetTitledName], but some of your remaining guards bring in [From.GetTitledName]'s corpse with an arrow sticking out of it. Despite things not going quite as planned, it would seem you have successfully killed [From.GetTitledName].
That went well, in the end!

You quickly spin around and cut down one of the guards before [FromFrom.GetTitledName] can react, running from the table as you hear the guards and servants you left behind draw their weapons to fight [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards.\nIn the confusion, you manage to avoid [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards without any danger and hurriedly move towards your horse longside a small party of your guards and servants that also have escaped from the fighting. Just as you are about to mount up, an arrow comes flying out of the dark, striking you in the chest, and the last thing you see before everything goes dark is more arrows striking the rest of your party.

You expect [From.GetTitledName] to try to cut their way to their horse, but it becomes clear that that is not what they have in mind as they move towards you. You quickly pull free your own sword and call out for your guards as [From.GetTitledName]'s guards and servants also rise to their feet with weapons drawn.\nEven though you should have the advantage due to sheer numbers, the fight turns against you, and [From.GetTitledName] manages to disarm you. Before you can get another weapon into your hand, they thrust their sword into your throat, and your vision starts to fade even before they turn around to escape.

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] clearly was expecting you to try to run away, as they almost don't have the time to pull free their sword before you are upon them. As your blades meet, you are vaguely aware that your guards and servants are doing what they can to fight off [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards that have arrived.\n[FromFrom.GetTitledName] should have the advantage due to the sheer number of guards they have nearby, but the fight still turns in your favor, and you disarm [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and quickly strike them down before they can grab another weapon. Taking in the situation around you, it is clear that you will be able to escape.

You expect [From.GetTitledName] to try to cut their way to their horse, but it becomes clear that that is not what they have in mind as they move towards you. You quickly pull free your own sword and call out for your guards as [From.GetTitledName]'s guards and servants also rise to their feet with weapons drawn.\nYou have the advantage due to sheer numbers, and the fight turns against [From.GetTitledName] and their guards. You disarm them before long, and before they can react you thrust your sword into their throat as your guards continue to cut down the rest of [From.GetTitledName]'s party.
Make sure they are truly dead!

[FromFrom.GetTitledName] clearly was expecting you to try to run away, as they almost don't have the time to pull free their sword before you are upon them. As your blades meet, you are vaguely aware that your guards and servants are doing what they can to fight off [FromFrom.GetTitledName]'s guards that have arrived.\n[FromFrom.GetTitledName] has the advantage due to the sheer number of guards they have nearby, and the fight quickly turns against you and your beleagued party. Before long, you are disarmed, and [FromFrom.GetTitledName], and they quickly strikes you down before you can grab another weapon.

The rider you sent to invite [From.GetTitledName] returns before long, informing you that [From.GetTitledName] and their party will not be joining you for dinner as they wish to travel quickly to reach their destination as soon as possible.

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. As you do not like them, meeting them in person is obviously out of the question, and perhaps this is an opportunity for retribution...

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. However, even for a barbarian they have been unusually disruptive at court, and perhaps they should not be allowed into your presence.

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. While they are not fitting in as well as some might like, they are not being as disruptive as some barbarians have been in the past.

[From.GetTitledName] has arrived at your court, supposedly to kowtow before the Dragon Throne. Even though they are a barbarian, they are behaving almost as well as if they have been raised in the Middle Kingdom, and your ministers are most impressed.
Let them kowtow before a depiction of me!
They can kowtow before me, but quickly!
They can kowtow before me, as I am impressed!
Have them escorted to the dungeon!

As you wait for the ministers at [From.GetTitledName]'s court to arrange for you to kowtow before the Dragon Throne, a number of guards come rushing in and surround your party. Before long, you are all escorted down to the dungeons to await your fate.
[From.GetTitledName] has agreed to your request to turn over [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], and they have been imprisoned to await punushment.
[From.GetTitledName] has refused your request to turn over [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName]. Evidently, they do not respect the Dragon Throne.
[From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], an escaped convict, has apparently showed up in [From.GetTitledName]'s court, and [From.GetPrimaryChina] has agreed to hand them over.
Dispatch some soldiers to arrest them!

You have learned that [From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName] somehow managed to escape from [From.GetTitledName]'s court before your soldiers arrived. Clearly, [From.GetTitledName] cannot be trusted not to waste your time.

It is only proper that foreign barbarians treat the envoys of the [Root.GetPrimaryChina] Empire respectfully. Do you want to send an envoy to [chinese_envoy_target.GetTitledName] to see if they respect the Dragon Throne?

It would seem [From.GetTitledName] does not respect the Middle Kingdom. [From.GetSheHeCap] went so far as to refuse to see your envoy, which is a major sign of disrespect towards the Dragon Throne itself.

While [From.GetSheHe] still is a foreign barbarian, [From.GetTitledName] has shown your envoys great respect during their visit to [From.GetHerHis] court, and by extension [From.GetSheHe] clearly respects the Dragon Throne.

While [From.GetTitledName] welcomed your envoys, [From.GetSheHe] still is a foreign barbarian, and [From.GetHerHis] respect towards your envoys was lacking. By extension, [From.GetTitledName] disrespects the Dragon Throne itself

That barbarians from faraway lands want to trade with the Middle Kingdom is well known. However, though most of them deserve no special treatment, occassionally one of them are worthy of better treatment. Should we let some of them compete for this right?

[From.GetTitledName] has had a new city constructed along the Silk Road to prove that they are worthy of more favorable trade deals with the Middle Kingdom. It is undeniable that they have done well, and we should reward them accordingly.
Let them know that I am pleased!

Despite the honor of being allowed to prove themselves worthy of being granted favorable trade deals with the Middle Kingdom, none of the barbarians given this honor have lived up to expectations, and it is clear they should not be granted any rewards.
Let them know I am displeased!

[From.escaped_chinese_noble.GetName], an escaped convict, has apparently showed up in [From.GetTitledName]'s court, and [From.GetTitledName] has not seen fit to inform you of this, unlike what might be expected.
Demand that they had the convict over!
The [From.GetTitle] of the [From.GetPrimaryChina] addresses a letter to the [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitle] of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
column3: Le [From.GetTitle] de l'[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] adresse une lettre [Root.Get_au_Title][Root.GetTitle] [Root.PrimaryTitle.Get_du_RealmFull][Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
column4: [From.GetDerDie] [From.GetTitle] des [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective]e[From.Offmap.Ruler.GetnMale] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle][From.Offmap.Ruler.GetsMale] adressiert einen Brief an [Root.Getdendie] [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective]e[Root.GetnMale] [Root.GetTitle] von [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]
column6: El [From.GetTitle] del [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [From.Offmap.Ruler.GetTitle] dirige una carta al [Root.GetChineseComplimentAdjective] [Root.GetTitle] del [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]

column2: It is no longer possible for you to complete your quest to kowtow before the Dragon Throne.

Desired by many for its intrinsic value and the beautiful design which displays the height of the [Root.GetBestChineseArtifactName] Empire, this intricately designed dragon made out of jade by a master [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] craftsman is a very unique treasure.
column3: Nombreux sont ceux qui le veulent pour sa valeur intrinsèque et son esthétique affichant la grandeur de [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName], ce dragon finement sculpté fait en jade par un maître-artisan [From.OriginalOwner.GetCultureMasc] est un trésor unique.
column4: Von vielen für seinen inneren Wert und das schöne Design geschätzt, wurde dieser kompliziert entworfene Drache aus Jade von einem meisterhaften [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName]en Handwerker geschaffen und ist ein sehr einzigartiger Schatz.
column6: Deseado por muchos por su valor intrínseco y el hermoso diseño que muestra la altura del [offmap_china.GetFullGenericName], este dragón intricadamente diseñado de jade por un maestro artesano [From.OriginalOwner.Culture.GetName] es un tesoro único.

column2: While it is obvious to us that we hold the Mandate of Heaven, we have to take certain steps to ensure that the world is of the same opinion.
As the ruler of the Middle Kingdom, we can decide to move its administrative centre to another suitable location.
